Description: SANTA MONICA BAY RESTORATION FOUNDATION WILL PARTNER WITH ENVIRONMENTAL CHARTER SCHOOLS (ECS) TO INSTALL GARDEN BEDS IN PARKWAYS SURROUNDING ECS CAMPUSES IN SOUTH LOS ANGELES (LA) AND INTEGRATE THE PROJECT INTO THE SCHOOL CURRICULUM. THE PROJECT WILL EDUCATE SOUTH LA STUDENTS AND COMMUNITIES ON FOOD PRODUCTION, AIR POLLUTION ALONG TRANSPORTATION CORRIDORS, GARDENING, AND CARBON SEQUESTRATION. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FRESH PRODUCE IN A FOOD DESERT WHILE UTILIZING THE LITTLE GREEN SPACE AVAILABLE IN SOUTH LA.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/01/2019.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP AND INTEGRATE CURRICULUM FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO EXPLORE LOCAL EJ ISSUES, UNDERSTAND COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPACTS, AND ENGAGE LOCAL RESIDENTS AND LEADERS IN DEVELOPING SOLUTIONS TO PROTECT HEALTH. THE PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE A PREVIOUS AIR QUALITY PROJECT TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY ACROSS SAN LEANDRO; ASSESS LOCAL SURFACE WATER QUALITY AND DEVELOP POLLUTION PREVENTION STRATEGIES; ASSESS CHEMICAL EXPOSURE AND AIR QUALITY AT HOME, AND DEVELOP EXPOSURE REDUCTION STRATEGIES.   THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.  PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO OCTOBER 1, 2019.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE PICO UNION ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ENTERPRISE (PUEDE) CENTER'S GREEN ALLEYS PROJECT (GAP), WILL REPURPOSE GARBAGE-FILLED ALLEYS INTO VIBRANT, OUTDOOR SPACES THROUGH GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE. THE CENTER WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS OBJECTIVE THROUGH AN INTEGRATED STRATEGY OF 1) HOSTING MULTI-LINGUAL WORKSHOPS AND DISTRIBUTING INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS TO BOOST AWARENESS OF THE LINK BETWEEN ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH, 2) EDUCATING THE PUBLIC OF APPROPRIATE WASTE DISPOSAL METHODS, 3) RESURFACING PAVEMENTS WITH PERVIOUS MATERIAL TO IMPROVE STORMWATER MANAGEMENT, 4) PROVIDING TRAINING IN HOW TO CONSTRUCT, GROW AND MAINTAIN VERTICAL TRELLIS GARDENS CONSISTING OF DROUGHT RESISTANT, POLLUTION ABSORBING PLANTS, AND 5) CREATING MURALS ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC HEALTH.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,314.

COMMUNITY SERVICES AND EMPLOYMENT TRAINING (CSET) WILL WORK WITH VARIOUS PARTNERS IN ALLENSWORTH TO ENGAGE YOUTH IN TESTING TECHNOLOGY FOR TREATMENT OF ARSENIC IN DRINKING WATER. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON A 2019 FIELD TRIAL OF ELECTROCHEMICAL ARSENIC REMEDIATION (ECAR) TECHNOLOGY, A LOW-COST APPROACH TO TREATING DRINKING WATER THAT CONTAINS ARSENIC. STUDENTS WILL OPERATE THE ECAR SYSTEM, TEST SOIL SAMPLES WHERE ECAR-TREATED WATER WILL BE APPLIED, AND PARTICIPATE IN FIELD TRIPS TO LEARN ABOUT THE REGION'S WATER ISSUES.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/1/2019.

GROUNDWORK SAN DIEGO-CHOLLAS CREEK WILL ENGAGE LOW-INCOME YOUTH IN THE ENCANTO COMMUNITY LOCATED IN SOUTHEAST SAN DIEGO TO UNDERSTAND AND IMPROVE RESIDENTIAL INDOOR AIR QUALITY. GROUNDWORK WILL PARTNER WITH THE MILLENNIAL TECH MIDDLE SCHOOL TO INTEGRATE AIR QUALITY INTO THE SCHOOL'S SCIENCE CURRICULUM AND THEN ENLIST 20 STUDENTS AS HEALTHY HOME AMBASSADORS TO DO OUTREACH ON INDOOR AIR QUALITY TO FELLOW STUDENTS, FAMILIES AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE. THE PROJECT WILL EDUCATE AND EMPOWER THE ENCANTO COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY FOR THEMSELVES AND OTHERS.   THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE RISKS DOMESTIC WORKERS FACE IN THE DAILY USE OF HOUSEHOLD CLEANING AND AIR FRESHENING PRODUCTS RELATED TO THE TOXICITY OF THESE PRODUCTS, AND THEIR SECONDARY NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT. THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON EDUCATING DOMESTIC WORKERS, IDENTIFYING OPPORTUNITIES FOR REDUCING RISKS THROUGH PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES AND SUBSTITUTION OF LESS TOXIC CLEANING SUBSTANCES.  PROJECT INCLUDES TRAINING SOCIAL SERVICE PROVIDERS AND PEER OUTREACH WORKERS, AND DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL TOOLS AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING OF $30,000.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 04/01/2022.


THE HOPI AND NAVAJO NATIONS IN ARIZONA ARE TWO INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES WHO HAVE BEEN IMPACTED BY ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES INCLUDING EXPOSURE TO PARTICULATE MATTER AIR POLLUTION. THOUSANDS OF TRIBAL MEMBERS LACK ELECTRICITY AND REFRIGERATION, WHICH REQUIRES FAMILIES TO TRAVEL LONG DISTANCES TO SHOP FOR FOOD. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RESEARCH AND UNDERSTAND THE TRANSPORTATION HABITS OF TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO LIVE IN RURAL AREAS WITH NO ELECTRICITY OR FOOD STORAGE AND TO EXPLORE HOW FOOD STORAGE CAN REDUCE TRAVEL AND RELATED TRANSPORTATION EMISSIONS. NATIVE RENEWABLES INC. WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION ON THE INTERSECTION OF FOOD, ENERGY, TRANSPORTATION, AND EMISSIONS TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY. TEN FAMILIES WILL BE PROVIDED WITH HOME SOLAR-POWERED COLD FOOD STORAGE EQUIPMENT AND WILL ASSIST WITH DATA GATHERING FOR THE RESEARCH COMPONENTS OF THIS PROJECT. THE PROJECT AIMS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: IMPROVE COMMUNITY MEMBERS' AND TRIBAL LEADERS' AWARENESS OF RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, ENERGY, AND EMISSIONS; INCREASE SOLAR KNOWLEDGE IN INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES; INCREASE ENGAGEMENT BETWEEN TRIBAL LEADERS AND COMMUNITIES ON TRANSPORTATION, ENERGY, AND FOOD ISSUES; CHANGE TRAVEL BEHAVIORS; REDUCE AIR EMISSIONS FROM TRIPS TAKEN FOR FOOD SUPPLIES.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DELIVERING SOLAR-POWERED COLD FOOD STORAGE EQUIPMENT TO 10 INDIGENOUS FAMILIES, CREATION OF TOOLS TO FACILITATE DATA GATHERING BY FAMILIES, COLLECTION OF DATA RELATED TO ENERGY CONSUMPTION AND TRAVEL FOR FOOD, CREATION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ON SOLAR ENERGY BENEFITS, ENGAGEMENT WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS TO INFORM ABOUT PROJECT DETAILS AND SOLAR ENERGY BENEFITS, HOST EDUCATIONAL WEBINARS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS RELATED TO TRAVEL, ENERGY CONSUMPTION, ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS, AND CALCULATING EMISSIONS; AND PREPARATION OF A FINAL PROJECT REPORT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:AS A RESULT OF THE PROJECT, NRI WILL GENERATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND TRIBAL LEADERS, GATHER DATA ABOUT THE IMPACTS OF SOLAR REFRIGERATION EQUIPMENT ON TRAVEL HABITS AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION; AND GENERATE A FINAL REPORT SUMMARIZING THE PROJECT'S FINDINGS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE HOP AND NAVAJO NATIONS. THE PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY MEMBERS' AND TRIBAL LEADERS' AWARENESS OF RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, ENERGY, AND EMISSIONS, INCREASE SOLAR KNOWLEDGE IN INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES, INCREASE ENGAGEMENT BETWEEN TRIBAL LEADERS AND COMMUNITIES ON TRANSPORTATION, ENERGY, AND FOOD ISSUES, CHANGE TRAVEL BEHAVIORS, AND REDUCE AIR EMISSIONS FROM TRIPS TAKEN FOR FOOD SUPPLIES. ADDITIONALLY, PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY REDUCING COMMUNITY MEMBERS' EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION, NATIVE RENEWABLES' EFFORTS ARE EXPECTED TO REDUCE THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 04/01/2022.



WEST OAKLAND RANKS IN THE 90TH PERCENTILE FOR CALIFORNIA COMMUNITIES OF COLOR EXPOSED TO BLACK CARBON AND TRANSPORTATION EMISSIONS. RESIDENTS ARE SURROUNDED ON ALL SIDES BY FREEWAYS AND SPRAWLING FREIGHT AND LOGISTICS OPERATIONS FROM THE NEARBY PORT OF OAKLAND. TO ADDRESS THE AIR POLLUTION, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND CLIMATE CRISES IN THE REGION, THE WEST OAKLAND SUSTAINABLE PORT COLLABORATIVE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A FORUM FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO WORK TOGETHER WITH A DIVERSE GROUP OF PARTNERS IN ACADEMIA, LABOR, BUSINESS, INDUSTRY, AND LOCAL AND STATE AGENCIES TO ACCELERATE THE PORT OF OAKLAND'S TRANSITION TO ZERO-EMISSIONS. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EDUCATING PORT DECISIONMAKERS ON THE FEASIBILITY OF ZERO-EMISSIONS TECHNOLOGY, IDENTIFYING BARRIERS TO ELIMINATING SPECIFIC EMISSIONS SOURCES, AND EMPOWERING RESIDENTS TO PUSH THE PORT TO MAKE SPECIFIC ZERO-EMISSIONS COMMITMENTS. THE GOAL IS TO SHIFT THE DIRECTION OF THE PORT'S MARITIME STRATEGIC PLAN FROM CONTINUOUS GROWTH TO SUSTAINABLE, EMISSION-FREE COMMERCE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WEST OAKLAND SUSTAINABLE PORT COLLABORATIVE WILL LEAD THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MODEL RESOLUTION INCLUDING ZERO-EMISSIONS RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE PORT OF OAKLAND.  ZERO-EMISSIONS RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE RESEARCHED BY MEMBERS OF THE COLLABORATIVE INCLUDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS, LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNER AGENCIES, AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS THAT WOULD BE ACHIEVED VIA ADOPTION OF THE ZERO-EMISSIONS RECOMMENDATIONS BY THE PORT OF OAKLAND WOULD BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH OF THE CITIZENS OF WEST OAKLAND COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP A COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING NETWORK IN PARAMOUNT, CA TO FILL A DATA GAP ON TOXIC HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM (HEX CHROME) POLLUTION AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. RESIDENTS WILL INDEPENDENTLY COLLECT AIR SAMPLES,  REGULATORS TO POLLUTION PEAKS, AND USE THESE DATA TO ADVOCATE FOR FEASIBLE, LONG-TERM PREVENTATIVE ACTION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING HEX CHROME MONITORING DATA AVAILABLE, INCREASING THE NUMBER OF LEADERS AND RESIDENTS RECEIVING UPDATES AND MONITORING INFORMATION, AND INCREASING THE NUMBER OF STAKEHOLDERS PARTICIPATING IN EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES IN PARAMOUNT, SUCH AS LONG-TERM MONITORING AND REGULATION OF POLLUTING INDUSTRIES. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 

 THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK 2/1/2022. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS.
ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITY 1: ACQUIRE HEX CHROME SAMPLING EQUIPMENT AND PLAN LOGISTICS OF SAMPLING METHOD, TIME FRAME, AND SETUP. 
ACTIVITY 2: COLLECT AMBIENT AIR DATA
ACTIVITY 3: REVIEW, AGGREGATE, TRANSLATE, AND DISSEMINATE AIR SAMPLING DATA TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT.
ACTIVITY 4: DEVELOP A STRATEGY TO ADVOCATE FOR PERMANENT REGULATORY MONITORING PRESENCE.
OUTCOMES:
AS DESCRIBED IN THE WORK PLAN, RECIPIENT WILL MONITOR AIR QUALITY NEAR SUSPECTED SOURCES OF HEXAVALENT CHROMIUM AIR RELEASES, COMPILE RESULTS, AND PARTICIPATE IN CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS/STRATEGY SESSIONS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN AN EFFORT TO CURB INDUSTRIAL POLLUTION IN THE COMMUNITY.  COMMUNITY MEMBERS/RESIDENTS OR PARAMOUNT, CA ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE WATER IS LIFE PROJECT WILL CREATE A MORE AWARE, INFORMED AND WATER RESILIENT ASIAN AMERICAN, NATIVE HAWAIIAN, AND PACIFIC ISLANDER COMMUNITY, ESPECIALLY AMONG IMMIGRANTS AND LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT RESIDENTS, IN THE SAN GABRIEL VALLEY OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY. BY PROVIDING CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE EDUCATION ON TOPICS RELATED TO WATER CAPTURE, CONSERVATION AND CONTAMINATION, THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE AWARENESS OF LOCAL WATER ISSUES AMONG RESIDENTS AND CITY OFFICIALS, ELEVATE COMMUNITY VOICES AND CONCERNS RELATED TO DRINKING WATER SAFETY, AND MOBILIZE COMMUNITY ACTION TO CHANGE WATER USE HABITS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ENGAGE RESIDENTS IN LOCAL WATER RESOURCE CONSERVATION STRATEGIES BY ENCOURAGING STORMWATER CAPTURE PRACTICES, SUCH AS INSTALLATION OF RAIN BARRELS ON RESIDENTIAL SITES, AND COLLABORATING WITH CITY LEADERS AND RESIDENTS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL SITES FOR A MULTI-BENEFIT STORMWATER CAPTURE PROJECT.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 3/1/2022.

ACTIVITIES:
COMPONENT 1: PLAN AND DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS; COMPONENT 2: DISSEMINATE EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS; COMPONENT 3: HOST EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS; COMPONENT 4: PLAN, DEVELOP, AND DISTRIBUTE WRITTEN EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS; COMPONENT 5: CONDUCT OUTREACH;	COMPONENT 6: PURCHASE, DISTRIBUTE, AND INSTALL RAIN BARRELS; COMPONENT 7: COLLECTION LOCATION SUGGESTIONS FOR A MULTI-BENEFIT STORM WATER PROJECT; COMPONENT 8: PRESENT MULTI-BENEFIT STORM WATER PROJECT LOCATIONS TO THE ALHAMBRA CITY COUNCIL.					
				
		

				
					
			

OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING.  FOUR 5-MINUTE VIDEOS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION ON VARIOUS WATER ISSUES IN ENGLISH, SPANISH, MANDARIN AND/OR CANTONESE. BASED ON THE CURRENT REACH AND AUDIENCE OF SSG/APIFM'S SOCIAL MEDIA, NEWSLETTER, AND WEBSITE, IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THE VIDEOS WILL ACHIEVE APPROXIMATELY 19,000 VIEWS.  COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT LOCAL WATER ISSUES AND SYSTEMS AND ENGAGE IN A PUBLIC WATER PROJECT DURING FOUR (4) WORKSHOPS.  IN ADDITION, BY INCLUDING WRITTEN EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ON VARIOUS LOCAL WATER ISSUES INSIDE PRODUCE BAGS, WHICH ARE DISTRIBUTED TO HUNDREDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGHOUT LAC ON A BIWEEKLY BASIS, IT'S ESTIMATED THAT SSG/APIFM WILL REACH 2,400 RESIDENTS.  COMMUNITY WILL GATHER FOR INPUT ON THE PUBLIC MULTI-BENEFIT STORM WATER PROJECT LOCATIONS AND INCREASE AWARENESS AND WATER-RESILIENCE AMONGST AANHPI COMMUNITIES.  TEN (10) RAIN BARRELS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AND INSTALLED AT THE HOMES OF PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS ON A FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE BASIS.  THERE WILL ALSO BE A COLLECTION OF A TOTAL OF TEN (10) SUGGESTED PROJECT LOCATIONS FROM PARTICIPANTS AND WITH THE SUBMISSION OF THREE (3) FINAL PROJECT LOCATIONS TO THE ALHAMBRA CITY COUNCIL.








SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE ROSE FOUNDATION FOR COMMUNITIES AND THE ENVIRONMENT WILL USE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDS TO IMPLEMENT THE NEW VOICES ARE RISING FOR RESILIENCE PROJECT. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE COLLABORATION ACROSS COMMUNITIES TO STRENGTHEN RESILIENCE IN THE FACE OF THE TRIPLE THREATS TO COMMUNITY HEALTH POSED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND TOXIC POLLUTION IN LOW-INCOME BAY AREA COMMUNITIES OF COLOR. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE COMMUNITIES OF BAYVIEW HUNTERS POINT, OAKLAND, RICHMOND/SAN PABLO, AND ANTIOCH/PITTSBURG, WITH A FOCUS ON YOUTH.  CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) SECTION 103(B)(3):  PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO MARCH 1, 2022.
ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND SUPPORTING COLLABORATION AMONG HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO BUILD COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP SKILLS THROUGH PAID FELLOWSHIPS AND INTERNSHIPS; SUPPORTING STUDENTS IN IMPLEMENTING PROJECTS TO ADVANCE FOOD JUSTICE, REDUCE INDOOR EXPOSURE TO WILDFIRE SMOKE, REDUCE COMMUNITY EXPOSURE TO TOXIC POLLUTION, INCREASE ELECTRICITY ACCESS IN EXTREME WEATHER AND WILDFIRE CONDITIONS, OR ADVANCE CREATION OF RESILIENCE HUBS; AND PROMOTING AWARENESS ON VACCINE SAFETY AND AVAILABILITY.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WOULD BE ISSUED TO COMMUNITIES FOR A BETTER ENVIRONMENT AND GREENACTION FOR ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE. SUBAWARD ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUPERVISING AND MENTORING FELLOWS AND INTERNS TO CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS, REDUCED VACCINE HESITANCY, IMPROVED CROSS-COMMUNITY COLLABORATION ON ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES,  IMPROVED AIR QUALITY, INCREASED RESILIENCY TO CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS, AND INCREASED COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN AIR QUALITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE PLANNING.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS GRANT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE PURPOSE FOCUSED ALTERNATIVE LEARNING (PFAL) CORPORATION TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO NAVAJO 'GREEN JOB CAREER DEVELOPMENT' TO PROVIDE SOLAR EDUCATION, TRAINING, NABCEP CERTIFICATION, AND EMPLOYMENT PROJECTS ON THE NAVAJO NATION. PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE DESIGNED TO EMPOWER UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES LIVING IN WESTERN NAVAJO IN THE FORMER 'BENNETT FREEZE' AREA, WITH A FOCUS ON THE BODAWAY GAP (5) COMMUNITIES TO DEVELOP A CERTIFIED GREEN WORKFORCE SPECIALIZING IN SOLAR TECHNOLOGIES. THUS, PROVIDING FOR GREEN-JOB OPPORTUNITIES TO DEPLOY, AND MANAGE OFF-GRID SOLAR FURNACES, AND SOLAR MICROGRID SYSTEMS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 4/1/2022.
ACTIVITIES:
1) RED CLOUD RENEWABLE (RCR) WILL SPONSOR (2) NAVAJO NABCEP CERTIFIED SOLAR TRAIN THE TRAINER TECHNICIANS; WHEREAS, THE GRANT WILL FUND ONE OTHER TO BECOME NABCEP CERTIFIED. 2) PURPOSE FOCUSED ALTERNATIVE LEARNING (PFAL) WILL PURCHASE OFF-GRID SOLAR FURNACES; AND TRAIN (6) NAVAJOS IN SOLAR FURNACE ASSEMBLY, INSTALLATION, AND PRELIMINARY MANUFACTURING. 3) PFAL AND HIDDEN SPRINGS MISSION (HSM) WILL CONDUCT QUARTERLY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EVENTS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS; CONCURRENTLY PFAL WILL CONDUCT JOB/CAREER MENTORING. 4) RCR AGREES TO ASSESS THE CURRENT HSM FACILITIES TO DETERMINE THE BEST USAGE OF THE EXISTING STRUCTURE(S).
OUTCOMES:

PURPOSE FOCUSED ALTERNATIVE LEARNING (PFAL) CORPORATION WILL HAVE A TOTAL OF (3) CERTIFIED NABCEP TRAINERS TO BEGIN THE INITIAL DEVELOPMENT OF A NAVAJO GREEN WORKFORCE CAPABLE OF INSTALLING SOLAR TECHNOLOGIES SLATED FOR BODAWAY GAP OF WESTERN NAVAJO.  PFAL WILL CONTRACT THE (6) TRAINED TECHNICIANS TO DEPLOY (12) SOLAR FURNACE SYSTEMS ACROSS THE BODAWAY GAP. THE REMAINING (4) SYSTEMS WILL BE UTILIZED FOR CONTINUED TRAINING.  AN OUTCOME INCLUDES COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PARTICIPATION THROUGH INCLUSION AND TRANSPARENCY RELATED TO GREEN JOB CREATION AND DEPLOYMENT OF RENEWABLE ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES ON NAVAJO.  IN ADDITION, THERE WILL BE LOCAL CAPACITY BUILDING BY PROVIDING SOLAR TECHNOLOGY TRAINING AT THE HSM FACILITIES LOCATED IN BODAWAY GAP.
SUBRECIPIENT:
PROJECT MANAGER, OUTREACH COORDINATOR, LOGISTICS MANAGER ARE PART OF THE PROJECT TEAM ALONG WITH RED CLOUD RENEWABLES TO TRAIN NAVAJO STUDENTS TO INSTALL OFF GRID SOLAR ASSEMBLY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ASSIST RAIN DC IN CREATING THE CARE RESILIENCE HUB: MAKING HOT SPACES COOL. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON URBAN HEAT INTERVENTIONS IN THE MESA, ARIZONA WATER TOWER IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT, AN UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOOD BATTLING INTENSE HEAT AND GENTRIFICATION DUE TO LARGE-SCALE DEVELOPMENT FROM PROPOSED GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROJECTS FOCUSED ON DESIGNED SHADE REST STOPS PLACED IN HIGH TRAFFIC/LOW SHADE LOCATIONS, A FRONT YARD BEAUTIFICATION PROJECT, THAT WILL PROVIDE SHADE TREES, AND OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT TO HELP EMPOWER THE COMMUNITY TO BUILD CAPACITY. TWO PROGRAMS WILL BE LAUNCHED AT THE RESILIENCE HUB. THE COMMUNITY GUARDIAN PROGRAM WILL TRAIN NEIGHBORS THROUGH A SERIES OF MONTHLY WORKSHOPS TO ADVOCATE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SOLUTIONS. A K-12 SUMMER EMERGENCY PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE 250 YOUTH ON HEAT-HEALTH SAFETY, COOL ROUTES, AND POSITIVE BEHAVIORAL CHOICES, SUCH AS ALWAYS CARRYING REUSABLE WATER BOTTLES.  PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO FEBRUARY 1, 2022. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

ACTIVITIES:
   
THREE ACTIVITIES WILL BE SIMULTANEOUSLY LAUNCHED TO CAPITALIZE SYNERGIES FROM PAST RESEARCH, CURRENTLY FUNDED PROJECTS, AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT PLANS: 1) A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL RESULT IN FOUR COMMUNITY DESIGNED SHADE REST STOPS STRATEGICALLY PLACED IN HIGH TRAFFIC/LOW SHADE AMENITY LOCATIONS, 2) A DEMONSTRATION AND MONITORING PROJECT, A FRONT YARD BEAUTIFICATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SHADE TREES ON PRIVATE PROPERTY, CULMINATING IN DATA-DRIVEN COOL CORRIDORS AND 3) A DEMONSTRATION, MONITORING AND PUBLIC EDUCATION PROJECT, ENGAGING AND EMPOWERING RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE TRANSFORMATION OF CARE PARTNERSHIP, A TRUSTED COMMUNITY CENTER INTO A RESILIENCE HUB, COMMUNITY-DRIVEN RESILIENCE INCUBATOR FOR EMERGENCY SITUATIONS (HEAT WAVES, BLACKOUTS, WILDFIRES), RECOVERY FROM DISASTERS (COVID), AND CAPACITY BUILDING. TWO PROGRAMS WILL BE LAUNCHED AT THE RESILIENCE HUB. THE COMMUNITY GUARDIAN PROGRAM WILL TRAIN NEIGHBORS THROUGH A SERIES OF MONTHLY WORKSHOPS TO ADVOCATE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SOLUTIONS. A K-12 SUMMER EMERGENCY PROGRAM WILL EDUCATE 250 YOUTH ON HEAT-HEALTH SAFETY, COOL ROUTES, AND ENCOURAGE POSITIVE BEHAVIORAL CHOICES, SUCH AS ALWAYS CARRYING REUSABLE WATER BOTTLES. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF CARE RESILIENCE HUB: MAKING HOT SPACES COOL IS TO DEVELOP AND EXECUTE DATA-DRIVEN, COMMUNITY INSPIRED URBAN HEAT SOLUTIONS AND STRENGTHEN SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE NECESSARY TO EMBRACE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE/LANDSCAPE LEVEL IMPROVEMENTS WHILE PRESERVING AN ENDURING PLACE AMID THE CULTURAL FABRIC OF AN EVOLVING COMMUNITY.
OUTCOMES:
THE EXPECTED OUTPUTS FROM THIS PROJECT ARE: 1) PLANS FOR COMMUNITY SHADE SPACES, 2) A GUIDEBOOK/MAP FOR COOLER SPACES, AND 3) A TEACHING CURRICULUM FOR K-12 STUDENTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON HEAT MITIGATION MEASURES, AND TO COOL OFF UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
1) SUBGRANT TO CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOR VENUE FEES FOR WORKSHOPS AND ADVOCACY TRAINING, PROVIDING OFFICE SPACE/WORKSTATION FOR URBAN HEAT FELLOW AND RESILIENCE HUB SPECIALIST, PERMISSION FEES FOR SITING OF REST STOPS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, FOOD FOR ADVOCACY CONVENINGS. 
2) SUBGRANT TO ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY FOR WEATHER STATION INSTALLATION AND MONITORING, ANALYSIS OF PRE/POST SURVEYS, COOL ROUTE OPTIMIZATION ANALYSIS, REST STOP USAGE ANALYSIS.
3) RAIL CDC - ADVOCACY TRAINING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY SPONSORSHIP DEVELOPMENT, EMPLOYER BENEFITS RESPONSIBILITY.
4) STIPEND FOR TWO SEMESTERS ($2,500 EACH) FOR COMMUNITY/DIGITAL ORGANIZERS.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ADDRESS URBAN HEAT ISLAND EFFECTS AT A PUBLIC HOUSING COMPLEX, A PARK, AND THREE SCHOOLS IN HONOLULU BY TRAINING STUDENT SCIENTISTS TO MEASURE AND DEVELOP SITE-SPECIFIC MAPS OF CURRENT CONDITIONS AND IDENTIFY SOLUTIONS TO THOSE PROBLEMS THROUGH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES. ELEMENTARY AGE STUDENTS WILL BE INTRODUCED TO CONCEPTS INTENDED TO FOSTER A LIFELONG LOVE OF SCIENCE AND NATURE WHILE MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL AGE STUDENTS WILL IDENTIFY STRATEGIES AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF HEAT. THROUGH THE PROJECT, THE APPLICANT HOPES TO INCREASE DISASTER RESILIENCY IN AN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY WITH VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF URBAN HEAT ISLANDS, PROMOTE AWARENESS OF CAREERS IN THE ENVIRONMENTAL SECTOR, AND PROVIDE A REPLICABLE MODEL FOR OTHER COMMUNITIES INTERESTED IN A 'BOTTOM UP' COLLABORATIVE APPROACH BY PUBLISHING A DETAILED STEP-BY-STEP GUIDE. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. REFER TO TERMS AND CONDITIONS. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 03/01/2022.
ACTIVITIES:
MIDDLE/HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED TO TAKE AIR TEMPERATURES, EXAMINE SOIL HEALTH, INVENTORY AND QUANTIFY EXISTING TREES, AND ESTIMATE CANOPY COVERAGE. STUDENTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO HAVE DISCUSSIONS WITH EXPERTS ON IDENTIFYING SOLUTIONS FOR HEAT MITIGATION. THE STUDENTS WILL PRODUCE A REPORT AND PRESENT THEIR FINDINGS TO THE HONOLULU CITY COUNCIL'S COMMITTEE ON TRANSPORTATION, SUSTAINABILITY, AND HEALTH. 
OUTCOMES:
DELIVERABLES INCLUDE FINAL PROJECT REPORTS FROM EACH STUDENT TEAM WHICH WILL HAVE AIR, SOIL AND TREE AND CANOPY COVERAGE DATA, AND WILL IDENTIFY HEAT MITIGATION SOLUTIONS. THE GRANTEE WILL ALSO PRODUCE AND PUBLISH A STEP-BY-STEP GUIDE ON HOW TO APPLY THEIR PROJECT TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE STUDENTS, THE BROADER LOCAL COMMUNITY, ELECTED OFFICIALS AND INTERESTED COMMUNITIES ELSEWHERE. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO IMPLEMENT AT LEAST ONE OF THE ACTION ITEMS FROM THE STUDENT REPORTS IN THE LOCAL AREA, INCREASE AWARENESS OF HEAT AS AN ISSUE, EDUCATE STUDENTS AND ENCOURAGE THEM TO PURSUE POTENTIAL CAREER PATHS IN THE ENVIRONMENTAL FIELD/ACADEMIA. THE LONG TERM EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVING AIR QUALITY, REDUCING BASELINE TEMPERATURES AND INCREASING DISASTER RESILIENCY BY REDUCING STORM AND WATER RUNOFF BY PLANTING MORE TREES IN THE FUTURE. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
A SUBAWARD WILL BE GIVEN TO THE NON-PROFIT GROUP, SMART TREES PACIFIC (STP). THEY WILL DEVELOP THE CURRICULUM AND TRAINING ON TREE INVENTORY, PLOTTING, AND ENTRY. 
ANOTHER SUBAWARD WILL BE GIVEN TO PACT YOUTH SERVICES STAFF FOR TRAINING, PLANNING, RECRUITMENT AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS MEETINGS AND DIRECT SERVICE.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE REGENERATION PROJECT: THE CONGREGATIONS AS RESILIENCY HUBS PROJECT THAT WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB FOR AN EAST OAKLAND NEIGHBORHOOD BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO CLEAN AIR DURING WILDFIRES AND BLACKOUTS AT THE FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH. IN CREATING A RESILIENCY HUB, THE REGENERATION PROJECT SHALL ASSESS AND ADDRESS INDOOR AIR POLLUTANTS, AS WELL AS INSTALL AN AIR FILTRATION SYSTEM FOR USE DURING WILDFIRES THE FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH SITE. THE PROJECT WILL HOST TWO COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS DISCUSSING THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD AND HOW TO ADAPT TO THESE CHANGES. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT SHALL DEVELOP A RESOURCE GUIDE SUPPORT OTHER CONGREGATIONS IN BECOMING COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUBS. 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING OF $75,000. PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO MARCH 1, 2022.

ACTIVITIES:
THE PRIMARY PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE:
OBJECTIVE 1: RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP FUND A BACK UP BATTERY FOR THE CONGREGATION 
OBJECTIVE 2: IDENTIFY INDOOR AIR POLLUTANTS, SOLICIT AIR FILTRATION UPGRADES, DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE PAMPHLETS ABOUT THE RESILIENCY HUB.
OBJECTIVE 3: DEVELOP CURRICULUM FOR INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND HOST WORKSHOPS WITH THE COMMUNITY
OBJECTIVE 4: DEVELOP RESILIENCY HUB GUIDES AND DISTRIBUTE TO THE CONGREGATIONS/CHURCHES
OUTCOMES:
                                                                                                                                                                            
THE ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES AND DELIVERABLES ARE TO IDENTIFY AND ELIMINATE INDOOR AIR POLLUTANTS AT FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH, PURCHASE PORTABLE AIR PURIFIERS FOR FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH HIRE CONTRACTORS TO INSTALL BACK-UP BATTERIES FOR FAITH BAPTIST SOLAR PANELS AS WELL AS UPDATE THE AIR FILTRATION SYSTEM AT FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH, HOST CLIMATE IMPACT AND PREPAREDNESS WORKSHOPS AND DEVELOP GUIDES FOR CONGREGATION RESILIENCY HUBS, DISSEMINATE INFORMATION ABOUT RESILIENCY HUB TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH OAKLAND CITY COUNCIL MEMBER LOREN TAYLOR'S EMAIL LIST, DISTRIBUTE PAMPHLETS ABOUT RESILIENCY HUB AROUND FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH'S NEIGHBORHOOD, AND DISTRIBUTE GUIDES TO CA IPL AND GTC CONGREGATIONS.

SHORT TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE KNOWLEDGE OF COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB FROM HAVENCOURT COMMUNITY MEMBERS, COMMUNITY PREPARATION DURING WILDFIRES, NEIGHBORHOOD ACCESS TO CLEAN AIR DURING WILDFIRES AT COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB, CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACT RECOGNITION IN THE HAVENSCOURT/MILLSMONT AREA, AND FORMATION OF CONGREGATIONS IN CA, AND ACROSS THE U.S., TO LEARN ABOUT COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB.

INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES INCLUDE HAVENSCOURT/MILLSMONT NEIGHBORS UTILIZATION OF COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB DURING WILDFIRES, INCREASED COMMUNITY CLIMATE CHANGE KNOWLEDGE AND PREPAREDNESS, AND FORMATION OF ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB CONGREGATIONS ACROSS CA AND U.S.

LONG TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE COMMUNITY RESILIENCY HUB CONGREGATIONS ACROSS CA AND U.S., ACCESS TO CLEAN AND COOL AIR DURING NATURAL DISASTERS, SUCH AS WILDFIRES, TO RESIDENTS ACROSS CA AND THE U.S., AND DECREASED NUMBER OF ASTHMA-RELATED HOSPITALIZATIONS AMONGST THE HAVENSCOURT/MILLSMONT COMMUNITY. 







SUBRECIPIENT:
SUB-GRANT TO GREEN THE CHURCH FOR DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF COMMUNITY RESILIENCY GUIDE = $11,000

SUB-GRANT TO FAITH BAPTIST CHURCH FOR SECURITY FIRM CONTRACT, OVERHEAD COSTS OF STAFF TIME AND UTILITIES = $7,000

DESCRIPTION:
OVER A SIX-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD, GROW2ZERO FARMS WILL COLLECT AND RE-PACKAGE 50,000 POUNDS OF RESCUED FOOD AS WELL AS GROW AND DISTRIBUTE AN ADDITIONAL 10,000 POUNDS OF ORGANIC PRODUCE GROWN AT ITS URBAN FARM IN WEST LONG BEACH. THE PROJECT WILL TARGET HOMEBOUND HOUSEHOLDS AND INDIVIDUALS, THOSE ADVERSELY IMPACTED BY SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS RESULTING FROM COVID-19, AS WELL AS THE POLLUTION FROM THE PORT OF LONG BEACH AND SEVERAL LOCAL REFINERIES. 
THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE THE IMPACTS OF METHANE ASSOCIATED WITH FOOD DISPOSAL AND SERVE TO SEQUESTER GHG EMISSIONS FROM THE LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AT LEAST 2600 CRATES OF FRESH FOOD THROUGH BOTH DISTRIBUTION AND DIRECT DOOR-TO-DOOR DELIVERY TO PARTICIPATING FAMILIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL HOST 8 WEBINARS, OR WORKSHOPS, FOCUSED ON COMPOSTING, FOOD WASTE REDUCTION, FOOD PREPARATION, ORGANIC GARDENING AND NON-TOXIC PEST CONTROL PRACTICES TO HELP REDUCE HOUSEHOLD WASTE AND POLLUTION, PROVIDE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD, AND ENCOURAGE HEALTHY FOOD HABITS. DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO OFFER A HOLISTIC RESPONSE TO A LACK OF HEALTHY FOOD OPTIONS FOR RESIDENTS IN SOUTHWEST FRESNO, AN AREA THAT FACES SOME OF THE WORST AIR QUALITY IN THE FRESNO METROPOLITAN AREAS AND HAS BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES. THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON MAPPING HEALTHY FOOD RESOURCES , CONNECTING RESIDENTS TO LOCAL COMMUNITY GARDEN RESOURCES, LAUNCHING SEVERAL COMMUNITY GARDENS, AND DEMONSTRATING HOW TO USE AND ACCESS HEALTHY PRODUCE. DURING IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT, THE APPLICANT WILL UTILIZE A RACIAL EQUITY IMPACT ASSESSMENT APPROACH TO ENSURE EQUITABLE IMPLEMENTATION OF OUR PROJECT TO REMEDY LONG‐STANDING FOOD DISPARITY ISSUES IN SOUTHWEST FRESNO. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 

PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 03/01/2022. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000.
ACTIVITIES:
EVERY NEIGHBORHOOD PARTNERSHIP (ENP) PLANS TO DO A BASELINE ASSESSMENT BY SURVEYING THE COMMUNITY TO UNDERSTAND AND DOCUMENT COMMUNITY-DRIVEN FOOD SECURITY AND ACCESSIBILITY CHALLENGES. 

ENP WILL CREATE AN ASSET MAP OF CURRENT HEALTHY FOOD SOURCES IN SOUTHWEST FRESNO AND IDENTIFY POTENTIALLY SUITABLE LOCATIONS FOR URBAN GARDENING PROJECTS. 

ENP WILL PARTNER WITH FRESNO HOUSING TO IDENTIFY AND DEVELOP AT LEAST TWO ADDITIONAL URBAN GARDENING SITES. 

ENP WILL DEVELOP A 'SOUTHWEST FRESNO FOOD SECURITY NETWORK' BY PARTNERING WITH YO'VILLE COMMUNITY GARDEN, FRESNO COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONNECT EXISTING AND NEW COMMUNITY GARDENERS, PROVIDE EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE AND HANDS-ON EXPERTISE FOR RESIDENTS WANTING TO START THEIR OWN GARDENS OR PARTICIPATE IN COMMUNITY GARDENING. 

ENP WILL ALSO PERFORM OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY. 
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTPUTS INCLUDE A PUBLIC FOOD MAP ECOSYSTEM, REACTIVATING EXISTING COMMUNITY GARDENS AND ESTABLISHING NEW ONES, CREATING A FRESNO GARDEN TOOLBOX, HOSTING CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE FOOD DEMONSTRATIONS, CREATING SCHOOL PROGRAMS ON CREATING ON-CAMPUS GARDENS, HIGHLIGHTING FARMERS IN SW FRESNO, AND HOSTING A BI-WEEKLY TRAINING OR WEBINAR EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY ON FOOD RELATED ISSUES. 

THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME WOULD BE TO HAVE NEW RESIDENTS CONNECTING WITH LOCAL PRODUCERS FOR LOCAL FOODS, RESIDENTS PURCHASING MORE LOCALLY GROWN ORGANIC FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, A CLEAR FRAMEWORK FOR ESTABLISHING SCHOOL, HOME OR COMMUNITY-BASED GARDENS, ENHANCED PARTICIPATION AND LEADERSHIP IN LOCAL FOOD CONVERSATION, AND REDUCTIONS IN GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS DUE TO FEWER TRIPS OUT OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD FOR FOOD. 

LONG-TERM OUTCOMES WOULD BE A CONTINUED REDUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS WHICH IN TURN WOULD IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND REDUCE THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19, IMPROVED SOCIAL FABRIC DUE TO HEALTHY FOOD OUTREACH, IMPROVED ECONOMIC CONDITIONS FOR FAMILIES DUE TO LOCAL AVAILABILITY OF FOOD, CREATION OF NEW PARTNERSHIPS AROUND HEALTHY FOOD, THRIVING FRESNO COUNTY FOOD SECURITY PLAN, BUILDING A BANK OF RESIDENTS READY TO BUY INTO LOCAL CO-OP OF FOOD SYSTEM, AND CHANGES TO LOCAL GARDENING ORDINANCES TO PROMOTE HEALTHY FAMILIES.  
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO ONEOC TO LEVERAGE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A RESIDENT-LED COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING INITIATIVE USING LOW-COST SENSORS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS THE LOCAL, CUMULATIVE IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTION AND COVID-19 IN SOUTHEAST SANTA ANA. THE PROJECT IS GUIDED BY FIVE PROJECT AIMS: (1) COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING TO CHARACTERIZE LOCAL
POLLUTION, (2) REGIONAL AIR MONITORING TO CHARACTERIZE ENVIRONMENTAL DISPARITIES, (3) PERSONAL AIR MONITORING TO IDENTIFY INDIVIDUAL RISKS OF AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE, INCLUDING INDOORS, (4)
EMPOWERING RESIDENTS THROUGH LEADERSHIP TRAINING AND HEALTH EDUCATION, AND (5) BUILDING SUSTAINABLE, MULTI-STAKEHOLDER LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF LOCAL EJ ISSUES AND COMMUNITY NEEDS AND TO INFORM FUTURE POLICY CHANGE. THE PROJECT WILL BE GUIDED AND OVERSEEN BY COMUNIDAD UNIDA, AIRE LIMPIO (CUAL), A STEERING COMMITTEE MADE UP OF YOUTH
AND ADULT RESIDENTS. OUTPUTS WILL INCLUDE THREE COMMUNITY FORUMS ON EJ ISSUES IN SOUTHEAST SANTA ANA, SIX COMMUNITY-WIDE 'TOXIC TOURS' TO CONDUCT OUTDOOR MONITORING, A WORKSHOP
AND BROCHURE ON REDUCING PERSONAL EXPOSURE TO INDOOR AIR POLLUTION INCLUDING COVID-19, A REPORT OF FINDINGS FROM THE THREE-PART COMMUNITY AIR MONITORING STUDY (AIMS 1-3), AND THE
DEVELOPMENT OF EJ ADVOCACY MATERIALS FOR MULTIPLE STAKEHOLDERS BASED ON THESE FINDINGS.

CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.ACTIVITIES:A. BIMONTHLY TOXIC TOURS (PROJECT AIMS 1 AND 2): COMMUNITY-WIDE AIR MONITORING ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST SANTA ANA WILL BE CARRIED OUT USING LOW-COST AIR MONITORING DEVICES CALLED
ATMOTUBES THROUGH A TOTAL OF SIX BIMONTHLY 'TOXIC TOURS,' OR DAY-LONG EVENTS IN WHICH CUAL COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND OTHER COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WILL CONDUCT SAMPLING ALONG
DESIGNATED ROUTES IN THE PROJECT FOCUS AREA (PROJECT AIM 1) AND SITES THROUGHOUT THE REGION (PROJECT AIM 2).
B. PERSONAL AIR MONITORING (PROJECT AIM 3): GIVEN THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN INDOOR AIR POLLUTION AND COVID-19 RISK, THE THIRD AIM OF THIS PROJECT IS TO UNDERSTAND AND REDUCE INDOOR AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE IN SOUTHEAST SANTA ANA. WE WILL RECRUIT 20 VOLUNTEERS FROM THE COMMUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS STUDY. FIRST, PARTICIPANTS WILL COMPLETE A BRIEF ONLINE QUESTIONNAIRE RELATED TO THE INTERIOR MAKEUP OF THEIR HOME (E.G., 'DO YOU HAVE A GAS STOVE?'), THEIR INDOOR ACTIVITIES (E.G., 'DO ANY MEMBERS OF YOUR HOUSEHOLD SMOKE INSIDE YOUR HOME?,' 'DO YOU OPEN THE WINDOWS WHEN YOU COOK?'), AND THEIR BELIEFS AND UNDERSTANDING SURROUNDING INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR POLLUTION HAZARDS, EMISSION SOURCES, AND CONCENTRATIONS (E.G. 'DO YOU BELIEVE THE AIR INSIDE OF YOUR HOME IS HEALTHY TO BREATHE?'). AFTER COMPLETING THE SURVEY, PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE AN ATMOTUBE TO MONITOR THEIR DAILY ACTIVITIES AND INDOOR AIR POLLUTION AT HOME FOR A PERIOD OF TWO WEEKS. EACH PARTICIPANT WILL BE ASKED TO TAKE THE MONITORING DEVICE AROUND WITH THEM AND MAINTAIN A TIME-ACTIVITY DIARY. AFTER THE FIRST WEEK, WE WILL HOST AN ONLINE WORKSHOP FOR HALF OF THE PARTICIPANTS (10 PEOPLE) TO DISCUSS THEIR EXPERIENCES USING THE AIR MONITORS, ANY OBSERVED PEAKS IN AIR POLLUTION, AND DAILY ACTIVITIES THAT SEEM TO LEAD TO HIGH EXPOSURES. IN THE WORKSHOP, WE WILL ALSO DISCUSS TIPS TO HELP REDUCE INDOOR AIR POLLUTION (E.G. OPENING THE WINDOWS WHEN
COOKING). AFTER THE COMPLETION OF THE TWO-WEEK PERIOD, PARTICIPANTS WILL COMPLETE THE SECOND QUESTIONNAIRE WITH THE SAME SET OF QUESTIONS AS THE FIRST QUESTIONNAIRE IN ORDER TO ASSESS THE IMPACT OF THE AT-HOME AIR MONITORING D

ONE STEP A LA VEZ WILL BE A CONDUCTING A PROJECT TITLED, THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITY EDUCATION PROJECT. IN THIS PROJECT THEY WILL IDENTIFY AND DEVELOP YOUTH LEADERSHIP TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN IDENTIFYING ENVIRONMENTAL THREATS TO ITS HEALTH AND WELL-BEING AND TAKING ACTION TO REDUCE THOSE THREATS IN THE SANTA CLARA RIVER VALLEY/HERITAGE VALLEY. FOR THE LOS PADRES NATIONAL FOREST, THE FOCUS WILL BE ON DRINKING WATER AND TOXIC SUBSTANCES IN THE RURAL, LOW-INCOME AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY. LOUIS.  LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCING NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS ON VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES FROM CLIMATE AND DISASTER RELATED EVENTS LIKE URBAN HEAT WAVES OR EXTREME COLD. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE 50 FAMILIES IN NORTH ST. LOUIS AND LOW INCOME FAMILIES IN NORTH  AND SOUTH ST. LOUIS NEIGHBORHOODS.
SUBRECIPIENT: "THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY ". THE COMMUNITIES FIRST PARTNERS WILL WORK TO IDENTIFY AND RECRUIT THE 50 LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, HOLD 10 LOW-COST WEATHERIZATION DEMONSTRATION PILOTS, TWO TOWNHALL MEETINGS TO FACILITATE GROUP DECISIONS ON HOW TO BETTER IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENT IN THE FAMILIES' COMMUNITIES, REVIEW THE ASSESSMENTS TO INTERPRET THE SCORE, AND DEVELOP TAILORED PLANS WITH THE FAMILIES TO IMPROVE ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND AIR QUALITY OF THEIR HOMES. COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS WILL FOCUS ON RECRUITING HOMEOWNERS, REVIEWING AUDIT SCORES, AND DEVELOPING A GAME PLAN FOR EACH FAMILY. COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND SMALL GROUP ENGAGEMENTS WILL HELP PEOPLE HELP EACH OTHER WITH ENERGY EFFICIENCY STRATEGIES AND ALLOW OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENGAGE IN BROADER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES FACING THE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL INJUSTICES CAUSED BY THE AUTO-CENTRIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM IN COLUMBIA, MO, WHICH PUTS LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AND COMMUNITIES OF COLOR AT HIGHER RISK OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH HARMS (E.G., AIR POLLUTION, ASTHMA, COVID-19, LOW ACCESS TO RESOURCES) AND EXCLUDES THEM FROM DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES THAT CAN CREATE HEALTHY ENVIRONMENTS.  
ACTIVITIES:
THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON COLUMBIA'S FIVE VISION ZERO PRIORITY NEIGHBORHOODS AND WILL PARTNER WITH RESIDENT LEADERS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE EQUITY AND CLIMATE ACTION MISSIONS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION (E.G., DOOR KNOCKING, NEWSLETTERS, AWARENESS CAMPAIGN), GATHER INPUT AND ASSESS NEEDS (E.G., COMMUNITY MEETINGS, AUDITS OF TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND RESOURCES, STREET ISSUE MAPPING APP), AND EMPOWER RESIDENTS TO ENGAGE WITH DECISION-MAKERS. 



OUTCOMES:
PROJECT OUTPUTS WILL INCLUDE: RESIDENTS REACHED THROUGH DOOR-TO-DOOR OUTREACH AND NEWSLETTERS, COMMUNITY MEETINGS, INFRASTRUCTURE AND BASIC NEEDS AUDITS, AND EMPOWERED COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO ENGAGING IN DECISION-MAKING. LONGER-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE: DECREASED EMISSIONS AND AIR POLLUTION AND INCREASED ACCESS TO DECISION-MAKING AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES.  BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF COLUMBIA, MO. 


SUBRECIPIENT:
RACE MATTERS- FRIENDS WILL WORK WITH PEDNET IN COMMUNICATING WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN SHARING INFORMATION ON TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS, HELPING TO PROMOTE PROJECT ACTIVITIES, ASSISTING WITH DOOR KNOCKING AND DISTRIBUTING DOOR HANGERS.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED PROJECT IS TO WORK WITH NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS, LOCAL ARTISTS, STUDENTS, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO EDUCATE INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN OR NEAR NORTH OMAHA, NEBRASKA ABOUT THE NEW NORTH OMAHA TRAIL AND CLEAN AIR INITIATIVES. NORTH OMAHA IS THE HISTORIC CENTER OF THE BLACK COMMUNITY, AND THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO ELIMINATE RACIAL DISPARITIES IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL RISKS. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 
ACTIVITIES:
SPARK WILL COORDINATE WITH COMMUNITY ADVISORY GROUPS AND WORK WITH LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS ON A VARIETY OF CLEAN AIR-RELATED COMPONENTS IN ORDER TO REACH THE UNDERSERVED SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY TRAIL MURALS; WORK WITH GARDENING GROUPS TO PLANT RAISED BEDS; PUBLICIZE AND MARKET TRAIL USAGE AND EVENTS; RECRUIT NEIGHBORS, BUSINESSES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO PARTICIPATE. 
OUTCOMES:
KEY OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS WILL INCLUDE ACTIVATION PROJECTS OF THE NORTH OMAHA TRAIL THAT FOCUS ON EDUCATING THE PUBLIC AND EMPOWERING NEIGHBORS TO TAKE AN ACTIVE ROLE IN CLEAN AIR EFFORTS. GARDENING AND A COMMUNITY CLEAN AIR WALK AND JUNETEENTH EVENTS WILL BE HELD.  THE PRIMARY SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY RISKS IN THE COMMUNITY AND TO ACTIVATE THE TRAIL TO INCREASE USAGE OF WALKING, BIKING, AND OTHER METHODS OF TRANSPORTATION THAT WILL IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. ANTICIPATED INTERMEDIATE AND LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED BIKING AND WALKING, REDUCED TRAFFIC AND CARBON EMISSIONS NEAR THE TRAIL. THIS WOULD ALSO HELP THE LONG-TERM OUTCOMES OF IMPROVED HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF NORTH OMAHA RESIDENTS, WHICH IS THE HISTORIC CENTER OF THE BLACK COMMUNITY, AND THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO ELIMINATE RACIAL DISPARITIES IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL RISKS. 

SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT, PARTIALLY FUNDED BY THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN, IS TO EDUCATE AND TRAIN BOTH URBAN AND RURAL GREENE COUNTY, MISSOURI COMMUNITIES TO BECOME MORE RESILIENT TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND NATURAL DISASTERS BY TEACHING SUSTAINABLE, ECOLOGICALLY DIVERSE, FOOD PRODUCTION PRACTICES TO NEIGHBORHOOD LEADERS, OWNERS OF SMALL SUSTAINABLE LANDHOLDINGS FOR MARKET FARMING, AND THE URBAN CORE AND RURAL FARMERS IN THE COUNTY.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF: (1) THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ADVISORY BOARD AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF MARKETING MATERIALS; (2) PROJECT OUTREACH AND ENROLLMENT (ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ADVERTISEMENT THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA, PRINT, AND THROUGH EXTENSIONS OF PROJECT PARTNER RELATIONSHIPS); (3) FORMALIZING THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM CURRICULUM AND PROVIDING FREE, 4 WEEK EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR 28 TRAINEES; (4) AFTER GRADUATION, PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE A CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION. AFTER TAKING THE INTERNSHIP COURSE, THERE ARE AVENUES FOR ADVANCEMENT AS AN SCG APPRENTICE, THEN AS AN ASSISTANT FARMER. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE; FOSTERING FOOD SECURITY FOR UNDERSERVED URBAN POPULATION AND RURAL FARMERS RESIDENTS IN URBAN COMMUNITIES AND INCREASING COMMUNITY MEMBER UNDERSTANDING ABOUT URBAN AGRICULTURE WHICH PROTECTS THEM AGAINST DISRUPTIONS IN THE FOOD SYSTEM (INCLUDING FLUCTUATIONS IN CROPS, PRICING, AND TRANSPORTATION).  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES CONSIST OF 4 WEEK INTERNSHIPS WITH 4 INTERNS PER COHORT THAT WILL OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT TIMELINE. SEVEN COHORTS WILL OCCUR PER YEAR FOR A TOTAL OF 28 INTERNS ANNUALLY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AND PEOPLE OF COLOR FARMERS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BENEFIT LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN GREENE COUNTY, MO.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO SUPPORT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE THROUGH COVID-19 RECOVERY IN AREAS OF NORTH AND SOUTH OMAHA DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY THE PANDEMIC.
ACTIVITIES:
AT TWO VICTORY GARDEN DEMONSTRATION PROJECT SITES, MONTHLY WORKSHOPS WILL TRAIN PARTICIPANTS TO START AND MAINTAIN THEIR OWN VICTORY GARDENS, WHICH FOCUS ON THE PRODUCTION OF LARGE AMOUNTS OF NUTRIENT-DENSE AND CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE FOODS TO FEED FAMILIES AND DONATE TO THOSE IN NEED. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.  
OUTCOMES:
SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING THE RATE OF COVID-19 VACCINATIONS, REDUCTION IN FOOD INSECURITY, REDUCTION IN VEHICLE TRAFFIC DUE TO LOCAL FOOD ACCESS. INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED PRODUCTION GARDENS AT HOMES AND IN COMMUNITY GARDENS, INCREASED HEALTH AND WELLBEING DUE TO INCREASED NUTRITION.  LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE SUPPORT FOR BUILDING VICTORY GARDENS AT HOMES AND AT MULTI-FAMILY HOUSING UNITS AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY DUE TO EXPANSION OF GREEN SPACES IN URBAN AREAS AND THE REDUCTION IN VEHICLE TRAFFIC. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF NORTH AND SOUTH OMAHA.
SUBRECIPIENT:
FREE FARM SYNDICATE WILL PURCHASE GARDENING SUPPLIES INCLUDING SOIL, SEEDS, COMPOST, MULCH, BOXES, BAGS AND TOOLS IN SUPPORT OF PROVIDING WORKSHOPS AND RUNNING FREE FARM STANDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AS COMMUNITIES GRAPPLE WITH THE INCREASED EFFECTS OF URBAN HEAT ISLANDS (UHIS) DUE TO THE WARMING CLIMATE. ACTIVITIES:METROPOLITAN ENERGY CENTER WILL FACILITATE COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS IN THE ARGENTINE AND AMOURDALE NEIGHBORHOODS IN KANSAS CITY, KANSAS, TO BUILD TWO COMMUNITY HEAT ACTION PLANS THAT IDENTIFY MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES TO REDUCE HEAT DIRECTLY AND IMPROVE THE ABILITY OF RESIDENTS TO DEAL WITH EXTREME TEMPERATURES. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO DEVELOP AWARENESS, AGENCY, AND SOCIAL COHESION IN UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE (1) THE PLANNING, PREPARATION, AND EXECUTION OF TWO, TWO-DAY WORKSHOPS TO ENGAGE WITH AND LEARN FROM THE COMMUNITY TO DEVELOP TWO HEAT ACTION PLANS; (2) AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING AND KNOWLEDGE RELATED TO THE UHI EFFECT AND THE RESOURCES CURRENTLY AVAILABLE DURING OPPRESSIVE HEAT DAYS, AND (3) IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL CAPITAL AND COHESION IN THE SELECTED NEIGHBORHOODS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TARGET NEIGHBORHOODS OF ARGENTINE AND AMOURDALE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO GROUNDWORK DENVER SO IT WILL HIRE 20 SOUTH COMMERCE CITY, (CC) AND GLOBEVILLE ELYRIA AND SWANSEA (GES) GREEN TEAM EMPLOYEES, EDUCATE THEM ABOUT LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES AND ENVIRONMENTAL ADVOCACY AND STEWARDSHIP, TRAIN THEM TO EFFECTIVELY OUTREACH TO AND DISCUSS ENERGY EFFICIENCY WITH RESIDENTS, AND HOW TO PLANT AND MAINTAIN TREES ON THEIR PROPERTY. DESCRIPTION:HIGH COUNTRY CONSERVATION CENTER, (HC3) WILL DEVELOP A CLIMATE EQUITY PLAN THAT EMPOWERS SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN CREATING CLIMATE ACTION SOLUTIONS WHILE IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL RESIDENTS AND DECREASING GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. BY COORDINATING WITH DIVERSE ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ALREADY WORK WITH LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY RESIDENTS ON COMMUNITY- BUILDING PROJECTS, HC3 WILL ENSURE MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT WITH OUR COMMUNITY'S DIVERSE POPULATIONS. HC3 WILL INCORPORATE THE CLIMATE EQUITY PLAN INTO THE EXISTING COMMUNITY-WIDE CLIMATE ACTION PLAN, PRIORITIZING ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION OF ALL RESIDENTS IN THEIR COMMUNITY'S LARGER EFFORTS TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. ACTIVITIES:  CONVENE STEERING COMMITTEE OF 8 - 15 MEMBERS
- IDENTIFY PRIMARY CONCERNS, NEEDS, AND CHALLENGES FACED BY SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES
- IDENTIFY POTENTIAL CLIMATE ACTION SOLUTIONS THAT ADDRESS THE NEEDS AND CONCERNS OF SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY
- CREATE AND DISTRIBUTE COMMUNITY SURVEY IN ENGLISH AND SPANISH TO GATHER FEEDBACK ON NEEDS AND CONCERNS AND POTENTIAL SOLUTIONS
HOST COMMUNITY LISTENING SESSIONS TO GATHER IN-DEPTH FEEDBACK ON NEEDS AND CONCERNS AND POTENTIAL SOLUTIONS
- CREATE CLIMATE EQUITY PLAN WITH OVERSIGHT FROM STEERING COMMITTEE
- PRESENT COMPLETED CLIMATE EQUITY PLAN TO SUMMIT CLIMATE ACTION COLLABORATIVE
- IMPLEMENT NEW CLIMATE ACTION SOLUTIONS BASED ON INPUT FROM STEERING COMMITTEE AND SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED RESIDENTSSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:INCREASE IN # OF UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS THAT KNOW ABOUT LOCAL CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS AND THE CLIMATE ACTION PLAN (TARGET: 200)
- INCREASE IN # OF CLIMATE ACTION STRATEGIES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED WITH UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY MEMBERS' INPUT (TARGET: 4 - 8)
- STRENGTHENED RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS 
- INCREASED TRUST WITH SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED POPULATION 
- IMPLEMENTATION OF STRATEGIES OUTLINED IN CLIMATE EQUITY PLAN
- INCREASE IN # OF UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS WHO PARTICIPATE IN HC3'S CLIMATE ACTION PROGRAMS
- INCREASE IN COLLABORATION BETWEEN HC3 AND COMMUNITY GROUPS SERVING SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS
- DECREASE IN GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS FROM PARTICIPATION IN HC3'S CLIMATE ACTION PROGRAMS
- CONTINUED FOCUS ON EQUITY AND ENGAGEMENT IN CLIMATE ACTION DEVELOPMENT AND PLANNING
- PROGRAM PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN HC3 AND COMMUNITY GROUPS SERVING SUMMIT COUNTY'S UNDERSERVED POPULATION

UTAH CLEAN ENERGY'S 'EMPOWER SLC' PROGRAM WILL IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY IN SALT LAKE CITY BY EMPOWERING UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO REDUCE ENERGY CONSUMPTION IN THEIR HOMES AND BUSINESSES, WHILE BUILDING THE COMMUNITY'S CAPACITY TO UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THE PROGRAM WILL INCREASE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITIES BY EXPANDING UTAH CLEAN ENERGY'S RELATIONSHIPS WITH SALT LAKE CITY'S UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, NONPROFITS, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT PARTNERS IN REGARDS TO ENERGY EFFICIENCY, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND AIR QUALITY ISSUES. OUR PROGRAM WILL RESULT IN LONG-TERM COMMUNITY-BASED PARTNERSHIPS THAT WILL CONTINUE TO IMPROVE LOCAL AIR QUALITY.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE HEALTH DISPARITIES AND DISPROPORTIONATE BURDEN OF ENERGY CONSUMPTION CAUSED BY SUBSTANDARD HOUSING AMONG LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS OF ROUTT AND MOFFAT COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST COLORADO. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH, SAFETY AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY OF HOMES FOR THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY -- BENEFITING BOTH RESIDENTS AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THROUGH HEALTHY HOMES EVALUATIONS, ENERGY ASSESSMENTS, HOME SAFETY AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY RETROFITS, AND HEALTHY HOME AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY EDUCATION AND COACHING, YVSC WILL HELP LOW-INCOME FAMILIES REDUCE HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS AND MAKE THEIR HOMES MORE ENERGY EFFICIENT. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY, DECREASE EXPOSURE TO TOXIC SUBSTANCES AND SAFETY HAZARDS, REDUCE ENERGY USE AND LOWER UTILITY BILLS. THUS, PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MORE FINANCIALLY RESILIENT, THEIR HOMES WILL BE SAFER AND MORE COMFORTABLE, AND THE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THEIR ENERGY USE WILL BE REDUCED.

ENVIRONMENTAL LEARNING FOR KIDS'COMMUNITY WATER CONNECTIONS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE DIRECT IMPACTS OF WATER POLLUTION AND CONTAMINATION BY CONNECTING HUMAN ACTIVITIES TO THE IMPACT OF WATER CONTAMINATION AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES ON THE NATURAL WORLD, INCLUDING EXPLORATION OF AQUATIC BIOLOGY, CHANGES IN SPECIES DIVERSITY, AND IMPACTS ON FISH POPULATIONS FROM WATER QUALITY CHANGES; AND TYING PROJECT ACTIVITIES TO AN UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE MEANS.

SPECIFIC ACTIONS WILL INCLUDE ENGAGING RESIDENTS OF NORTHEAST DENVER AND AREAS SURROUNDING LOWER BEAR CREEK IN MAKING PROPERTY-SPECIFIC GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDING RAIN BARREL AND RAIN GARDEN INSTALLATIONS, AS WELL AS FACE-TO-FACE EDUCATION, A NON-STRUCTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICE REFERENCED IN THE 'LOWER BEAR CREEK WATERSHED PLAN' GWD DEVELOPED IN 2014. MEMBERS OF GWD'S GREEN TEAM YOUTH EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM WILL BE ENGAGED IN COMMUNITY OUTREACH, EDUCATION, INSTALLATION, AND MAINTENANCE, THROUGH WHICH THEY WILL GAIN BOTH HARD AND SOFT SKILLS NECESSARY TO PREPARE THEM FOR CAREERS IN DENVER'S RAPIDLY EXPANDING WORKFORCE.
THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PRODUCE A REPLICABLE AND SCALABLE COMMUNITY DRIVEN INNOVATION PROCESS FOR RADICAL INTEGRATION OF CULTURALLY SENSITIVE CITIZEN SCIENCE WITH PROJECT-BASED LEARNING.

UPHE'S LEAD SAFE OUTREACH PROGRAM AIMS TO CREATE A SAFE ENVIRONMENT FOR CHILDREN BY EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY AND SCHOOLS ABOUT THE SOURCES AND HEALTH RISK OF LEAD POISONING, INFORMING THEM ABOUT LOCAL PROGRAMS FOR ABATEMENT, PROVIDING INFORMATION TO THE LEAD EDUCATION AND SCREENING COALITION, AND SHARING INFORMATION FROM THIS COALITION BACK TO THE COMMUNITY.

THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE BUILDING COMMUNITY CAPACITY AND IMPROVING INDOOR AIR QUALITYPROJECT IS TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT RADON AND THE NEED FOR HOME TESTING AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES DURING THE LIFE OF THE PROJECT.
THE BLACKFEET NATION WILL UNDERTAKE A BASELINE MONITORING STUDY USING EDNA TESTING TECHNIQUES TO DETERMINE PRESENCE/ABSENCE OF INVASIVE MUSSELS (I.E.ZEBRA AND QUAGGA) IN TRIBAL WATERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DEPLOY PROFESSIONALLY TRAINED DETECTION DOGS TO SURVEY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINANTS AND COVID-19 IN CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT LANDSCAPES ON AND SURROUNDING THE BLACKFEET NATION OF NORTH-CENTRAL MONTANA. CONSERVATION DETECTION DOGS TRAINED BY WORKING DOGS FOR CONSERVATION WILL BE USED TO FIND SCAT SAMPLES FROM TWO SENTINEL SPECIES: MINK AND OTTER. BOTH MINK AND OTTER ARE AQUATIC SPECIES EXPLOITING THE INVERTEBRATE AND PISCINE COMPONENTS OF AQUATIC FOOD WEBS, RESPECTIVELY. HEAVY METALS, PHARMACEUTICALS, FLAME RETARDANTS, AND COVID-19 CAN ALL BE RECOVERED FROM THESE TWO MUSTELIDS' SCATS. AS SUCH, THESE SPECIES CAN REVEAL THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF THESE CONTAMINANTS AND DISEASE. ACTIVITIES:K9 DETECTION AND MAPPING OF MINK AND OTTER SCAT.  THIS INCLUDES BASE TRAINING, SO THAT THE DOGS ARE TRAINED AND RELIABLE, FIELD-READY AND THEY WORK WELL WITH THE DOG HANDLER AS A TEAM. THE SECOND PART OF THE ACTIVITY IS A DEMONSTRATION TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHERE THE K9 SKILLS AND RELIABILITY ARE OBSERVED BY THE COMMUNITY.  THE FINAL PART OF THE K9 TRAINING IS THE ACTUAL FIELD DEPLOYMENT, WHERE SAMPLES ARE COLLECTED. THE SECOND PART OF THE GRANT WILL BE COMMUNITY INFORMATION DISSEMINATION. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EFFICIENT SOURCING OF SAMPLES FROM SENTINEL SPECIES (MINK AND OTTER). HIGH QUALITY SAMPLES FOR ANALYSIS, CLEAR IDENTIFICATION OF CONTAMINANT AND DISEASE PATTERNS. TRUST AND BELIEF IN K9 METHODS, ACTION BASED ON SPATIAL/ECOLOGICAL PATTERNS OF CONTAMINATION OR DISEASE OBSERVED. HEALTHIER FOOD. LESS EXPOSURE TO CONTAMINANTS AND DISEASE, HEALTHIER BLACKFEET POPULATION. BETTER RESOURCE COLLECTION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS (SPECIFICALLY, AVOIDANCE OF EXISTING CONTAMINATION) CLEANUP OF CONTAMINATED AREAS AND PREVENTION OF FUTURE CONTAMINATION.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO STRENGTHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITY'S CAPACITY TO ADDRESS FLOODING AND WATER QUALITY IN LYNCHBURG, VIRGINIA, AN INDEPENDENT CITY IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, WHERE FLOOD OCCURRENCE, WATER CONTAMINATION, AND EXTREME TEMPERATURE HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS CURRENT HAZARDS WHICH, DUE TO CLIMATE CHANGE, WILL LIKELY BE EXACERBATED DURING HURRICANE SEASON.  LYNCHBURG IS KNOWN AS THE 'CITY OF SEVEN HILLS' OR THE 'HILL CITY' AND LIES AT THE CENTER OF A WIDER METROPOLITAN AREA CLOSE TO THE GEOGRAPHIC CENTER OF VIRGINIA. IT IS THE FIFTH LARGEST METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA (MSA) IN VIRGINIA, WITH A POPULATION OF 260,320.
ACTIVITIES:
 THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE LOW-INCOME, MINORITY NEIGHBORHOODS, WHICH ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY THESE HAZARDS, TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THEIR RISKS AND TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO ADDRESS THEM. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) KICK-OFF AND PROJECT REVIEW THAT PRODUCES A PROJECT WORK PLAN, 2) DATA COLLECTION TO ASSEMBLE THE LATEST HAZARD, CLIMATE, AND DEMOGRAPHIC DATA TO IDENTIFY VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES AT RISK, 3) COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, WHICH INCLUDES FIVE FACILITATED MEETINGS (INCLUDING MVOC CONFERENCE SESSIONS), FIVE SETS OF MEETING MINUTES, A FACILITATION FINDINGS REPORT, AND 15-20 ACCEPTABLE MITIGATION ACTIVITIES, AND 4) OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES, WHICH WILL GENERATE AN OUTREACH PLAN AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL, INTERACTIONS WITH 300 RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES, AND INPUT INTO THE LOCAL HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN. A LONG-TERM OUTCOME WILL BE THE IDENTIFICATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS THAT SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN A FUTURE LOCAL RESILIENCY PLAN.


. 
OUTCOMES:
THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT INCLUDE USING THE LATEST HAZARD, CLIMATE, AND DEMOGRAPHIC DATA TO IDENTIFY VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES AT RISK, ENGAGING WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS ON WATER QUALITY AND REDUCING HAZARD IMPACTS, AND DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL TO PROMOTE HAZARD AWARENESS, AND CARRYING OUT NO-COST/LOW-COST HAZARD MITIGATION AND WATER QUALITY ACTIVITIES. FLOOD AND EXTREME TEMPERATURE HAZARDS WERE IDENTIFIED DUE TO THE LIKELIHOOD OF CLIMATE CHANGE EXACERBATING THESE HAZARDS.
THIS INITIAL TASK WILL ALLOW THE TEAM TO MEET, REVIEW PROJECT GOALS AND ACTIVITIES, FINALIZE A SCHEDULE, AND ANSWER ANY STAKEHOLDER QUESTIONS. A LIST OF DATA AND THEIR SOURCES WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE TEAM TO ENSURE ALL RELEVANT INFORMATION IS IDENTIFIED AND CAN BE COLLECTED IN A TIMELY MANNER. THE RESULT OF THIS TASK WILL BE A WORK PLAN THE TEAM WILL FOLLOW. OUTPUTS FROM THE PROJECT INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION GATHERED TO IDENTIFY NEIGHBORHOODS WITHIN LYNCHBURG THAT WOULD BE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED IN HAZARD EVENTS, 2) RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS ENGAGED TO LISTEN TO THEIR CONCERNS AND SEEK INPUT ON WAYS TO INCREASE HAZARD MITIGATION ACTIVITIES, AND 3) EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS DEVELOPED AND DISSEMINATED. OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF STAKEHOLDERS AWARE OF AND ADDRESSING HAZARDS, AND 2) COMMUNITY INPUT INTO THE HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN.  THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY NEIGHBORHOODS OF LYNCHBURG, VIRGINIA, WHO ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY HAZARDS SUCH AS FLOODING, WATER CONTAMINATION, AND EXTREME TEMPERATURES.


SUBRECIPIENT:
LESLIE KING CONSULTING WILL PARTNER WITH MVOC, A LYNCHBURG NON-PROFIT COMMITTED TO ADVANCING RACIAL JUSTICE IN CENTRAL VIRGINIA BY INSPIRING ACTION AND SOCIAL CHANGE THROUGH EDUCATION, ENGAGEMENT, AND ADVOCACY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO HIGHLIGHT THE IMPACT, ESPECIALLY FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES RESIDING IN HAZARDOUS HOUSING, OF SPENDING ADDITIONAL TIME INDOORS DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE EXPOSURE TO HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS IN HOUSING IN NORTHEAST WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, INCLUDING AIR AND WATER POLLUTANTS THAT ARE PREVALENT IN HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS OF THE CITY WITH HIGH CONCENTRATIONS OF LOW AND MODERATE HOUSEHOLD INCOMES AND BLACK AND LATINO RESIDENTS.

CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 

SDWA 1442: HANDWASHING IS A WELL-ACCEPTED APPROACH TO COMBATING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. CLEAN WATER IS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER WASHING OF HANDS. SDWA 1442 GRANT PROJECTS CONTRIBUTE TO PROVIDING CLEAN WATER FOR HANDWASHING IN COMBATTING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. 
ACTIVITIES:GBU STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH THE RESILIENCE TEAM TO HOST CLIMATE RESILIENCY SERVICE DAYS, WHICH WILL DEMONSTRATE HOW RESIDENTS CAN MAKE PHYSICAL STRUCTURES IN NORTHEAST WILMINGTON MORE CLIMATE RESILIENT. THE EVENT WILL FEATURE EXISTING HOME ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BEST SUITED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF NEIGHBORS SUCH AS: DELAWARE IN-HOME ENERGY CHECK-UP AND COUNSELING; REFRIGERATION REPLACEMENT PROGRAM; DOWNTOWN DEVELOPMENT DISTRICTS HOME PERFORMANCE PROGRAM; WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (WAP); PRE-WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; ENERGIZE DELAWARE - LIGHTS-ON DELAWARE STRONG PROGRAM; SUMMER COOLING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; REPLACE OR REPAIR HEATERS AND CONSERVE ENERGY PROGRAM; LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES PROGRAM; OR OTHERS. PARTICIPATING RESIDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT AND PROVIDE OR RECEIVE HOME SERVICES SUCH AS INSTALLATIONS OF PROGRAMMABLE/SMART THERMOSTATS; LED LIGHT BULBS; SMART POWER STRIPS FOR TVS AND COMPUTERS; CAULKING; AND REPLACEMENT OF AIR FILTERS. HOME ENERGY AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS MAY ALSO BE PROVIDED TO 40-80 HOMES WITH PERMISSION OF RESIDENTS/OWNERS. THIS WILL BE IN COORDINATION WITH ENERGIZE DELAWARE'S HOME PERFORMANCE WITH ENERGY STAR PROGRAM WHICH CURRENTLY COSTS $50 PER HOUSEHOLD ($25 PER LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLD). THESE ASSESSMENTS INCLUDE: IDENTIFYING ENERGY-SAVING IMPROVEMENTS USING STATE-OF-THE-ART DIAGNOSTIC EQUIPMENT; INSTALLING UP TO $200 WORTH OF ENERGY-SAVING MEASURES; REVIEWING RECOMMENDED IMPROVEMENTS AND AVAILABLE REBATES. GBU WILL ALSO WORK WITH CONTRACTORS TO BE ABLE TO ASSESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY POLLUTANTS.


OUTCOMES:GBU AND PARTNERS IN NORTHEAST WILMINGTON WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A YEAR-LONG PROGRAM OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES TO FOSTER DISCUSSIONS ON COMMUNITY READINESS FOR ANTICIPATING, PREPARING FOR, AND RESPONDING TO HAZARDOUS EVENTS, TRENDS, OR DISTURBANCES RELATED TO CLIMATE AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO ADDRESS BOTH THE SOCIAL AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT DIMENSIONS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, UNDERSTANDING THAT WEATHER EXTREMES AND SUBSTANDARD HOUSING DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECT LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, AND THAT AFFORDABLE HOUSING SOLUTIONS NEED TO INCLUDE EFFICIENT AND AFFORDABLE SOLUTIONS THAT ENSURE CLEAN AIR, WATER, AND ENERGY. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO LAY THE GROUNDWORK FOR FUTURE ENDEAVORS, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESILIENCE HUBS - NEIGHBORHOOD DESIGNED CENTERS THAT HELP RESIDENTS BUILD CLIMATE RESILIENCY.
THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE UNDERSERVED EJ-IMPACTED COMMUNITIES OF NORTHEAST WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF UNDERSERVED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES IN BALTIMORE, MD.  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY INCREASING THE ACCESSIBILITY OF URBAN FOREST PATCHES THAT PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH HEAT RELIEF AND CONTRIBUTE TO BETTERING THE AIR QUALITY IN 3 UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS IN BALTIMORE. 

BALTIMORE CITY, MARYLAND IS A MAJORITY-BLACK (63%) JURISDICTION WITH UNDERSERVED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES THAT SUFFER FROM MANY ILLS AND LACK OF SERVICES.  THESE INCLUDE LIMITED ACCESS TO GREENSPACES AND LIMITED TREE CANOPY COVER THAT INTENSIFY NEIGHBORHOOD HEAT ISLANDS. RESIDENTS OF THESE NEIGHBORHOODS HAVE HIGHER RATES OF CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS, INCLUDING ASTHMA.
ACTIVITIES:
THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES TO ACHIEVE THIS OBJECTIVE: FIELD RESEARCH WILL BE CONDUCTED BY GRADUATE STUDENTS FROM MORGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
AND/OR UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, BALTIMORE COUNTY TO DETERMINE HOW MUCH PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE IN IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF 10 FORESTS THAT WE FIRST SURVEYED IN 2016.  EDUCATION AND TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED FOR 10+ NEIGHBORHOOD FOREST STEWARDS AND 200+ OTHER BALTIMORE CITY RESIDENTS WILL BE EDUCATED ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF FOREST PATCHES IN MITIGATING NEIGHBORHOOD HEAT ISLANDS AND TRAINED IN MAINTENANCE EFFORTS SUCH AS INVASIVE VINE REMOVAL. 
OUTCOMES:
THESE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES WILL REACH APPROXIMATELY 200+ BALTIMORE CITY RESIDENTS INCLUDING AT LEAST 10 NEIGHBORHOOD FOREST STEWARDS AND PROVIDE THEM WITH THE NECESSARY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND ACCESSIBILITY OF URBAN FOREST PATCHES.  THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS PROVIDED ARE ESSENTIAL TO MAINTAINING AND ENHANCING FOREST PATCHES WHICH IN TURN ARE ESSENTIAL TO BETTERING LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND MITIGATING NEIGHBORHOOD HEAT ISLANDS.  POOR AIR QUALITY AND EXTREME HEAT ARE MAJOR CHALLENGES IN THESE COMMUNITIES WHICH HAVE A LONG HISTORY OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL INJUSTICES.  THIS EDUCATION AND TRAINING WILL PROVIDE SPECIALIZED INFORMATION THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE UNAVAILABLE TO THE COMMUNITY TO ENABLE VITAL MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS INVASIVE VINE REMOVAL, AND CORRECT SELECTION OF TRANSITIONAL PLANTS WHICH ARE ESSENTIAL TO MAINTAIN THE HEALTH AND PREVENT DEGRADATION OF THE FOREST PATCHES AND ACHIEVE VALUABLE HEALTH BENEFITS.

THE BENEFICIARIES ARE PREDOMINANTLY THE NEIGHBORHOODS AROUND THE 3 PRIMARY SITES OF WILSON PARK WOODS, SPRINGFIELD WOODS, AND FAIRWOOD FOREST.  THESE NEIGHBORHOODS HAVE HIGH MINORITY POPULATIONS (61%-90% BLACK), AND A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS (29%-47% IN 2018) AND HAVE LONG SUFFERED FROM A HISTORY OF REDLINING, DISINVESTMENT, AN ABUNDANCE OF VACANT HOUSES AND LANDS, AND LIMITED ACCESS TO GREENSPACES.  OTHER BENEFICIARIES ARE BALTIMORE CITY UNDERSERVED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES AS A WHOLE THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY BUILDING FROM THE 200+ RESIDENTS RECEIVING TRAINING AND SKILLS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

OUTCOMES:

PENNSYLVANIA HORTICULTURAL SOCIETY (PHS) WITH PARTNERS, NEIGHBORHOOD LEADERS AND STAKEHOLDERS WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A PILOT PROGRAM TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IN THE TIOGA AND NICETOWN NEIGHBORHOODS OF PHILADELPHIA. THE PROGRAM WILL BUILD COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES RELATED TO CLEAR AIR AND WATER THROUGH GREENING, AND LAY GROUNDWORK FOR FUTURE ENDEAVORS.

THE ENERGY COORDINATING AGENCY OF PHILADELPHIA (ECAP) WILL ADDRESS LEAD POISONING AFFECTING YOUNG CHILDREN IN LOW INCOME FAMILIES IN PHILADELPHIA. ECAP'S PROJECT ENTITLED, 'LIVING SAFELY WITH LEAD' IS DESIGNED TO INCREASE HOME LEAD CONTAINMENT BY DEVELOPING A LEAD HOME AUDIT, A PILOT PROJECT TO EDUCATE LOW INCOME FAMILIES LIVING IN AREAS OF HIGH LEAD CONTAMINATION AND CONDUCT AN AUDIT OF HOMES IN THE AREA.

THE FRANKFORD CREEK WATERSHED IN PHILADELPHIA HAS LONG BEEN ABUSED AND MARGINALIZED, WITH TOO LITTLE PROGRESS FOR THE STREAM OR THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES SINCE THE CLEAN WATER ACT WAS PASSED IN 1972.  LOCAL RESIDENTS REQUEST GREATER ACCOUNTABILITY AND THERE IS NOW A GREATER FOCUS ON THIS WATERSHED, WHICH HAS THE POTENTIAL TO ACCELERATE MEANINGFUL IMPROVEMENTS IN WATER QUALITY AND COMMUNITY HEALTH. THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, THIS WILL INVEST THE LOCAL RESIDENTS' CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY THE PROBLEMS AND SEEK VIABLE SOLUTIONS TO THE PROBLEMS.  CURRENT EFFORTS TO BUILD MOMENTUM AND IMPROVE CONDITIONS CAN BE GREATLY EXPANDED, WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR FISHABLE AND SWIMMABLE USES FOR THE CREEK.

YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDS (YES!) IS A GARDEN-BASED, HANDS-ON ECOLOGICAL LITERACY AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, CREATED WITH CITY SCHOOLYARD GARDEN (CSG) THAT GIVES YOUTH IN CHARLOTTESVILLE, VA OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE IN NATURE THROUGH THE CULTIVATION OF SCHOOLYARD GARDENS, STEWARDSHIP OF NATURAL HABITATS AND APPLICATION OF ECOLOGICAL PRINCIPLES IN EVERYDAY PRACTICE.  WORKING COLLABORATIVELY WITH EACH NEIGHBORHOOD, CSG ADDRESSES THE DUAL PROBLEM OF ADVANCING CITIZEN-LEVEL ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND FOOD ACCESS IN UNDER-RESOURCED COMMUNITIES FROM THE GROUND UP.

GROUNDED STRATEGIES WILL USE A VACANT LOT IN THE ALLENTOWN NEIGHBORHOOD OF PITTSBURGH AS A SITE FOR A NEW LOW-COST METHOD FOR REDUCING THE TOXICITY OF LEAD.  BASED ON SOIL SAMPLING, THE LOT HAS VERY HIGH LEAD LEVELS. FIVE RESIDENTS WILL BE RECRUITED AS AMBASSADORS TO CHAMPION THE PROJECT IN THE COMMUNITY.  THROUGH FOUR EDUCATION SESSIONS RESIDENTS WILL BE TAUGHT HOW TO REDUCE THEIR EXPOSURE, HELP BUILD A LEAD ABATEMENT APPARATUS AND LEARN OTHER LOW-COST LEAD ABATEMENT STRATEGIES BY APPLYING SOIL AMENDMENTS AND PLANTINGS ACROSS THE ENTIRE VACANT LOT.

ESPERANZA, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH PENNSYLVANIA INTERFAITH POWER & LIGHT AND THE PHILADELPHIA OFFICE OF SUSTAIINABILITY, WILL ADDRESS URBAN HEAT INEQUALITIES IN HUNTING PARK--A LOW-INCOME, MAJORITY BLACK AND HISPANIC, AND HEAT VULNERABLE NEIGHBORHOOD IN NORTH PHILADELPHIA--BY ACTIVATING THE CITY'S FIRST COMMUNITY HEAT RELIEF NETWORK.

HEALTHY FAMILIES: HEALTHY HOMES IS AN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORT DESIGNED TO ENGAGE THE LOW INCOME LATINO RESIDENTS OF HIGHLY STRESSED NEIGHBORHOODS OF PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY, MD IN ACTIVITIES TO MITIGATE THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOXINS AND THEIR EFFECTS ON PUBLIC HEALTH PARTICULARLY, HIGH RATES OF PEDIATRIC ASTHMA. THEY WILL UTILIZE THE TRAIN THE TRAINER MODEL IN WHICH CHURCH LEADERS CALLED PROMOTORAS WILL BE TRAINED ON ENVIRONMENTAL TOXIC CHEMICALS AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH AND SEEKING HEALTH ALTERNATIVES.  PROMOTORAS WILL TRAIN LOW INCOME LATINO MEMBERS IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS.  PROMOTORAS WILL ALSO ACT AS RESOURCES AND MENTOR AND SUPPORT RESIDENTS TO ACCESS HEALTH AND SOCIAL RESOURCES OFFERED BY THE COMMUNITY.

THE PATAPSCO LATINO ACTION NETWORK (PLAN) PROJECT SEEKS TO CLEAN-UP MARINE DEBRIS IN THE LOCAL BALTIMORE NEIGHBORHOODS OF BROOKLYN AND CURTIS BAY. THESE NEIGHBORHOODS ARE IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO HIGH LEVELS OF INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY AND THE IMPAIRED PATAPSCO RIVER BRANCH OF BALTIMORE HARBOR. THE PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE USE OF PLAN'S COMMUNITY-LED CONSERVATION MODEL.

PROJECT WILL ENGAGE THE ROCKAWAY, NY COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING STIPENDS TO YOUTH FOR WORKFORCE TRAINING.
