DESCRIPTION:THE IRONBOUND COMMUNITY CORPORATION (ICC) AND ITS PROJECT PARTNER, SOUTH WARD ENVIRONMENTAL ALLIANCE (SWEA), WILL CONDUCT OUTREACH AND RECRUIT NEWARK RESIDENTS TO WORKSHOPS AND TRAINING SESSIONS TO PREPARE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN TRUCK COUNTING DAYS IN NEIGHBORHOODS NEAR THE PORT OF NEWARK, AND TO DEVELOP KNOWLEDGE REGARDING POLLUTION PREVENTION STRATEGIES. THESE TRUCK COUNTS WILL HIGHLIGHT THE TRUCK TRAFFIC AND DIESEL POLLUTION IN RESIDENTS' NEIGHBORHOODS AND WILL BE FOLLOWED BY A REPORT BACK TO THE COMMUNITY TO HELP BUILD A BASE OF RESIDENTS COMMITTED TOWARDS MINIMIZING AIR POLLUTION AND MAXIMIZING COMMUNITY BENEFITS, AND FIGHTING FOR A HEALTHY PORT OF NEWARK. 

ACTIVITIES:IRONBOUND COMMUNITY CORPORATION AND THEIR PROJECT PARTNER SWEA WILL DEVELOP A TRAINING CURRICULUM, AND CONDUCT TRAININGS AND WORKSHOPS TO EDUCATE NEWARK RESIDENTS ABOUT AIR POLLUTION FROM VEHICLES AND AIR QUALITY. RESIDENTS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE TRAININGS WILL CONDUCT TRUCK COUNTS. ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE TOURS WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED TO RESIDENTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.SUBRECIPIENT:THE SUBAWARD WILL BE USED BY SOUTH WARD ENVIRONMENTAL ALLIANCE TO EDUCATE AND TRAIN RESIDENTS ON LOCAL AIR POLLUTION AND TO CONDUCT TRUCK COUNTS IN THEIR LOCAL AREA.OUTCOMES:THE IRONBOUND COMMUNITY CORPORATION (ICC) AND ITS PROJECT PARTNER, SOUTH WARD ENVIRONMENTAL ALLIANCE (SWEA), WILL CONDUCT OUTREACH AND RECRUIT NEWARK RESIDENTS TO WORKSHOPS AND TRAINING SESSIONS TO PREPARE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN TRUCK COUNTING DAYS IN NEIGHBORHOODS NEAR THE PORT OF NEWARK, AND TO DEVELOP KNOWLEDGE REGARDING POLLUTION PREVENTION STRATEGIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE LOCAL RESIDENTS OF NEWARK, NEW JERSEY. THE OUTCOMES OF THIS GRANT WILL BE THE TRUCK COUNTS WHICH WILL HIGHLIGHT THE LOCAL TRUCK TRAFFIC AND POTENTIAL DIESEL POLLUTION IN RESIDENTS' NEIGHBORHOODS. OTHER OUTCOMES WILL BE A BASE OF RESIDENTS COMMITTED TOWARDS MINIMIZING AIR POLLUTION AND MAXIMIZING COMMUNITY BENEFITS AND A REPORT BACK TO THE COMMUNITY THAT WILL BUILD ON EFFORTS TO CREATE A HEALTHY PORT OF NEWARK.

DESCRIPTION:UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES SHOULD HAVE THE SAME OPPORTUNITIES AS ANY OTHER COMMUNITY, INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, ACCESS TO INFORMATION, JOB CREATION/OPPORTUNITIES, A HEALTHY LIVING AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT, OPEN AND GREEN SPACES, AND MUCH MORE. THIS PROJECT INTENDS TO PROVIDE THESE OPPORTUNITIES, THROUGH AND WITH LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTNERS, TO SEVERAL UNDERSERVED, ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN STATEN ISLAND, NY. THIS PROJECT WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND INFORMATION TO THE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESS OWNERS, THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS, BUILD COMMUNITY, AND BEAUTIFY THESE ONCE NEGLECTED AREAS.ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE A SERIES OF FOUNDATION-LEVEL WORKSHOPS TO RESIDENTS OF UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS, WITH A FOCUS IN CLEAN ENERGY. THIS LEARNING SERIES WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH ACCESS TO INFORMATION TO IMPROVE THEIR OWN QUALITY OF LIVING BUT WILL ALSO SERVE AS AN INTRODUCTION TO AN INDUSTRY THAT CURRENTLY OFFERS A HOST OF SUSTAINABLE, ENTRY-LEVEL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, WITH CLEAR CAREER PATHWAYS. PROVIDED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COLLEGE OF STATEN ISLAND/CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, THIS LEARNING SERIES MAY BE A CONDUIT FOR RESIDENTS SEEKING FURTHER, LOW-COST AND GRANT-FUNDED TRAINING AS HVAC TECHNICIANS. CREATE A PUBLIC PARTICIPATION GUIDE OR TOOLKIT TO ENSURE CONTINUED PARTNERSHIPS OF STAKEHOLDERS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. THE BENEFIT WITH PARTICIPATION IS NOT JUST DEVELOPING INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS LIKE FACT SHEETS, BUT TO ENSURE THE COMMUNITY IS ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN ADDRESSING ITS ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS.SUBRECIPIENT:SIEDC IS PARTNERING WITH THE COLLEGE OF STATEN ISLAND'S DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, CONTINUING STUDIES. THE COLLEGE OF STATEN ISLAND WILL DEVELOP AND PROVIDED TRAINING LEVEL INSTRUCTION ON HEAT AND COOLING AND JOB READINESS TRAINING, INCLUDING COMMUNICATION SKILLS, DEPENDABILITY, CUSTOMER SERVICE AND PROBLEM ESCALATION WITH ACCESS TO EPA-608 TEST PREP AND EXAM.OUTCOMES:PRODUCE AND COMPLETE A JOB TRAINING PROGRAM, WILL BENEFIT THE LOCAL COMMUNITY. HOST 7 SESSIONS INCLUDING NOT LIMITED TO IN-PERSON WORKSHOP, EDUCATION, WEBINARS, AND CURRICULUM. HAVE 20 INDIVIDUALS COMPLETE IT. INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE REGARDING TESTING, AIR QUALITY AND OTHER RELATED ITEMS. GOAL TO WORK WITH 5 LOCAL ORGANIZATION, BUSINESSES, STAKEHOLDERS TO PREPARE PARTICIPANTS FOR TESTING, TRAINING. INCREASE IN EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY AS IT PERTAINS TO TESTING AND RELATED AREAS. EPA 608 CERTIFICATION. GOAL TO HAVE 20 INDIVIDUALS CERTIFIED IN CERTIFICATIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO ENABLE WESTERN NEW YORK SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS ROUNDTABLE (SBR) TO PARTNER WITH THE WESTSIDE PROMISE AND BLACK ROCK NEIGHBORHOODS TO BUILD A COLLECTIVE MOVEMENT OF MEANINGFUL ACTION AROUND CLIMATE RESILIENCY. THE APPROACH IS HUMAN-CENTERED, PLACING THE NEEDS, VOICES AND LEADERSHIP OF THOSE WHO ARE MOST IMPACTED AT THE FOREFRONT. THEY WILL BRING TOGETHER THE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS COMMUNITY OUTREACH CAPACITY AND SBR'S ABILITY TO INFLUENCE BUSINESSES TO BECOME PARTNERS IN ACTION. THE MAIN GOALS ARE TO: 1) EDUCATE RESIDENTS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND CLIMATE VULNERABILITY ISSUES IN THEIR COMMUNITY AND THE RESULTING RISKS; FROM A SHORT- MID-, AND LONG-TERM PERSPECTIVE, 2) CREATE ARENAS FOR DIALOGUE AROUND WHAT TYPE OF MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION MEASURES ARE MOST IMPORTANT FROM A COMMUNITY PERSPECTIVE, AND 3) INVOLVE LOCAL BUSINESSES TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY-LED CLIMATE RESILIENCY ACTION. SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A BASE OF ENGAGED RESIDENTS THAT REFLECTS THEIR COMMUNITIES' VOICES, EXPERIENCES, AND PRIORITIES IN CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLANNING, AND A CORE GROUP OF LOCAL, SUSTAINABLE BUSINESSES ASSISTING WITH IMPLEMENTATION OF PRIORITIZED ACTIONS.

NOTE FOR USE OF ARP FUNDS: CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. ACTIVITIES:THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED: ANALYZE AND COMPILE COMMUNITY NEEDS TO DRAFT A CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLAN;  CONDUCT TWO WORKSHOPS AT LOCAL BUSINESSES (15-25 ATTENDEES PER WORKSHOP); CREATE AND DISTRIBUTE EVENT SURVEYS TO WORKSHOP ATTENDEES; PRODUCE 4 ELECTRONIC NEWSLETTERS, 2 VIDEOS, 8 SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS AND 1-2 PAID ADVERTISEMENTS; CREATE A FACT SHEET OUTLINING BEST PRACTICES TO SERVE AS A RESOURCE FOR ORGANIZATIONS (LIKE SBR) TO IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY DRIVEN CLIMATE RESILIENCY AND MITIGATION ACTION SUPPORTED BY LOCAL SUSTAINABLE BUSINESSES, WITH THEIR CONSTITUENCIES; RECRUIT A MINIMUM OF 2 COMPANIES TO PARTICIPATE IN COMMUNITY/ CORPORATE SERVICE CLIMATE ACTION DAYS.SUBRECIPIENT:WESTERN NEW YORK SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS (SBR)'S SUB-GRANTEE, BLACK ROCK RIVERSIDE ALLIANCE (BRRA), IS ONE OF TWO MAIN PARTNERS FOR THE PROJECTS. THE PRIMARY ROLE OF BRRA WILL BE TO
PROVIDE CONNECTIONS TO THE RESIDENTS WITHIN THE WEST SIDE COMMUNITIES WHO WILL PARTICIPATE IN DIALOGUES TO INFORM THE CLIMATE RESILIENCE PLANNING EFFORTS. THE SUB-AWARD WILL COVER TIME SPENT BY BRRA ON RECRUITMENT OF RESIDENTS TO ATTEND THE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS, DISSEMINATION OF MARKETING MATERIALS, USE OF BRRA'S MEETING SPACE FOR ONE OF THE WORKSHOP SERIES AND PRODUCTION AND DATA COLLECTION OF A POST-WORKSHOP SURVEY. BRRA HAS STRONG ROOTS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, MAKING THEM VALUABLE FOR PROVIDING A BRIDGE BETWEEN THE RESIDENTS AND SBR'S NETWORK OF LOCAL, SUSTAINABLE BUSINESSES. THE OTHER PARTNER, WEST SIDE PROMISE NEIGHBORHOOD PROGRAM (WSPN), IS A NON-FUNDED PARTNER. OUTCOMES:KEY OUTPUTS INCLUDE 300 - 500 INDIVIDUALS INVOLVED IN OUR PROJECT ACTIVITIES, A COMMUNITY-DRIVEN CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLAN AND A FACTSHEET. KEY OUTCOMES INCLUDE CHANGES IN KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS AMONG WEST SIDE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES, CHANGES IN BUSINESS PRACTICES, AND EQUITY CENTERED POLICIES IN PLACE. WEST SIDE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES ARE THE BENEFICIARIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT AIMS TO EDUCATE THE REFUGEE COMMUNITY LOCATED IN ROCHESTER, NEW YORK ON THE POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES SURROUNDING LOCAL FISH CONSUMPTION. REFUGEE SUBSISTENCE ANGLERS IN THE ROCHESTER EMBAYMENT AREA OF CONCERN ARE DIFFICULT TO REACH WITH TRADITIONAL FISH HEALTH ADVISORY EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL. THIS MEANS THEY, THEIR FAMILIES AND OTHERS WHO CONSUME THE FISH THEY CATCH ARE PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE TO THE ILL HEALTH EFFECTS OF MIREX, PCBS, DIOXINS AND OTHER WATER POLLUTANTS FOUND IN THIS AREA WHICH AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH THROUGH FISH CONSUMPTION. 

ROCHESTER REFUGEE RESETTLEMENT SERVICES WILL ENGAGE HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE AGED STUDENTS FROM THE REFUGEE COMMUNITY AS SURVEYORS TO COLLECT DATA ON LOCAL FISH CONSUMPTION AND KNOWLEDGE OF FISH CONSUMPTION HEALTH ADVISORIES. THE SURVEY DATA WILL BE ANALYZED AND USED TO DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH STRATEGIES FOR IMPROVED FISH ADVISORY COMMUNICATIONS WITH THIS COMMUNITY. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF ROCHESTER, NEW YORK.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE: TRAIN 12 STUDENT FISH FLASH CARD SURVEYORS AT ONE 3-HR KICKOFF MEETING; CONDUCT 300 FISH FLASH CARD SURVEYS; COLLECT SURVEY RESULTS FROM SURVEYORS AT 6 BIWEEKLY WORKSHOP MEETINGS; ANALYZE FISH FLASH CARD SURVEYS AT 4 BIWEEKLY WORKSHOP MEETINGS; DEVELOP OUTREACH LESSON PLANS AND DESIGN FORMATS/IDENTIFY LEARNING OBJECTIVES AND DEVELOP OUTREACH STRATEGIES AT 6 BIWEEKLY WORKSHOP MEETINGS; EXECUTE THE DEVELOPED EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH STRATEGIES AT 8 EVENTS, REACHING AN AUDIENCE OF 1000 MEMBERS OF THE REFUGEE COMMUNITY; EVALUATE OUTREACH STRATEGIES.SUBRECIPIENT:THERE ARE TWO SUBAWARDS INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT. ONE SUBAWARD, IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,883 WILL GO TO MARY'S PLACE REFUGEE OUTREACH TO PAY FOR 23% OF THE TIME OF ONE EXPERIENCED EDUCATOR AND OUTREACH COORDINATOR TO ASSIST RECRUITING, COORDINATING, AND ASSISTING TWELVE YOUNG ADULTS FLUENT IN ENGLISH AND THEIR FAMILY'S PRIMARY LANGUAGE TO ACT AS SURVEYORS USING THE 'FISH FLASH CARD' SURVEY. THE MARY'S PLACE EMPLOYEE, ALONG WITH TWO RRRS EMPLOYEES AND THE PROJECT MANAGER, JEFF WYATT, DVM, MPH (UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AND DENTISTRY) WILL ASSIST THE 'FISH FLASH CARD' SURVEYORS IN STATISTICAL ANALYSIS OF THE SURVEY DATA. 

A SECOND SUBAWARD, IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,580 WILL GO TO THE SENECA PARK ZOOLOGICAL SOCIETY TO PAY FOR 11.5% OF THE TIME OF TWO EDUCATION SPECIALISTS WHO WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON CRAFTING OUTREACH PLATFORMS TO INFORM THE REFUGEE COMMUNITY OF AGE- AND GENDER-SPECIFIC HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH CONSUMING SELECT FISH SPECIES FROM THE ROCHESTER EMBAYMENT AOC AND LAKE ONTARIO. THE TWO SENECA PARK ZOO EDUCATION SPECIALISTS WILL WORK WITH THE TEAM OF SUPERVISORS/MENTORS FROM MARY'S PLACE AND RRRS, THE TWELVE SURVEYORS, DR. WYATT, AND ANTHONY PETRUSO, MD, A PHYSICIAN AT THE CENTER FOR REFUGEE HEALTH (CRH) TO DESIGN AN IMPACTFUL OUTREACH PLATFORM, INCLUDING TARGETED LESSON PLANS, PUBLIC AND WEB-BASED PRESENTATIONS AND PAMPHLETS AND POSTERS FOR THE CRH CLINIC WAITING ROOM ACCESSIBLE TO FAMILIES AND USEFUL FOR HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS TO SHARE DURING PATIENT VISITS. 
OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES FROM THIS PROJECT ARE THE OUTREACH ACTIVITIES THAT ARE DEVELOPED FROM THE SURVEY AND DATA ANALYSIS. OUTREACH STRATEGIES WILL BE DETERMINED BASED ON THE CONCLUSIONS FROM ANALYSIS OF THE SURVEY DATA. THEY ARE EXPECTED TO INCLUDE BROCHURES (IN ENGLISH AND IN REFUGEES' NATIVE LANGUAGES) AND COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE: INCREASED REFUGEE COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF SAFE FISH CONSUMPTION ADVISORIES, DECREASED HAZARDOUS FISH CONSUMPTION BY CHILDREN AND CHILDBEARING AGE WOMEN, REDUCED RISK OF LIFELONG COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENTS AND ENDOCRINE DISRUPTION FROM CHILDHOOD OR FETAL EXPOSURE TO CONTAMINANTS IN FISH, AND REDUCED CANCER RISK IN WOMEN. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF ROCHESTER, NY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO TRAIN UNDESERVED, DIVERSE STUDENTS AND RESIDENTS OF RIVERHEAD AND RIVERSIDE, NEW YORK ABOUT WATER AND AIR QUALITY ISSUES AFFECTING THEIR COMMUNITY.  THROUGH WATER QUALITY SAMPLING AND AIR MONITORING, RESIDENCE WILL LEARN ABOUT THE HEALTH OF THEIR LOCAL ECOSYSTEM AND AIR QUALITY. THE PLACE FOR LEARNING INTENDS TO PROVIDE HANDS-ON FIELD EXPLORATION AND DATA COLLECTION PROGRAMS IN BOTH ENGLISH AND SPANISH TO CREATE AN ACCESSIBLE BI-LINGUAL COMMUNITY RESOURCE AND TEACHING TOOL THAT WILL CREATE A JOB PIPELINE FOR PARTICIPANTS.  ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDES WATER QUALITY TESTING FOR THE PRESENCE OF CYANOBACTERIA AND WATER QUALITY, AIR QUALITY MONITORING FOR PM 2.5, CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL TOURS IN THE COMMUNITY EDUCATING THE STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY RESIDENTS ON WATER QUALITY ISSUES AND HEALTH EFFECTS, AND SEARCH FOR POTENTIAL AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES. ALSO, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF HOW CRITICAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES IMPACT THE HEALTH OF RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEMS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS ARE TO INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF THE WATER AND AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND THEIR POTENTIAL HEALTH EFFECTS, DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL CONTENT FOR STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS FOR BOTH IN-PERSON AND ONLINE. A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS MAPPING SYSTEM WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR THE PUBLIC TO VIEW THE RESULTS OF THE WATER AND AIR MONITORING SAMPLES.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE STUDENTS AND RESIDENTS OF RIVERHEAD AND RIVERSIDE, NEW YORK.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO TRAIN YOUTH LEADERS IN THE SOUTH BRONX SECTION OF THE BRONX, NEW YORK ON THE POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH EFFECTS OF AIR QUALITY AND HOW TO MITIGATE AIR POLLUTION IN THEIR COMMUNITY.   IN ADDITION, YOUTH MINISTRIES FOR PEACE AND JUSTICE, YMPJ, WILL CONDUCT AN ANALYSIS OF AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTED IN THE SOUTH BRONX TO DETERMINE CORRELATION BETWEEN SOUTH BRONX AIR QUALITY, AIR POLLUTION, RESPIRATORY ILLNESS AND THE LINK BETWEEN AIR QUALITY AND COVID-TRANSMISSION AND POOR HEALTH. THE RESULT OF THE ANALYSIS WILL BE WIDELY DISSEMINATED, IN THE FORM OF TRAININGS, SPEAKER SERIES; PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES, AND A VIRTUAL SYMPOSIUM, TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND TO PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH CONTINUED EDUCATION ON THE CAUSES AND DELETERIOUS EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION INCLUDING COVID-19 AND THE STEPS COMMUNITY MEMBERS CAN TAKE TO PROTECT THEMSELVES FROM AIR POLLUTION EXPOSURE AND POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTH BRONX SECTION OF THE BRONX, NEW YORK.
ACTIVITIES:YMPJ HAS COLLECTED HYPER-LOCAL AIR QUALITY DATA IN THE SOUTH BRONX SINCE 2009. THEY WILL NOW ANALYZE THIS DATA TO UNDERSTAND THE SPECIFIC CONNECTION BETWEEN SOUTH BRONX AIR QUALITY, INCIDENCE OF RESPIRATORY CONDITIONS, AND LINKS TO COVID-19 TRANSMISSION/OUTCOMES. YMPJ WILL INFORM SOUTH BRONX RESIDENTS OF THE AIR POLLUTION AND EFFECTS ON RESPIRATORY HEALTH, WHAT CAN BE DONE TO INCREASE AIR QUALITY, AND STEPS COMMUNITY MEMBERS CAN TAKE TO PROTECT THEMSELVES FROM AIR POLLUTANTS INCLUDING COVID-19. YMPJ WILL TRAIN 60 YOUTH LEADERS, AGES 14-24, ON THE DELETERIOUS EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION ON RESPIRATORY HEALTH CONDITIONS INCLUDING COVID-19. A SIGNIFICANT FOCUS OF THE TRAINING SESSIONS WILL BE THE RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES FACED BY SOUTH BRONX COMMUNITIES AND WHAT COMMUNITIES, NYC, NYS, AND THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT CAN DO TO MITIGATE AIR POLLUTION. YMPJ WILL CONDUCT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO INFORM SOUTH BRONX RESIDENTS AND ALLAY FEARS ABOUT COVID 19 VACCINES AND BOOSTER SHOTS, AND INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE DETRIMENTAL EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION. YMPJ COMMUNITY OUTREACH SPECIALISTS WILL BE EQUIPPED TO HELP MAKE APPOINTMENTS ON THE SPOT USING INTERNET-ACCESSIBLE TABLETS. TO CULMINATE THE PROJECT, YMPJ WILL HOST A VIRTUAL SYMPOSIUM TO SHARE AIR QUALITY DATA AND COMMUNITY HEALTH ANALYSIS.SUBRECIPIENT:YMPJ WILL PROVIDE A SUBAWARD TO HABITATMAP, WHICH IS A NON-PROFIT BUILDING ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING AND DATA VISUALIZATION TOOLS THAT EMPOWER ORGANIZATIONS AND CITIZEN SCIENTISTS. THEY FOCUS ON LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES AND COMMUNITIES OF COLOR LIVING WITH DISPROPORTIONATE ENVIRONMENTAL BURDENS. MICHAEL HEIMBINDER, FOUNDER AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, INVENTED THE AIRBEAM AND AIRCAST 5 TECHNOLOGY ESSENTIAL TO THIS PROJECT. HABITAT MAP WILL SUPPORT THE PROJECT BY ANALYZING THE AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTED BY YMPJ SINCE 2009 AND OVERLAYING THE AIR QUALITY DATA WITH PUBLIC HEALTH DATA INCLUDING COVID-19 TRANSMISSION AND SEVERITY RATES TO DETERMINE CORRELATIONS, AND INCIDENCE OF OTHER RESPIRATORY ISSUES. THEY WILL ALSO ASSIST IN DEVELOPING THE QAPP REQUIRED FOR THIS PROJECT. FINALLY, HABITAT MAP WILL CONTRIBUTE KEY GUEST SPEAKERS AT THE NEIGHBORHOOD COALITION STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATE IN THE CULMINATING SYMPOSIUM. THEY HAVE A VESTED INTEREST IN THE PROJECT'S SUCCESS AND WILL CONTINUE COLLABORATING WITH YMPJ AS WE APPLY THEIR TECHNOLOGY TO PURSUE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE GOALS.OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT ARE: AIR QUALITY AND COVID-19 'FAST FACTS', SOCIAL MEDIA POST INCORPORATING THE FAST FACTS AND ENGAGING THE LOCAL COMMUNITY IN A DISCUSSION AROUND AIR QUALITY AND COVID-19, A COMPARISON OF SOUTH BRONX AND NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES' DATA TO IDENTIFY DISPARATE AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH IMPACTS, A VIRTUAL SYMPOSIUM FOCUSING ON AIR QUALITY, COVID-19 OUTCOMES, AND COMMUNITY, LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL ACTIONS THAT MUST BE TAKEN TO IMPROVE CONDITIONS IN THE SOUTH BRONX, A

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ENSURE A HEALTHY AND RESILIENT ROCKAWAY BY CREATING SHORE CORPS - AN INTERNSHIP PROGRAM TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY YOUTH IN LEARNING ABOUT STEWARDSHIP AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION PROJECTS. SHORE CORPS IS A PAID 'GREEN' INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY FOR HIGH SCHOOLERS TO GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE THROUGH TREE MAINTENANCE, ORGANIZED BEACH CLEAN UPS, AND DUNE RESTORATION, ALONGSIDE CRITICAL WORKFORCE AND LEADERSHIP TRAINING, TO PROTECT AND SUSTAIN THE ROCKAWAY PENINSULA. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, STUDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL CAREER PATHS AND BUILD THEIR PROFESSIONAL NETWORKS THROUGH MENTORS IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND CONSERVATION RELATED FIELDS. THE PLANNED ACTIVITIES ALSO AIM TO BRING THE COMMUNITY CLOSER TOGETHER THROUGH COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PARTICIPATION TO NOT ONLY INVOLVE THE YOUTH OF THE COMMUNITY BUT ALSO THEIR FAMILY, FRIENDS, AND NEIGHBORS. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO INCORPORATE VACCINE EDUCATION TO TACKLE THE URGENT HEALTH DISPARITIES IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, IN PARTICULAR RAISING AWARENESS ABOUT THE SAFETY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF COVID-19 VACCINE TO THE COMMUNITY. CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. ACTIVITIES:THERE WILL BE OUTREACH PERFORMED THROUGH FLYERS AT LOCAL SCHOOLS, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND RISE'S E-NEWSLETTER TO RECRUIT STUDENTS INTO THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM. ONCE SELECTED, STUDENT INTERNS WILL PARTICIPATE IN HANDS-ON PROJECTS TO HONE THEIR ACADEMIC AND CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS ALONGSIDE PROFESSIONAL MENTORS IN STEM-RELATED FIELDS. THEY WILL WORK ON CONSERVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING DUNE RESTORATION, TREE MAINTENANCE, AND BEACH CLEAN UPS. FROM THESE PROJECTS, INTERNS WILL LEARN ABOUT ROOT NETWORK AND SAND EROSION, PLANT BUSHES, AND ENGAGE WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY ON THEIR WORK. STUDENTS WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH TO INFORM THE COMMUNITY ABOUT COVID-19 AND VACCINES WHICH WILL CONSIST OF IN-PERSON OUTREACH AT EVENTS AND THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES TO REACH THE WHOLE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION TO HANDS-ON TRAININGS, STUDENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN PROFESSIONAL TRAININGS TO HONE THEIR SOFT SKILLS WHICH INCLUDES INTERVIEW PREP AND AWARENESS OF TIME LIKE PUNCTUALITY, ATTENDANCE, AND MEETING DEADLINES. THE STUDENTS WILL ALSO GET SUPPORT FOR COLLEGE APPLICATION PROCESS AND WILL TOUR SOME OF THE LOCAL COLLEGES IN NYC. THERE WILL BE A ONE-DAY CONFERENCE AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM FOR THE STUDENT, LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND STAKEHOLDERS, AND PARTNERS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE TO: 1) TRAIN 40 LOCAL YOUTH IN ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION AND LEADERSHIP; 2) ENGAGE AT LEAST 400 LOCAL RESIDENTS IN 4 PLANTINGS AND CLEANUPS; 3) STABILIZE 2 MILES OF DUNE SYSTEMS ALONG THE ATLANTIC OCEAN THROUGH THE PLANTING OF 20,000 SPRIGS OF GRASSES AND 140 BUSHES TO BETTER WITHSTAND WAVE ACTION, STORMS, AND EROSION; 4) INCREASE LONG-TERM EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS, CLIMATE CHANGE AWARENESS, AND COVID-19 VACCINATION EDUCATION AND ACCESS FOR LOCAL RESIDENTS THROUGH TARGETED OUTREACH AND A ONE-DAY COMMUNITY CONFERENCE. THE PROGRAM WILL END WITH A ONE-DAY MINI-CONFERENCE WITH AT LEAST 75 ATTENDEES IN AUGUST OF 2022. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE ROCKAWAY PENINSULA IN QUEENS, NEW YORK BUT WILL TARGET THE PREDOMINANTLY VERY LOW TO MODERATE INCOME COMMUNITIES OF COLOR ON THE EASTERN END OF THE PENINSULA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO EDUCATE UNDERSERVED TEENS LOCATED IN THE BRONX, NEW YORK ON HOW TO REDUCE SOLID WASTE THROUGH WASTE MANAGEMENT AND BROADENING THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THROUGH HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE, VAN CORTLANDT PARK ALLIANCE, INC WILL EDUCATE PROJECT PARTICIPANTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT BY COLLECTING AND PROCESSING SCRAPS IN COMPOST BINS, DEMONSTRATE SUSTAINABLE GARDENING PRACTICES, AND HOSTING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ON COMPOSTING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDES COMPOSTING AND REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF SOLID WASTE THROUGH PUBLIC EDUCATION AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS.
ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COLLECTING MARKET FOOD SCRAPS PROCESSING; AND HOSTING EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING PROGRAMS ON COMPOSTING, TO INCREASE AWARENESS FOR THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY.  EDUCATING YOUTH INTERNS ON FOOD JUSTICE/SECURITY ISSUES, WHICH WILL POSITIVELY IMPACT THE COMMUNITY TO BE SELF-SUFFICIENT WHEN FOOD ACCESSIBILITY IS DISRUPTED DURING A PANDEMIC, AND GROWING PRODUCE TO DONATE TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.  THE INTERNSHIP WILL INCLUDE PROJECTS RELATED TO THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA), SECTION 103(B)(3) BY PROVIDING EDUCATION ABOUT AND OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP ADDRESS FOOD JUSTICE/SECURITY ISSUES AND IMPROVING AIR QUALITY BY THEREFORE REDUCING MILES BETWEEN FOOD PRODUCTION AND FOOD CONSUMPTION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOME AND OUTPUTS IS TO INCREASE THE COMMUNITY COMPOSTING AND GARDENING, PROVIDING HEALTHY FOOD OPTIONS TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS.  THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM WILL BE HIGHLY BENEFICIAL BOTH TO THE YOUNG PEOPLE RUNNING THE MARKET AND THE COMMUNITY SERVED BY IT.  BY RUNNING THE MARKET, WHICH INCLUDES DECISION-MAKING RELATED TO SOURCING AND PURCHASING PRODUCE, INTERNS ARE INTRODUCED TO ISSUES OF FOOD JUSTICE, FOOD INSECURITY, AND NUTRITION.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE STUDENTS, RESIDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE OF THE VAN CORTLAND PARK AND SURROUNDING AREA IN NEW YORK.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS FOR ASLF AND ITS PARTNERS TO PLAN, DESIGN, AND INSTALL SIX AGROFORESTRY DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS AND A COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAM FOCUSING ON THE MYRIAD ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL BENEFITS ASSOCIATED WITH SAID PRACTICE. FIVE OF THE SIX DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS WILL BE LOCATED IN IMPOVERISHED URBAN SYRACUSE NEIGHBORHOODS AND WILL TAKE THE FORM OF URBAN FOOD FORESTS. THE SIXTH DEMONSTRATION WILL BE INSTALLED ON A FARM OWNED BY THE ONONDAGA NATION AND WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO ITS BRAIDING THE SACRED PROGRAM, WHICH FOCUSES ON PRESERVING INDIGENOUS NATIVE FOOD PLANTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUILDING FOOD SOVEREIGNTY. OUTREACH AND EDUCATION WILL FOCUS ON COMMUNICATING THE BENEFITS OF AGROFORESTRY AND NATIVE URBAN TREES AS THEY RELATE TO STORMWATER MITIGATION, AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, FOOD SECURITY, GREENSPACE ACCESS, URBAN HEAT ISLAND MITIGATION, URBAN RESILIENCE, AND PSYCHO-SOCIAL STRESS RELIEF.ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT HAS OUTREACH/EDUCATION AND DEMONSTRATION COMPONENTS, AND ACTIVITIES WILL BE BASED ON ACCOMPLISHING OUTCOMES DERIVED FROM THESE. ACTIVITIES ARE DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS:
- OUTREACH/EDUCATION/ADVANCING AWARENESS - ASLF WILL WORK WITH PARTNERS TO ADVANCE AWARENESS OF HOW AGROFORESTRY AND FOOD FORESTS ARE AN IMPORTANT PART OF RESTORATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, URBAN RESILIENCE, IMPROVING NEARBY GREENSPACES, FOOD SECURITY/SOVEREIGNTY, STORMWATER MITIGATION, AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, URBAN HEAT ISLAND REDUCTION, PSYCHO-SOCIAL STRESS RELIEF, AND PREVENTION OF CHRONIC DISEASE. THIS WILL BE DONE WITH MEETINGS/PRESENTATIONS WITH EACH PARTNER AND THEIR CONSTITUENCY, GENERAL INFORMATIONAL PRESENTATIONS EITHER VIRTUALLY OR IN-PERSON, MEETINGS AT OTHER STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS INVOLVING MUNICIPAL DECISION-MAKERS, NATIVE TREE PLANTING AND CARE WORKSHOPS, DOOR-TO-DOOR OUTREACH, CREATION OF INFORMATIONAL BROCHURES, CREATION OF INFORMATIVE SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, INFORMATION POSTED ON THE ASLF AND PARTNER WEBSITES, AND A CASE STUDY PAPER WRITTEN ON THE PROJECT. ALL OF THESE OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WILL RESULT IN GREATER AWARENESS OF THE BENEFITS OF AGROFORESTRY AND FOOD FORESTS AT MULTIPLE LEVELS, FROM LAY COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO MUNICIPAL AGENCY DECISION-MAKERS. A MAJOR GOAL IS TO NORMALIZE THE EXPECTATION OF FOOD FORESTS FOR ALMOST EVERY LOCAL PROJECT INVOLVING PUBLICLY-ACCESSIBLE GREENSPACE. AFTER COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT A MUCH GREATER PORTION OF THE LOCAL PUBLIC SHOULD KNOW AND WANT FOOD FORESTS TO BE INTEGRATED INTO THE URBAN FABRIC OF SYRACUSE. 
- DESIGN, PLANNING, AND INSTALLATION OF DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS - ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DEMONSTRATION PROJECT COMPONENT INCLUDE: INITIAL PLANNING AND SITE ANALYSIS FOR PROJECT SITES, DESIGN MEETINGS WITH PARTNERS TO ENSURE INVOLVEMENT AND INPUT, TIME SPENT ON DESIGN WORK AND PLANTING PLANS, ORDERING AND PURCHASE OF NATIVE TREES, SHRUBS, AND OTHER PLANTING SUPPLIES, MANAGEMENT AND SCHEDULING OF PLANTING EVENTS, EXECUTING PLANTING EVENTS FOR ALL PROJECT SITES, INITIAL WATERING AND POST-PLANTING MAINTENANCE. FOLLOW UP AND CONTINUED CARE/MAINTENANCE OF PLANTING SITES WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO OUTREACH AND EDUCATION WITH PARTNERS. SUBRECIPIENT:A SUBAWARD WILL SUPPORT AGROFORESTRY DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS TO EXPLORE APPROACHES TO ADDRESSING VARIOUS ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTING UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE WESTSIDE AND SOUTHSIDE NEIGHBORHOODS OF SYRACUSE AND MEMBERS OF THE ONONDAGA NATION IN TOWN OF ONONDAGA. THE DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE THE PLANTING OF NATIVE TREES AND WILL FOCUS ON COMMUNICATING THE BENEFITS OF AGROFORESTRY AND NATIVE URBAN TREES AS THEY RELATE TO STORMWATER MITIGATION, AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, FOOD SECURITY, GREENSPACE ACCESS, URBAN HEAT ISLAND MITIGATION, URBAN RESILIENCE, AND PSYCHO-SOCIAL STRESS RELIEF.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MEETINGS AND PRESENTATIONS FOR EDUCATING AND PROMOTING AGROFORESTRY AND FOOD FORESTS, AND BENEFITS FOR WATER,

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO COLLABORATIVELY DESIGN, CONDUCT, AND SHARE LOCAL COMMUNITY-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL VALUES ADVANCING AT-RISK COMMUNITIES (EVAAC) TRAININGS ON INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR POLLUTION AND TOXIC CHEMICALS RELATED TO INDOOR AIR POLLUTION THAT WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITIES WITH ON-THE-GROUND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND UTILIZE A CONSENSUS-BASED COMMUNITY MAPPING APPROACH INNOVATED BY REPRESENTABLE TO REFLECT COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK WILL FORM COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDERS AND HOST TRAINING ACTIVITIES TO EDUCATE, ENGAGE, AND EMPOWER THEM ON LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH DISPARITIES RELATED TO AIR POLLUTION AND DISCUSS OPTIONS TO ADDRESS OR MITIGATE PRIORITIZED AIR POLLUTION ISSUES.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INVOLVE PUBLIC EDUCATION THROUGH TRAININGS, USE OF THE REPRESENTABLE TOOL TO IDENTIFY AND BUILD COMMUNITIES OF INTEREST, AND EMPOWERING PEOPLE. CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK, ALONG WITH CAPITAL AREA URBAN LEAGUE AND OTHER COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES, WILL HOLD 2-3 PRELIMINARY CONVERSATIONS TO SHARE KNOWN INFORMATION ABOUT EXISTING AND POTENTIAL AIR POLLUTION AND TOXICS SOURCES, EXPLORE FEDERAL DATA ON AIR POLLUTION, TOXICS, AND RELATED HEALTH IMPACTS USING THE EPA EJ MAPPER TOOL, AND ASSESS ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY INFORMATION NEEDS SO EXISTING DATA CAN BE COMPILED DURING A LITERATURE REVIEW. 10-20 TRAINING MEETINGS WITH RESIDENTS, ELECTED OFFICIALS, BUSINESS AND RELIGIOUS LEADERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE PLANNED AND HELD TO PRESENT INFORMATION ABOUT AIR POLLUTION AND TOXICS USING A COMBINATION OF PARTICIPANT QUESTIONS, A DEVELOPED SLIDE DECK, AND A PROCESS CREATED BY REPRESENTABLE. 'COMMUNITIES OF INTEREST' AND COMMON PRIORITIES AMONG THE DIFFERENT CHALLENGES FACING THE IMPACTED COMMUNITY WILL BE IDENTIFIED. AFTER THE TRAINING MEETINGS, ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH INFORMATION IDENTIFIED FOR PRIORITIZATION WILL BE CURATED. MAPS, ALONG WITH AN EDUCATIONAL BROCHURE AND INFOGRAPHIC, WILL BE CREATED. CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK WILL WORK WITH AN ACCREDITED TEACHER TO TRANSLATE TRAINING CONTENT INTO AN EDUCATIONAL CURRICULUM FOR K-12 STUDENTS THAT WILL BE SHARED WITH TEACHERS IN THE CITY AND THE NYS UNITED TEACHERS. THESE MATERIALS AND INFORMATION ABOUT AIR POLLUTION PRIORITIES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHANGE WILL BE SHARED WITH TRAINING MEETING PARTICIPANTS, THEIR ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE BROADER COMMUNITY VIA CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK'S WEBSITE, SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES, AND TABLES/BOOTHS AT MAJOR CULTURAL EVENTS IN ALBANY, NEW YORK. SUBRECIPIENT:CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK WILL PROVIDE CAPITAL AREA URBAN LEAGUE, A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION, A SUBAWARD FOR STAFF TIME TO HELP BRAINSTORM, PLAN TRAININGS, TRAIN PROJECT LEADERS ABOUT THE REPRESENTABLE TOOL FOR COMMUNITY MAPPING, ENGAGE IN OUTREACH AND PARTICIPATE IN/FACILITATE TRAINING MEETINGS WITH STAKEHOLDERS AND TEAM MEMBERS, RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS AND ORGANIZATIONS, REVIEW MATERIALS, AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK. CLEAN AND HEALTHY NEW YORK WILL ALSO PROVIDE SUBAWARDS TO APPROXIMATELY THREE OTHER OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS FOR THEIR TIME CONDUCTING WORK SUCH AS PLANNING, ATTENDING EVENTS, PROVIDING FEEDBACK, ENGAGING THEIR MEMBERSHIP, AND HELPING DESIGN AND THEN REVIEW WRITTEN DOCUMENTS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED PROJECT DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A CURATED LITERATURE SEARCH COMPILING PRIORITIZED INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR POLLUTION DATA, A SLIDE DECK AND REPRESENTABLE QUESTIONS FOR TRAINING MEETINGS, TRAINING MEETING SCHEDULES AND REGISTRATION FORMS, POST-SURVEYS, CALENDARS, A MAP TO ILLUSTRATE PRIORITIZED ENVIRONMENTAL DATA, A MAP TO DOCUMENT THE OUTCOME OF THE REPRESENTABLE PROCESS, LESSON PLANS FOR K-12 STUDENTS, AND MATERIALS (MAPS, BROCHURE, AND INFOGRAPHIC) TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT PRIORITIZED CONCERNS. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO ENABLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS, INCLUDING TEACHERS AND STUDENTS, TO IDENTIFY 'COMMUNITIES OF INTEREST' USING REPRESENTABLE, PLAY AN INTEGRAL ROLE IN PRIORITIZING ENVIR

DESCRIPTION:GROUNDWORK ELIZABETH (GWE), ITS PROJECT PARTNERS AND SUBAWARD RECIPIENT WILL BRING TOGETHER A DIVERSE COALITION OF COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS THAT WILL INCREASE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) MONITORING, DEFINE PM HEALTH COSTS IN ELIZABETH (NEAR PORT-ELIZABETH MARINE TERMINAL), EXPLORE BIODIESEL AS A STRATEGY TO REDUCE EMISSIONS, AND DEVELOP A COMMUNITY ACTION PLAN FOR REDUCING PM IN THE COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY AND ITS HEALTH EFFECTS IN THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:GROUNDWORK ELIZABETH (GWE) AND ITS SUBAWARD RECIPIENT WILL DEPLOY AIR MONITORS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY TO MONITOR PM LEVELS AROUND THE PORT. THE CONTRACT RECIPIENT WILL MODEL THE IMPACTS OF DIESEL PM WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND THE BENEFITS OF SWITCHING TO ALTERNATIVE FUELS.  SUBRECIPIENT:THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH SCIENCE INSTITUTE (EOSHI) AND THE CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EXPOSURE AND DISEASE (CEED) WITHIN RUTGERS UNIVERSITY WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR IMPROVED CHARACTERIZATION OF LOCAL AIR QUALITY FOCUSED ON PARTICULATE MATTER AND DIESEL EXHAUST AIR POLLUTION. THEY WILL ASSIST WITH DEVELOPMENT OF A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP), TRAINING OF GWE STAFF AND GREEN TEAMS ON FUNDAMENTALS OF AIR POLLUTION AND HEALTH, SITING AND DEPLOYMENT OF PURPLE AIR MONITORS, TROUBLESHOOTING THE MONITORS, AND ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION OF DATA.OUTCOMES:THE PM MONITORING WILL HELP DEFINE PM HEALTH COSTS IN ELIZABETH (NEAR PORT-ELIZABETH MARINE TERMINAL). THE CONTRACTED STUDY WILL EXPLORE BIODIESEL AS A STRATEGY TO REDUCE EMISSIONS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE COMMUNITY NEAR THE PORT-ELIZABETH MARINE TERMINAL.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE: 1) CONDUCT A HEALTHY HOMES SURVEY AND A HEALTH FOCUSED LIFESTYLES SURVEY; 2) ENHANCE THE ONGOING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM; 3) PERFORM AMBIENT (ATMOSPHERIC) RADON MONITORING AND TO MONITOR FOR OTHER TOXIC AIR POLLUTANTS (E.G., VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS) AND 4) DEVELOP A WHITE MESA EPIDEMIOLOGICAL STUDY PLAN, INCLUSIVE OF AMBIENT RADON MONITORING AND INVESTIGATION OF OTHER TOXIC AIR POLLUTANTS. 

 .
ACTIVITIES:
MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY HAVE SUFFERED FROM CANCER AND NATIVE AMERICANS HAVE A HIGHER DEGREE OF ASTHMA THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. THE TRIBE HAS CORRESPONDED WITH THE 
ALBUQUERQUE AREA INDIAN HEALTH BOARD EPIDEMIOLOGY CENTER OVER THE LAST THREE YEARS AND THE INITIAL HEALTHY HOMES AND LIFESTYLES WORK HAS BEEN RECOMMENDED. PAIRING THIS 
WITH PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE ON EPIDEMIOLOGICAL PLANNING, WE INTEND TO IDENTIFY THE SPECIFIC MECHANISMS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS OF WHITE MESA AND 
WHETHER THE MILL IS IMPACTING PUBLIC HEALTH. WITH THE FUTURE OF MILL ACTIVITIES UNCERTAIN, BUT LIKELY TO CONTINUE INDEFINITELY INTO THE NEXT DECADES, THIS WILL BE A STARTING POINT FOR 
MORE RIGOROUS INVESTIGATIONS IN THE FUTURE. AFTER APPROVAL TO A PETITION FROM THE TRIBE IN 2019, THE AGENCY FOR TOXIC SUBSTANCES AND DISEASE REGISTRY (ATSDR) HAS BEEN 5
REVIEWING DOCUMENTATION AND TRIBAL AIR MONITORING DATA TO OBTAIN RISK TO HEALTH EFFECTS FROM THE MILL TO THE WHITE MESA COMMUNITY. THE ATSDR REPORT IS EXPECTED TO BE 
FINISHED IN THE NEXT SIX MONTHS. THIS WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL CONTEXT IN GUIDING THE EPIDEMIOLOGICAL WORK PROPOSED TO BE PLANNED IN THIS PROJECT.
OUTCOMES:
THE GRANTEE WILL ENGAGE IN A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM WHICH WILL RESULT IN AN INCREASE IN COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AN INCREASE IN INVOLVEMENT WITH LOCAL OFFICIALS AND STAKE HOLDERS.  THE HEALTH EFFECTS FROM URANIUM MILL WILL BE UNDERSTAND BY ALL STAKEHOLDERS. THE GRANTEE WILL COMPLETE A HEALTHY HOMES STUDY (INDOOR RADON) AND COMPLETE A HEALTH-BASED LIFESTYLE SURVEY. ONCE THE RADON TEST IS IMPLEMENTED, THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF POTENTIAL HEALTH IMPACT VECTORS.  ONCE THE DATA IS COLLECTED, INFORMATION SHARED, AND THE GRANTEE WILL HELP IDENTIFY RESOURCES TO ADDRESS IN-HOME HEALTH VECTORS.  THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE BETTER HOUSING AWARENESS OF IN-HOME HEALTH VECTORS, CHANGES TO HOME HEALTH ISSUES. THE GRANTEE WILL IMPLEMENT AMBIENT AIR QUALITY TESTING.  THE COMMUNITY WILL HAVE A BETTER KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY RISKS. THE GRANTEE WILL DEVELOP AN EPA LIBRARY AND VIRTUAL MEDIA DEVELOPMENT ON URANIUM HEALTH EFFECTS.  THIS WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND AN ACTIVE SPACE TO ARCHIVE MATERIALS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITY FOR INCREASED KNOWLEDGE. THE GRANTEE WILL BUILD A GROUNDWATER EXHIBIT.  THIS WILL LEAD TO COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF LOCAL GROUNDWATER. THE GRANTEE WILL GATHER URANIUM MILL DATA  AND DO AN UP TO DATE ASSESSMENT OF MILL POLLUTANTS AND REGULATORY ACTIONS.  THIS WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED LINES OF COMMUNICATION WITH REGULATORS, AND CHANGES IN REGULATORY DECISIONS THAT INCORPORATE TRIBAL PERSPECTIVES. FINALLY THE GRANTEE WILL BEGIN THE EPIDEMIOLOGICAL STUDY PLANNING.  THIS RESULT IN THE CONDUCTING OF EPIDEMIOLOGICAL STUDY OF WHITE MESA RESIDENTS.  THOSE IMPACTED BY THESE ACTIONS INCLUDE, IHS, UTAH HEALTH BOARD, TRIBAL MEMBERS, TRIBAL LEADERS, NON-TRIBAL PARTNERS, REGULATORS WHITE MESA AND LOCAL RESIDENTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSAL BEGINS BY CONDUCTING LISTENING SESSIONS (INITIAL, AND SUBSEQUENT CONTINUOUS SESSIONS THROUGHOUT GRANT AWARD PERIOD) TO CONDUCT A NEEDS ASSESSMENT THROUGH EPA'S COMMUNITY ACTION ROADMAP (CAR) OF WHAT THE COMMUNITY NEEDS ARE AND USE THE RESULTS TO ASSESS KNOWLEDGE GAPS REGARDING IMPACTS OF THE INLAND PORT. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CONDUCT 'EJ PRIMER' TRAININGS WITH THE COMMUNITY TO PROMOTE COORDINATION AND TRAINING RELATED TO THE CAUSES AND POTENTIAL IMPACTS OF THE INLAND PORT (OZONE AND PARTICULATE MATTER). RELATEDLY, THE PROPOSAL WILL DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS (WEBSITE, BROCHURES) TO FURTHER FOSTER EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF THE PUBLIC RELATED TO THE IMPACTS/CAUSES OF AIR POLLUTION. THEREFORE, THE FOCUS IS ON OUTREACH/TRAINING/EDUCATION THROUGH LISTENING SESSIONS AND CONDUCT OF A NEEDS ASSESSMENT FROM THE COMMUNITY. THE OUTCOMES FOR THIS WORK WILL BE A MORE FULLY ENGAGED COMMUNITY ABLE TO SHARE ITS CONCERNS REGARDING THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONSEQUENCES OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE INLAND PORT.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE LISTENING SESSIONS, A NEEDS ASSESSMENT USING THE COMMUNITY ACTION ROADMAP, AN ANALYSIS OF THE KNOWLEDGE GAPS REGARDING PORT IMPACTS. ,EJ PRIMER' TRAININGS WITH THE COMMUNITY WILL BE CONDUCTED. THE GRANTEE WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS (WEBSITE, AND BROCHURES) AND USE THESE TO FURTHER EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY RE: ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES RELATED TO THE PORT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE,: BROCHURE, VIDEOS AND FACT SHEETS, LISTENING SESSION REPORTS, A ROADMAP TO EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND A  COMMUNITY OUTREACH GUIDE.  OUTCOMES INCLUDE A MORE INFORMED AND ENGAGED COMMUNITY PREPARED TO ADDRESS AND ARTICULATE COMMUNITY CONCERNS REGARDING PORTS AND OTHER SIGNIFICANT ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERNS.

DESCRIPTION:'CLEAN AIR - HEALTHY HOMES' IS A COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVE TO ADDRESS NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES DURING EVER-INCREASING WILDFIRE SMOKE EPISODES BY CO-CREATING A WILDFIRE SMOKE READY ACTION PLAN AND PROGRAMS BASED ON OUTREACH, SURVEYS AND INVESTIGATIONS WITH LOCAL INDIGENOUS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. IT WILL ALSO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION BY PROVIDING DIRECT ACCESS TO PORTABLE AIR CLEANERS. THE INITIATIVE WILL STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY RESILIENCE BY WORKING WITH PARTNERS TO SURVEY HOW INDIVIDUALS UNDERSTAND THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF WILDFIRE SMOKE AND THEN PREPARE FOR THESE EVENTS. FROM THIS, THE GRANTEE WILL CO-DEVELOP AN ACTION PLAN FOR WILDFIRE EVENTS WITH ACTIVITIES, SHARED RESOURCES, AND MESSAGING. IT BUILDS ON THE GUIDING PRINCIPLES, STRATEGIES, AND PARTNERSHIPS FROM THE RECENTLY ADOPTED COUNTY-WIDE CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLAN, CLIMATE READY MISSOULA AND CLIMATE SMART'S SUMMER SMART INITIATIVE. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS, INCLUDING ALL NATIONS HEALTH CENTER, WILL HOST 2 PARTNER PLANNING MEETINGS, CO-HOST 8 FOCUS GROUPS, AND HOST 5 POP-UP EVENTS IN KEY NEIGHBORHOODS. THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP A QA PLAN AND QUESTIONNAIRE TO SURVEY 200 COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT POP UP EVENTS. THE PROGRAM WILL GATHER FEEDBACK FROM 150 HOUSEHOLDS WHO RECEIVED AN AIR FILTER. THE HEALTH CENTER WILL CANVAS 70 INDIGENOUS COMMUNITY MEMBERS VIA A PILOT INTAKE PROCESS AND CANVAS 180 HOMES IN KEY NEIGHBORHOODS. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CREATING 10 MEETING-IN-A-BOX KITS FOR PARTNER USE. THE PROGRAM WILL HOST 2 WORK SESSIONS TO ASSEMBLE DO IT YOURSELF AIR FILTER + BOX FAN COMBINATIONS FOR USE DURING WILD FIRE SEASON. THE PROGRAM AND PARTNERS WILL SHARE INFORMATION REGIONALLY VIA MEDIA, WEBSITES. FINALLY, THE PROGRAM WILL HOST 6 DEBRIEF SESSIONS (FOCUS GROUPS AND PARTNERS) TO GATHER FEEDBACK ON HOW TO IMPROVE FUTURE PROJECT WORK AND GLEAN SUCCESS STORIES. SUBRECIPIENT:SUB-AWARD TO ALL NATIONS HEALTH CENTER TO ADVERTISE FOR AND HOST COMMUNITY MEETINGS.OUTCOMES:RESIDENTS WHO RECEIVED A FILTER REPORT HIGHER COMFORT LEVELS AT HOME (TARGET = 75% REPORT INCREASE IN COMFORT AT HOME) - INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF HEALTH IMPACTS OF WILDFIRE SMOKE AND SIMPLE STEPS TO TAKE TO STAY HEALTHY (TARGET = 20% INCREASE IN COMMUNITY AWARENESS) - STRONGER INFORMATION SHARING NETWORK ACROSS PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS AND MEETING IN-A-BOX TOOL (TARGET = 10 ORGANIZATIONS COMMIT TO HOSTING A CLIMATE RELATED MEETING EACH YEAR) - COMMUNITY MEMBERS FEEL EMPOWERED TO CHECK-IN ON NEIGHBORS DURING WILDFIRE SMOKE EVENTS AND SHARE RESOURCES FOR STAYING HEALTH (TARGET = 20 NEIGHBORHOOD AMBASSADORS IDENTIFIED) - ESTABLISH TRACKING SYSTEM FOR SMOKE IMPACTS WITHIN ESTABLISHED EFFORTS, SUCH AS ANNUAL SURVEYS AND INTAKES (TARGET = ALL NATIONS PILOT PROJECT EXPANDED AND DATA COLLECTED FOR INVEST HEALTH) - REGIONAL NETWORK STRENGTHENED FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE READINESS (TARGET = 2 PRESENTATIONS TO CLIMATE READY MONTANA AND MONTANA HEALTH PROFESSIONALS FOR A HEALTHY CLIMATE) - DECREASE IN EMERGENCY ROOM VISITS DURING WILDFIRE SMOKE EVENTS - INVEST HEALTH NEIGHBORHOODS REPORT FEWER POOR PHYSICAL HEALTH DAYS IN 2023 REPORT - COMMUNITY CONSENSUS THAT CLIMATE RESILIENCY PLANNING IS A PRIORITY AND OTHER ENTITIES INCLUDING BUSINESSES GET INVOLVED - 2 OTHER MONTANA COMMUNITIES CREATE A WILDFIRE SMOKE READY PLAN VIA ENGAGEMENT OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES - INDIGENOUS - NON-HISPANIC WHITE MORTALITY GAP DECREASES - DECREASE IN ASTHMA HOSPITALIZATIONS DURING WILDFIRE SMOKE EVENTS - AFFORDABLE HOUSING HAS PROVISIONS FOR CLEAN INDOOR AIR DURING WILDFIRE SMOKE EVENTS - WE HAVE A MORE RESILIENT AND COHESIVE COMMUNITY WHERE HEALTH IS PRIORITIZED FOR EVERYONE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS IN AND AROUND MISSOULA COUNTY, INCLUDING THOSE WHO TRAVEL TO THE COUNTY FOR HEALTH CARE SERVICES FROM NEARBY RESERVATIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM AND THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN-FUNDED GRANT IS TO USE INNOVATIVE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION MATERIALS AND ACTIVITIES TO ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN STUDYING AND REMEDIATING AIR QUALITY ISSUES IN THEIR HOME. THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THREE PHASES. 1) EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON IMPACTS OF AIR QUALITY USING CULTURALLY RELEVANT OUTREACH MATERIALS INCLUDING INFOGRAPHICS, EXPLAINER VIDEOS, LEVERAGING COMMUNITY EVENTS AND WORKING WITH TRIBAL HEALTH AGENCIES, TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH EXISTING HEALTH ISSUES TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT. 2) PROVIDE INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORS, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO MONITOR THE QUALITY OF THE INDOOR AIR IN THEIR HOMES. 3) FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHERE AIR QUALITY ISSUES ARE FOUND THE TRIBE WILL WORK WITH OTHER RESOURCES SUCH AS DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT (HUD), AND OTHER RESOURCES TO MITIGATE INDOOR AIR QUALITY. AKWESASNE IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHERN PORTION OF NEW YORK STATE WHICH MEANS THAT SIX MONTHS OUT OF THE YEAR ARE IN CLOSED HOME/OFFICE/SCHOOL CONDITIONS SO THE IN QUALITY OF THE AIR IN HOMES BECOME MORE IMPORTANT. ACTIVITIES:THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM AND THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES (IHS) WILL WORK WITH A SUBCONTRACTOR TO DEVELOP INNOVATIVE AND CULTURALLY RELEVANT MECHANISMS TO
TARGET OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ON THE IMPORTANCE OF INDOOR AIR QUALITY IMPACTS ON PUBLIC HEALTH PARTICULARLY THOSE WITH UNDERLYING HEALTH CONDITIONS (ELDERS, PEOPLE WITH CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (COPD), DIABETES ETC.). SOME OF THESE ACTIVITIES CAN INCLUDE CULTURALLY RELEVANT EXPLAINER VIDEOS, INFORMATION GRAPHICS, MEETINGS IN CHURCHES AND OTHER PUBLIC MEETINGS. INTEREST COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN A INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING RESEARCH ACTIVITY. THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM PROPOSES TO PURCHASE UP TO 65 AWAIR INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORS (25 OMNI AND 40 ELEMENT) TO BE SET UP IN THE HOMES OF PARTICIPATING COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND TRIBAL OFFICES. THE AWAIR OMNI CHECKS FOR 7 PARAMETERS: TEMPERATURE, RELATIVE HUMIDITY,  TOTAL VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (TVOC'S), PARTICULATE MATTER, CARBON DIOXIDE, LIGHT AND NOISE. THE AWAIR ELEMENT CHECK FOR 5 PARAMETERS: TEMPERATURE, RELATIVE HUMIDITY, TVOC'S, PARTICULATE MATTER AND CARBON DIOXIDE EACH OF THE MONITORS ARE EQUIPPED WITH SENSORS THAT HAVE BEEN CALIBRATED AND TESTED FOR ACCURATENESS AND PRECISION. THEY ALSO COME WITH A 3-YEAR WARRANTY FOR ANY AND ALL ISSUES THAT MAY HAPPEN FROM SENSOR FAILURE TO ACCIDENTAL DAMAGE. IT ALSO COMES WITH A SUPPORT PERSON TO ANSWER QUESTIONS AS WELL AS TROUBLESHOOT. THE DASHBOARD, THAT CAN BE VIEWED ONLINE, WILL ALLOW PARTICIPANTS TO UNDERSTAND AND MANAGE TO MONITOR THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN THEIR HOMES AND OFFICES. A MAP CAN BE CREATED TO SHOW WHERE THE UNITS ARE LOCATED. THE DASHBOARD ALSO ALLOWS ACCESS TO DIFFERENT SITE LOCATIONS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE AWAIR ELEMENT HAS AN ONLINE DASHBOARD THAT SHOWS THE READING IN REAL TIME. BECAUSE IT IS REAL TIME ADJUSTMENTS CAN BE MADE IN THE PARTICIPANTS HOMES WHEN THERE ARE ISSUES. ONCE THE ISSUES ARE ADDRESSED IT WILL ALSO SHOW THE CHANGES IN REAL TIME. KNOWING THAT CHANGES CAN BE MADE AND INSTANTANEOUS READINGS SHOW BETTER HEALTH OF THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY, ALLOWS FOR THE TRACKING OF POSITIVE OUTCOMES WITHIN THE PARTICIPANTS HOMES. THE AWAIR OMNI HAS AN ONLINE DASHBOARD THAT CAN BE VIEWED ONLINE ALLOWING THE COMMUNITY TO
VIEW THE AIR QUALITY TRIBAL OFFICES. AS WITH THE AWAIR ELEMENT ALL DATA IS IN REAL TIME SO WHEN ANY CHANGES TO THE AIR QUALITY HAPPEN IT IS NOTICEABLE. THE AWAIR OMNI ALSO MONITORS THE LIGHT AND NOISE OF OFFICES SO THAT YOU CAN BE SURE LIGHT AND NOISE ARE SUITABLE FOR THE COMMUNITY AND STAFF. THE MONITORS WILL BE INSTALLED AND MAINTAINED BY THE STAFF AND PARENTS AS WELL AS THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIP AIR QUA

DESCRIPTION: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO ALLOW THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE TO ADDRESS COVID PANDEMIC IMPACTED PARTICIPATION UNDER THIS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT FUNDED UNDER THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN. THE TRIBE'S PROJECT FOCUSES ON AIR QUALITY IMPACTS FROM WILD FIRE SMOKE AND PARTICULATE MATTER THAT IMPACTS TRIBAL AND COMMUNITY MEMBER HEALTH, ESPECIALLY LUNG DISEASE AND ASTHMA RATES. THE PROJECT PROVIDES OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE COMMUNITY IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE MESCALERO HIGH SCHOOL COMMUNITY. THE HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, ALONG WITH THE MESCALERO APACHE ENVIRONMENTAL DIRECTOR, WILL DEVELOP A QUALITY ASSURANCE (QA) PROJECT PLAN TO PLACE AND OPERATE PURPLE AIR SENSORS IN AND AROUND THE COMMUNITY TO MONITOR AIR QUALITY. THE ENVIRONMENTAL DATA GATHERED UNDER THE QA  PLAN WILL BE BE UPLOADED TO A WEBSITE FOR LOCAL USE ON POOR AIR QUALITY DAYS. TRIBAL AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE ABLE TO CHECK AIR QUALITY IN REAL TIME, DAILY, IN ORDER TO PLAN TO STAY IN DOORS ON POOR AIR QUALITY DAYS TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON AIR QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH IMPACTS FROM WILDFIRE SMOKE. THE PROJECT INVOLVES COLLECTING ENVIRONMENTAL AIR QUALITY DATA AND A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) WILL BE DRAFTED AND SUBMITTED TO THE EPA FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO AIR SENSOR PURCHASE OR AIR MONITORING ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENTED. THE PROJECT INVOLVES PARTNERSHIP WITH THE LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS FOR BROADER OUTREACH AND SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATH (STEM) EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT. THE PROJECT WILL BE FOUNDATIONAL TO ASSIST THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE WITH DEVELOPING AN AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM. THE PROJECT WILL HELP BREAK DOWN PUBLIC PARTICIPATION BARRIERS THAT INCREASED DUE TO COVID PANDEMIC SHUT DOWNS AND ISOLATION. WEBSITE ACCESS FOR AIR QUALITY STATUS WILL BE CREATED AND SHARED WITH THE COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MEMBERS OF THE MESCALERO APACHE TRIBE AND COMMUNITY SURROUNDING THE RESERVATION WILL BE THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN APPROVED QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN FOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING USING PURPLE AIR SENSORS. THE PROJECT DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF AIR SENSORS AROUND THE COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND WEBSITE DATA HOSTING FOR THE SENSORS. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED PUBLIC PARTICIPATION FOR ALL COMMUNITY AND TRIBAL MEMBERS TO UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY IMPACTS FROM INCREASED WILDFIRE SMOKE AND PARTICULATE MATTER.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO FUND THE OTOE-MISSOURIA RESCUE PLAN PROJECT, WHICH INCLUDES DETERMINING THE EXISTING KNOWLEDGE AND BELIEFS ABOUT THE FOUR MAIN SUBJECTS BEING COVERED IN THIS PROJECT, AIR QUALITY (AMBIENT, INDOOR AND HEALTHY HOMES), CLIMATE CHANGE, SAFE DRINKING WATER, DISASTER RESILIENCY AND PREPAREDNESS. THE TRIBE WOULD ALSO LIKE TO INCORPORATE ANY TRADITIONAL / INDIGENOUS KNOWLEDGE THAT MIGHT BE GAINED FROM COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THESE MODULES. INPUT FROM THE OM HISTORICAL PRESERVATION DEPARTMENT COULD BE A RESOURCE FOR THIS TYPE OF KNOWLEDGE. 



ACTIVITIES:OTOE-MISSOURIA ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT (OMED) STAFF WILL DESIGN AND CREATE BROCHURES, EMAILS, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND NEWSLETTER ARTICLES TO INFORM THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THIS PROJECT AND THE UPCOMING EDUCATIONAL MODULES. OMED WILL USE THESE FORMS OF MEDIA TO GATHER INTERESTED PARTIES FOR THE PROJECT THEN DISTRIBUTE TO THOSE WHO WISH TO PARTICIPATE. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:USING THE INPUT FROM PARTICIPANTS AND THE PROJECT PARTNERS, OMED WILL BEGIN DEVELOPING FOUR EDUCATIONAL MODULES INCLUDING WORKING WITH THE SPECIFIC PROJECT PARTNERS TO EITHER GAIN INPUT OR PLAN THE TIMING AND DETAILS OF THE PRESENTATION. EACH MODULE WILL CONTAIN TRAINING AND DEMONSTRATION MATERIALS AND TOOLS SPECIFIC TO EACH TOPIC. THESE MATERIALS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AT THE TIME OF THE MODULE. IF THE TOPIC CANNOT BE ADEQUATELY COVERED IN ONE MODULE THE PRESENTER MAY OPT FOR AN ADDITIONAL SESSION TO FURTHER DISCUSS THE TOPIC. PROGRESS ON THIS PROJECT WILL BE REPORTED TO THE OTOE-MISSOURIA ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR AND TO THE REGION 8 EPA PROJECT OFFICER IN QUARTERLY STATUS REPORTS. IN THE FOURTH QUARTER OF THE PROJECT, THE MODULES WILL BE COMPLETED. AN EXIT PROCESS WILL BE DEVELOPED AND COMPLETED BY PARTICIPANTS TO HELP DETERMINE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. A FINAL REPORT WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE EPA. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBAL AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN-FUNDED GRANT IS TO SEEK TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC AND MUNICIPALITIES ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THAT ARISE FROM CONTAMINATED STORMWATER RUNOFF.   THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP A COMMUNITY STORMWATER ENHANCEMENT PROJECT THAT FALL UNDER THE STATUTE OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT, SECTION 1442.  THE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ACTIVITIES, AND SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE IMPORTANCE OF CLEAN WATER AND THE EFFECTS OF CONTAMINANTS ON THE WATER SUPPLY.   SHOWING THE EFFECTS OF CONTAMINANTS ON THE NUMEROUS LAKES, RIVERS, AND STREAMS THAT ARE IN THE CHOCTAW NATION'S TERRITORY WILL HELP EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON THE IMPORTANCE OF PROPER WASTE HANDLING AND DISPOSAL AS A MITIGATION EFFORT.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON HOW TO PROPERLY IDENTIFY POTENTIAL HAZARDS IN THE WATER SYSTEMS AFTER A MAJOR STORM OR FLOODING EVENT.  THIS PROJECT WILL TARGET AN ESTIMATED 20 COMMUNITIES AND MUNICIPALITIES FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING, INCLUDING THE PURCHASE AND DELIVERY OF DRAINAGE CULVERTS FOR INSTALLATION.  THE LAST ASPECT OF THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF AN ESTIMATED 200 UNITS OF SIGNAGE AND PLACARDS FOR DROP INLETS AND STORM DRAINS IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE 12 DISTRICTS OF THE CHOCTAW NATION.  THERE WILL NOT BE ANY SUBAWARDS AS PART OF THE PROJECT.  

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, OUTREACH, TRAINING, AND COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE TO FOCUS ON THE IMPORTANCE OF KEEPING STORMWATER AND GROUNDWATER FREE FROM CONTAMINANTS, ESPECIALLY AFTER A MAJOR STORM OR FLOODING EVENT.  THIS EDUCATION WILL ALSO FOCUS ON IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL SOURCES OF CONTAMINATION BEFORE IT REACHES THESE WATER SUPPLIES. THE GOAL IS TO HELP CITIZENS RECOGNIZE THE CRITICAL ROLE THAT EACH INDIVIDUAL PLAYS IN HELPING IDENTIFY HAZARDS AS WELL AS HOW TO MITIGATE THOSE POTENTIAL HAZARDS. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THE PROJECT WILL HAVE 40 TOTAL EVENTS, A MIX OF BOTH COMMUNITY EDUCATIONAL AND OUTREACH EVENTS AND MUNICIPALITY OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE EVENTS/MEETINGS. THE EDUCATIONAL EVENTS WILL BE HELD AT COMMUNITY CENTERS THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL RESERVATION AT AN APPROXIMATE SCHEDULE OF FIVE EVENTS PER MONTH FOR EACH OF THE FOUR QUARTERS OF THE PROJECT PERFORMANCE PERIOD. THERE WILL BE COMMUNITY CENTER OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL EVENTS.  SURVEYS AND METRIC DATA WILL BE COLLECTED AT THE EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING EVENTS TO ASSIST IN THE REPORTING AND PROJECT EVALUATION. DROP INLET MARKERS AND DRAIN PLACARDS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITIES IN DISTRICTS 2, 3, AND 4. THE TARGETED RESULTS OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE THE COMPLETION OF AN ESTIMATED 5 COMMUNITY EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING EVENTS IN CNO DISTRICTS 2, 3, AND 4, THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF 7 MUNICIPALITY ASSISTANCE AND TRAININGS, THE DISTRIBUTION AND COLLECTION OF SURVEYS AND METRIC DATA, THE DISTRIBUTION OF DROP INLET MARKERS AND DRAIN PLACARDS IN THESE DISTRICTS, THE GENERATION OF QUARTERLY METRICS, AND THE COMPLETION OF THE QUARTERLY REPORTS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TRAINING AND OUTREACH MATERIALS THAT WILL BE DESIGNED, CREATED, AND PROCURED.  CHOCTAW WILL ALSO PRODUCE AND PROVIDE TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS. CHOCTAW WILL HOST EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND TRAINING EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE 12 CNO AND WILL DELIVER ATTENDANCE RECORDS, SURVEYS, AND METRIC DATA COLLECTED FOR QUARTERLY REPORTING.  THERE WILL BE AN ESTIMATED 20 MUNICIPALITY ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING THAT INCLUDES THE DELIVERY OF NECESSARY CULVERTS THAT WILL BE INSTALLED BY THE MUNICIPALITY, NUMBER OF DRAINAGE IMPROVEMENTS COMPLETED, ASSISTANCE WITH STORMWATER TRAINING (AS NEEDED), AND THE COLLECTION OF METRIC DATA FOR QUARTERLY REPORTING.  THERE WILL BE DELIVERY AND INSTALLATION OF SIGNAGE AND PLACARDS FOR DRAIN INLETS ACROSS 12 DISTRICTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS FOR THE KAW NATION  TO EXECUTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITHIN KAW NATION'S TRIBAL JURISDICTION AND SERVICE AREA THAT FOCUSES ON ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGERS. ADDITIONALLY,  A HEALTHY HOMES CAMPAIGN TO PROMOTE AND SHARE INFORMATION ABOUT IN-HOME ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH HAZARDS THAT MAY INCREASE VULNERABILITY DUE TO EXTENDED PERIODS INDOORS AND OUTDOORS STAY-AT-HOME BECAUSE OF ASTHMA AND COVID-19, ESPECIALLY FOR RESIDENTS IN MULTI-FAMILY HOUSING, SUB-STANDARD HOUSING, AND OTHER TRIBAL HOUSING SETTINGS. PROGRAM PARTICIPATION WILL BE HIGHLY PROMOTED AND ENCOURAGED TO REACH AS MANY VULNERABLE/AT-RISK COMMUNITY MEMBERS AS POSSIBLE.ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL ASTHMA TRIGGERS AND SPREAD OF COVID19 VIRUS OUTBREAKS. TWO PUBLIC EDUCATION EVENTS WILL BE PERFORMED. PUBLIC EDUCATION EVENT AND ACTIVITIES WILL RELATE TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL TRIGGERS OF ASTHMA AND COVID-19. BROCHURES AND FLYERS WILL BE PLACED IN BUSINESSES WITHIN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES EACH YEAR. EACH EVENT WILL HAVE EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL SUCH AS BROCHURES AND FLYERS AND COVID-19 PREVENTATIVE PARTICIPATION BAG.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MEMBERS OF THE KAW NATION AND COMMUNITY SURROUNDING THE RESERVATION WILL BE THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS BY EMAIL, AND PRINTED EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND EVENT MATERIALS USED FOR EACH OF THE EVENTS IN THE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORT BY EMAIL. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES RELATE TO PUBLIC HEALTH RESULTS AND THE REDUCTION IN THE SPREAD OF COVID-19 AND OTHER INFECTIOUS ILLNESSES AS WELL AS PUBLIC EDUCATION AND A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TO REDUCE AND STOP THE SPREAD OF SUCH VIRAL ILLNESSES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP GRANT TO THE SANTA MONICA BAY RESTORATION FOUNDATION (TBF) IS TO PARTNER WITH THE THREE ENVIRONMENTAL CHARTER MIDDLE SCHOOLS TO DEVELOP A COMMUNITY COMPOST PROGRAM AND ESTABLISH A MODEL GREENHOUSE DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM TO GROW AND MAINTAIN PLANT AND TREE SAPLINGS FOR STUDENTS, THEIR FAMILIES, AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO UTILIZE AT THE SCHOOLS LOCATED IN SOUTH LOS ANGELES.

CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: REBUILDING COMMUNITY COMPOST BINS AT THE ENVIRONMENTAL CHARTER SCHOOLS; HIRING A COMMUNITY COMPOST INTERN FOR EACH SCHOOL; ESTABLISHING A COMPOSTING PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY; PROVIDING A LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON TOPICS SUCH AS FOOD PRODUCTION AND GARDENING, COOKING, COMPOSTING AT HOME, CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCY, CARBON SEQUESTRATION, AND FOOD EQUITY; UPGRADING THE GREENHOUSE; GROWING PLANT SEEDLINGS AND TREE SAPLINGS IN THE GREENHOUSE; DEVELOPING COMMUNITY OUTREACH MATERIALS; AND BUILDING COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS. 

 SUBRECIPIENT:THE ENVIRONMENTAL CHARTER MIDDLE SCHOOL (ECMS) IS THE SUBAWARDEE. ECMS WILL CO-LEAD DEVELOPMENT WILL LEAD OR CO-LEAD ALL ELEMENTS OF THE PROJECT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: REVITALIZATION OF COMMUNITY COMPOST BINS AT THE SCHOOLS; FOUR PHOTOVOLTAIC SOLAR PANELS INSTALLED WITH VENTILATION FANS IN AT THE SCHOOL IN INGLEWOOD; AND PLANTS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS AND FAMILIES. OUTCOMES INCLUDE:  INCREASE IN STUDENT KNOWLEDGE OF FOOD PRODUCTION, RENEWABLE ENERGY, CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECTS AND RESILIENCY, AIR POLLUTION ALONG TRANSPORTATION CORRIDORS, GARDENING, CARBON SEQUESTRATION, AND LOCAL REUSE AND AN INCREASE IN COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH FOOD
PRODUCTION AND FOOD WASTE TRANSPORTATION, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND AIR POLLUTION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD PROVIDES A PARTIALLY ARP FUNDED GRANT TO THE COMMON GOOD CITY FARM'S CERTIFICATE PROGRAM IN REGENERATIVE URBAN AGRICULTURE TO FOCUS ON REDUCING THE IMPACT OF AGRICULTURE ON THE ENVIRONMENT BY EDUCATING PARTICIPANTS IN PRACTICAL, HANDS-ON, EVIDENCE-BASED TECHNIQUES, WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON SOIL CARBON SEQUESTRATION IN AGRICULTURE AS PART OF THEIR CERTIFICATE PROGRAM IN REGENERATIVE URBAN AGRICULTURE. FOCUSING ON MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE WASHINGTON, DC METROPOLITAN REGION, THIS PROPOSAL PLANS TO EXPAND THIS EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO ARE STUDYING BIOTECHNOLOGY OR INTERESTED IN CAREERS IN AGRICULTURE. THE PROJECT AIMS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF URBAN FARMERS USING SOIL CARBON SEQUESTRATION AND REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE TECHNIQUES; INCREASE THE NUMBER OF URBAN FARMS AND FARMERS; AND REDUCE VEHICLE MILES TRAVELED TO OBTAIN FOOD BY PRODUCING IT LOCALLY. THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS. ACTIVITIES:COMMON GOOD CITY FARM'S CERTIFICATE PROGRAM IN REGENERATIVE URBAN AGRICULTURE FOCUSES ON REDUCING THE IMPACT OF AGRICULTURE ON THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH 80 HOURS OF EDUCATIONAL TIME IN PRACTICAL, HANDS-ON, EVIDENCE-BASED TECHNIQUES, AS WELL AS SPECIFIC FOCUS ON SOIL CARBON SEQUESTRATION IN AGRICULTURE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: TRAIN LOCAL URBAN FARMERS IN YEAR ONE; INCLUDING YOUTH PARTICIPANTS IN YEAR TWO; AND ADD A TRAINING OF TRAINERS (TOT) MODEL IN YEAR THREE TO EXPAND GEOGRAPHICAL REACH. IN YEAR ONE, THE CERTIFICATE PROGRAM HAS RECRUITED A COHORT OF 12 BEGINNING FARMERS IN WASHINGTON, DC. IN YEAR TWO, THE NUMBER OF END USERS EXPANDS SIGNIFICANTLY, INCLUDING OVER 60 PARTICIPANTS RECRUITED IN WASHINGTON, DC. IN YEAR THREE, THE PROGRAM EXPANDS FURTHER TO INCLUDE FORMER PARTICIPANTS WHO WANT TO BECOME TRAINERS THROUGH A TOT PROGRAM ALLOWING FOR EXPANSION POTENTIAL ACROSS MORE SITES AND GEOGRAPHIC AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CERTIFICATE PROGRAM IN REGENERATIVE URBAN AGRICULTURE AND TRAINING OF TRAINERS (TOT) WILL BE ABLE TO EDUCATE 120 PEOPLE OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS IN REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE TECHNIQUES. THIS GRANT WILL FUND YEAR ONE OF THIS EFFORT. THE TARGET AUDIENCE IS PEOPLE GROWING FOOD IN THE WASHINGTON, DC METROPOLITAN REGION, WITH A FOCUS ON THOSE FROM MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. THESE FARMERS WILL HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED TO SUBSTANTIALLY INCREASE CARBON SEQUESTRATION IN THEIR FARM'S SOIL AS WELL AS INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF PRODUCE GROWN LOCALLY THROUGH INCREASED SOIL HEALTH. THEY WILL ADDRESS FOOD ACCESS ISSUES, DISTRIBUTING THE PRODUCE GROWN AT COMMON GOOD CITY FARM USING REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE TECHNIQUES THROUGH OUR WEEKLY FARM MARKET. THROUGH GEARING THIS PROGRAM FOR URBAN FARMS, THE STUDENTS WILL ALSO ADDRESS FOOD ACCESS ISSUES IN THEIR OWN NEIGHBORHOODS.

DESCRIPTION:NA MOKU 'AUPUNI O KO'OLAU IS CREATING A GRASSROOTS LEVEL, CITIZEN SCIENCE WATER QUALITY TESTING PROJECT TO HELP THE LOCAL COMMUNITY BETTER ACCESS AND UNDERSTAND UP-TO-DATE INFORMATION ABOUT THE WATER RESOURCES OF THE KE`ANAE-WAILUANUI COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT WILL CREATE A DASHBOARD ON WATER QUALITY FOR 27 STREAMS THAT WERE UNTIL RECENTLY DIVERTED FOR SUGAR PLANTATION USAGE, AND THIS INFORMATION IS VITAL TO THE RESIDENTS WHO DEPEND ON THE LOCAL WATERSHED FOR SUBSISTENCE GATHERING, FISHING, AND TARO FARMING. AS THE PROJECT PROGRESSES AND CITIZEN SCIENTISTS COLLECT AND EVALUATE DATA, COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL HAVE A STRONGER VOICE IN FUTURE CONVERSATIONS RELATED TO PROTECTING THEIR WATER RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO TRAIN RESIDENTS WITH REGIONAL AND CULTURAL KNOWLEDGE TO BECOME PROFICIENT IN THE USE OF WATER QUANTITY AND QUALITY MEASURING DEVICES, A MOBILE APP, AND DASHBOARD, THEREBY EMPOWERING THIS UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY'S CAPACITY FOR LOCAL STEWARDSHIP OF RESOURCES. THIS TRAINING WILL ENABLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ULTIMATELY MONITOR 27 STREAMS, TRIBUTARIES, AND ESTUARIES WITHIN KO'OLAU DISTRICT AND REMEDIATE WATER QUALITY ISSUES, SUPPORTING A HEALTHY WATERSHED AND TRADITIONAL AND CUSTOMARY PRACTICES: SUBSISTENCE GATHERING, FISHING AND TARO FARMING.

EPA FUNDING WILL SUPPORT A SMALL CREW IN LEARNING TO MAP OUT THE TERRAIN, ROADS, INTAKES/DIVERSIONS, GATES, AND INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED. THE CREW WILL CLEAR BRUSH AND TRAILS AND BECOME SKILLED IN SURFACE WATER TRACING. BY CARING FOR AND MONITORING THESE AREAS ON AN ONGOING BASIS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL GAIN THE CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY AND RESOLVE BARRIERS AND ROOT CAUSES TO FLOW, SUPPORT HEALTHY STREAM AND MARINE LIFE, AND PROVIDE AND ANALYZE DATA FOR LONG-TERM MANAGEMENT PLANS. ENSURING ACCESS TO QUALITY CLEAN STREAM ALSO SUPPORTS A COMMUNITY-BASED INDIGENOUS ECONOMY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO PROVIDE THE FINANCIAL AND TECHNOLOGICAL SUPPORTS NEEDED TO COMPREHENSIVELY COLLECT AND ANALYZE STREAM AND OTHER VITAL DATA IN MULTIPLE WATERSHEDS IN AN ONGOING AND INTEGRATED MANNER. REAL-TIME, HIGH INTEGRITY DATA COLLECTED AND ANALYZED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL PROVIDE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITH TOOLS NEEDED TO EDUCATE POLICY MAKERS ABOUT THE AVAILABILITY OF WATER THROUGH STREAMS, THE NATURE AND EXTENT OF DITCH FLOW, AS WELL AS LOSSES OVER TIME AND UNDER VARIOUS CONDITIONS. FURTHERMORE, HAVING ACCESS TO THEIR OWN DATA WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH A VOICE IN DEVELOPING NEEDED COMMUNITY-BASED STRATEGIES. IN THE LONG-TERM, DEVELOPING CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGY CAPACITY IN KE'ANAE-WAILUANUI WILL CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ENGAGING NEW TECHNOLOGY IN FURTHERANCE OF A TRADITIONAL LIFESTYLE; FOR NETWORKING WITH OTHER COMMUNITIES, NOT ONLY IN EAST MAUI BUT THROUGHOUT THE STATE. 

MONITORING OF STREAM LEVELS AND WATER DIVERSIONS BY GOVERNMENT AGENCIES IS LIMITED, AND THE PUBLIC DOES NOT HAVE ACCESS TO DATA COLLECTED BY PRIVATE COMPANIES. COMPREHENSIVE ANNUALIZED DATA AND MODELING ARE NEEDED TO DETERMINE HOW MUCH WATER IS BEING DIVERTED AND RETURNED TO THE STREAMS, AND HOW WATER QUALITY IS AFFECTED. IN THE SHORT-TERM, TRANSPARENT DATA WILL SUPPORT HEALTHIER STREAM AND MARINE LIFE AND INCREASE TARO FARMING, SUPPORTING AN INDIGENOUS ECONOMY BASED ON CULTURAL VALUES IN A WAY THAT ENSURES ACCOUNTABILITY AND COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION. IN THE LONG TERM, DATA SUPPORTS DEVELOPING MANAGEMENT PLANS THAT ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT IS PARTIALLY FUNDED BY THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN AND IS TO DEVELOP A COMMUNITY-LED MOVEMENT TO ADDRESS FLOODING IN LOW-LYING AREAS ALONG WITH OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL INJUSTICES THAT TYPICALLY PLAGUE FORMERLY REDLINED NEIGHBORHOODS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING COMMUNITY- LED RESEARCH; BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH GOVERNMENT STAKEHOLDERS AND YOUTH GROUPS; AND ADVOCATING FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF LARGE-SCALE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS IN THE TARGET AREAS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND AGENCY AMONG RESIDENTS; ENHANCED COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP; AND AGENCY FOR ACHIEVING A VISION FOR IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, SUCH AS LESS FLOODING, BETTER AIR AND WATER QUALITY, AND POSITIVE PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE 5 COMMUNITIES IN NEW ORLEANS, LA: TREME (70116), 7TH WARD (70119), UPPER 9TH WARD (70117), HOLLYGROVE-DIXON (70118), AND NEW ORLEANS EAST (70128). PARTNERS WILL PROVIDE EXPERTISE IN TECHNICAL ASPECTS; STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT FOR DATA COLLECTION; AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING COMMUNITY- LED RESEARCH; BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH GOVERNMENT STAKEHOLDERS AND YOUTH GROUPS; AND ADVOCATING FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF LARGE-SCALE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS IN THE TARGET AREAS. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT ARE DEVELOPING STRATEGIES FOR DATA COLLECTION, CONDUCT SURVEYS
AND COLLECT STORIES, PROVIDE OUTREACH, DISSEMINATE INFORMATION, AND FACILITATING AND MANAGING THE POLICY AND ADVOCACY COMMITTEE.OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND AGENCY AMONG RESIDENTS; ENHANCED COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP; AND AGENCY FOR ACHIEVING A VISION FOR IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, SUCH AS LESS FLOODING, BETTER AIR AND WATER QUALITY, AND POSITIVE PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE 5 COMMUNITIES IN NEW ORLEANS, LA: TREME (70116), 7TH WARD (70119), UPPER 9TH WARD (70117), HOLLYGROVE-DIXON (70118), AND NEW ORLEANS EAST (70128). PARTNERS WILL PROVIDE EXPERTISE IN TECHNICAL ASPECTS; STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT FOR DATA COLLECTION; AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, PARTIALLY FUNDED BY THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN, IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO METRO MINISTRIES TO CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION THROUGH YOUTH PRESENTATIONS TARGETING COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS.  YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS WILL BE RECRUITED FROM AMONG RESIDENTS IN TARGET COMMUNITIES AND PARTICIPATE IN A 10-HOUR TRAINING ON THE CLEAN WATER ACT, WHICH WILL INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH PRACTICES, LEARNING INFORMATION RELATED TO CAUSE, EFFECT, PREVENTION, REDUCTION AND ELIMINATION OF WATER POLLUTION.  AN ADDITIONAL FIVE HOURS OF COVID 19 HEALTH AND SAFETY TRAINING WILL BE INCORPORATED.  THESE YOUTH, COMMUNITY ADVOCATES, WILL DEVELOP ARTISTIC PRESENTATIONS USING SOCIAL MEDIA, WEB PRESENCE, COMIC BOOKS, SKITS/THEATRICAL ENDEAVORS, AND PRESENTATIONS BOTH IN PERSON AND VIRTUAL.ACTIVITIES:THROUGH HEALTHY COMMUNITIES METRO ANTICIPATES RECRUITING 20 COMMUNITY ADVOCATES FROM THE TARGET COMMUNITIES OVER THE TWO YEAR PERIOD.  3-5 TEAMS OF YOUTH WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND AWARENESS TO 4 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND 200 STUDENTS; REACH FOUR COMMUNITY GROUPS AND 60 MEMBERS, AND FOUR COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND 100 COMMUNITY PROFESSIONALS THROUGH PRESENTATION OF CLEAN WATER AND POLLUTION ABATEMENT STRATEGIES.  COMMUNITY ADVOCATES WILL PRODUCE CLEAN WATER WORKSHOPS IN FIVE MODALITIES:  MICRO-PLAY, PICTORIAL, VIDEO, MUSICAL DELIVERY/SONG, AND AN E-BOOK; EACH OF THESE WILL BE SHARED WITH THE FUNDER AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL GROUPS, AND POSTED ON THE PROGRAM'S SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE AT LEAST 12 COMMUNITY GROUPS, AND FOUR COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDER GROUPS. HEALTHY COMMUNITIES WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS TO AT LEAST 12 COMMUNITY GROUPS.  BY EDUCATING COMMUNITY ON HEALTHY WATERWAYS AND RESPONSIBILITY TOWARDS WATER SOURCES, 80% OF PARTICIPANTS WILL DEMONSTRATE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTH AND SAFE WATERWAYS, THUS CREATING EMPOWERMENT TOWARDS A CLEANER SOURCE OF WATER FOR HOUSEHOLDS AND BUSINESSES.- STAKEHOLDER CONSENSUS:  HEALTHY COMMUNITIES WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION TO AT LEAST FOUR COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDER GROUPS. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THE YAKUTAT SUBSISTENCE CONSUMPTION ASSESSMENT PROJECT IS TO STRENGTHEN THE YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBES'
ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS (WQSS) THAT ARE MORE PROTECTIVE OF SUBSISTENCE HARVESTERS. THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH THAT PROVIDES A QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENT OF THE CURRENT FISH CONSUMPTION RATE OF THE YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO LIVE IN YAKUTAT, ALASKA.  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITY AND OTHER TRIBES TO SHOW THE CONNECTION BETWEEN SAFE SUBSISTENCE FOODS AND WATER QUALITY STANDARDS.  THE RESULTS OF THIS RESEARCH WILL BE USED TO PROMOTE AWARENESS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF TRADITIONAL FOODS, AND TRAIN OTHER TRIBES ON HOW TO CONDUCT A FISH CONSUMPTION RATE SURVEY.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT TO THURSTON CLIMATE ACTION TEAM IS TO ADDRESS CLIMATE JUSTICE ISSUES IN THURSTON COUNTY IN WHICH OUR UNDERSERVED AND MINORITY COMMUNITIES ARE IMPACTED BY CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECTS. THE ACTION PORTION OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS, PRESENTATIONS TO COMMUNITY LEADERS AND PUTTING TOOLKITS TOGETHER WITH INFORMATION SHEETS AND BASIC ITEMS THAT ANYONE CAN USE TO MAKE THEIR HOMES MORE ENERGY EFFICIENT. OUR PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE TO INCREASE CLIMATE CHANGE AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT OF BIPOC COMMUNITY LEADERS AND MEMBERS VIA PRESENTATIONS AND WORKSHOPS WITH DECREASES IN UTILITY BILLS AND DISASTER RELATED CLAIMS. NO SUB-AWARDS TO CONTRACTUAL SOURCES HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED IN THIS PROJECT. CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. SDWA 1442 GRANT PROJECTS CONTRIBUTE TO PROVIDING CLEAN WATER FOR HANDWASHING IN COMBATTING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19.
ACTIVITIES:
THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A FOCUS ON COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND IMPROVING ENERGY EFFICIENCY IN HOMES, WORKING WITH UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THROUGH EDUCATION MATERIALS ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE AND POLLUTANTS WHILE ADDRESSING SPECIFIC ENERGY EFFICIENCY NEEDS. OUR ENERGY EFFICIENCY TOOLKITS PROVIDE INFORMATION AND BASIC ITEMS THAT ANYONE CAN USE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE; A BILINGUAL SURVEY TO THE COMMUNITY LEADERS ON WHAT THEY BELIEVE TO BE THE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITY, AND THEIR WILLINGNESS TO GET INVOLVED IN COMMUNITY EQUITY EFFORTS, COMMUNITY EDUCATION OUTREACH AND CREATION OF SUBSEQUENT MATERIALS. FURTHER ACTION IN THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE PUTTING TOOLKITS TOGETHER WITH INFORMATION SHEETS AND BASIC ITEMS THAT ANYONE CAN USE TO MAKE THEIR HOMES MORE ENERGY EFFICIENT. 
OUTCOMES:
OUTPUTS INCLUDE SURVEY RESULTS GATHERING FROM COMMUNITY LEADERS AND ASSESSMENT OF WILLINGNESS TO GET INVOLVED IN CHANGE EFFORTS, MULTILINGUAL EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH MATERIALS AVAILABLE TO ONLINE AND PRINT FORMATS AND CREATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF ENERGY EFFICIENCY TOOLKITS WITH INFORMATION SHEETS FOR THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT TO UTILIZE IN THEIR HOMES.  UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES WILL BE INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN CLIMATE ACTION GROUPS AND BUILDING AN EQUITY AGENDA AROUND CLIMATE CHANGE THROUGHOUT THIS PROJECT. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE COMMUNITIES OF BLACK, INDIGENOUS AND PEOPLE OF COLOR (BIPOC) AND OF LOW-INCOME AS THEY ARE IMPACTED FIRST AND WORST BY CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECTS SUCH AS UNHEALTHY AIR, FLOODING, AND DIRTY ENERGY IN THE LOCALITY OF THURSTON COUNTY, WA.

NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT, WATERVERSITY CAREER TRAINING - WATER SYSTEMS WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE CAREER PATHWAYS, ENHANCE QUALITY OF LIFE, ESSENTIAL SKILLS RELATED TO SAFE DRINKING WATER, AND PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE.  THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDES COMMUNITY OUTREACH, MONITORING, DEVELOPING CURRICULUM, EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN SKILLS RELATED TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND SAFE DRINKING WATER. DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT TERRAGRAPHICS INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION INC IS A PROJECT CALLED ONE HABITAT - SUMU'YOO T&UUML;PIPP&UUML;H: AN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL INJUSTICE ON THE SHOSHONE-PAIUTE DUCK VALLEY INDIAN RESERVATION. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING AN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR 7TH-12TH GRADE NATIVE STUDENTS INCLUDING CLASSROOM WORKSHOPS, FIELD TRIPS, FIELD ACTIVITIES, SCIENTIFIC CONFERENCES, AND COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE STUDENTS BEING BETTER PREPARED TO UNDERSTAND AND ADDRESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES AND AN INCREASE IN STUDENTS PURSUING HIGHER EDUCATION AND JOBS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE. THERE WILL BE SUBAWARDS FOR THIS PROJECT. SDWA 1442: HANDWASHING IS A WELL-ACCEPTED APPROACH TO COMBATING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. CLEAN WATER IS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER WASHING OF HANDS. SDWA 1442 GRANT PROJECTS CONTRIBUTE TO PROVIDING CLEAN WATER FOR HANDWASHING IN COMBATTING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. 
ACTIVITIES:
PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FOUR CLASSROOM WORKSHOPS, TWO FIELD TRIPS, THREE FIELD ACTIVITIES, THREE SCIENTIFIC CONFERENCES, AND TWO COMMUNITY MEETINGS.
CLASSROOM WORKSHOPS (4): CURRICULUM WILL BE DEVELOPED AND DELIVERED FOR 4 CLASSROOM WORKSHOPS BEFORE THE FIELD TRIPS AND FIELD ACTIVITIES. WORKSHOP 1 WILL BE LED BY STUDENTS INVOLVED IN THE SUMMER 2021 PILOT BEAVER TRAPPING WORK, DESCRIBING BEAVERS' ROLE IN A HEALTHY RIPARIAN ECOSYSTEM. THIS WILL BE PAIRED WITH COMMUNITY MEETING 1 TO INTRODUCE THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, SCHOOL BOARD, AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO THE PROJECT. WORKSHOP 2 WILL COVER THE MINING HISTORY IN THE REGION, IMPACTS OF MINING ON RIPARIAN (AND HUMAN) HEALTH, AND THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN CLIMATE CHANGE AND MINERAL DEMAND. WORKSHOP 3 WILL INTRODUCE STUDENTS TO CONCEPTS OF RIPARIAN ECOSYSTEM HEALTH, INCLUDING THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON WILDFIRES AND HOW CONTROLLED BURNS CAN HELP THE SAGEBRUSH ECOSYSTEM. STUDENTS WILL PLANT NATIVE SEEDLINGS AS PART OF RESTORING HABITAT DAMAGE FROM THE 2018 WILDFIRE. WORKSHOP 4 WILL COVER SALMON MIGRATION AND TEK PRIOR TO VISITING LOWER GRANITE DAM. 
FIELD TRIPS (2): TWO FIELD TRIPS WILL HELP STUDENTS UNDERSTAND THE INTERCONNECTED NATURE OF THE EFOR AND ASSOCIATED HABITAT AS PART OF THE LARGER UPPER SNAKE RIVER BASIN. THE ISOLATED NATURE OF THE DVIR MAKES THESE ACTIVITIES COSTLY (18% OF BUDGET IS FOR OCS STUDENT TRAVEL) AND SIMULTANEOUSLY ESSENTIAL FOR STUDENT LEARNING; STUDENTS HAVE FEW OPPORTUNITIES TO EXPERIENCE HOW THEIR ENVIRONMENT IS CONNECTED TO THE HEALTH OF HUMANS AND WILDLIFE REGIONALLY. STUDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN SALMON MIGRATION, CLIMATE CHANGE, ENERGY, AND MINING DURING VISITS TO THE FORT MCDERMITT RESERVATION (FIELD TRIP 1) AND THE LOWER GRANITE DAM (FIELD TRIP 2). FORT MCDERMITT (A USRT SISTER TRIBE) IS GRAPPLING WITH A PROPOSED LITHIUM MINE AT THACKER PASS TO MEET US DEMAND FOR LITHIUM-ION BATTERIES FOR LOW-CARBON TECHNOLOGIES TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. THE LOWER GRANITE DAM IS ONE OF FOUR DAMS PROPOSED FOR REMOVAL ON THE SNAKE RIVER. THE DAM TRIP WILL INCLUDE TWO ADDITIONAL STOPS: THE NEZ PERCE FISH HATCHERY AND UI CAMPUS. THE FISH HATCHERY IS MANAGED BY THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE, AND IS AN IMPORTANT PART OF MAINTAINING THE SACRED FISHING TRADITIONS OF THE NIMIIPUU (NEZ PERCE) PEOPLE. THE CAMPUS VISIT WILL BE SUPPORTED BY UI TRIBAL RELATIONS AND THE NATIVE AMERICAN STUDENT CENTER. 
FIELD ACTIVITIES (FA) (3): STUDENTS WILL PERFORM ENVIRONMENTAL SAMPLING, RIPARIAN RESTORATION (PLANTING), AND BEAVER TRAPPING/RELOCATION. EVENTS WILL FOCUS ON WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT AND IMPROVEMENT ALONG THE EFOR, INCLUDING THE DVIR RESERVOIR, STREAMS, AND PRIVATE WELLS TO INTRODUCE CONCEPTS OF WATERSHEDS, HYDROLOGY, AND WATER QUALITY.
