DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT, PEOPLE SCIENCE TRAINING AND RISK ASSESSMENT PROJECT, IS TO MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS OF AIR AND WATER POLLUTION RESULTING FROM A CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE THAT DESTROYED THE TOWNS OF PHOENIX AND TALENT IN SEPTEMBER 2020. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS REGARDING PREVALENCE OF ASTHMA AND RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS; MONITORING TEMPERATURE/WIND DIRECTION, MONITORING LEVELS OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5/PM10) FOR INDOOR/OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY, COMMUNITY MEETINGS, TRAININGS, AND CREATING ASSESSMENTS AND MAPS OF FIRE-DESTROYED PROPERTIES THAT MAY HAVE TOXIC RESIDUES WHICH COULD BECOME AIRBORNE. THE GOAL AND EXPECTED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES ARE INFORMED CITIZENS, REDUCED EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION AND LOWER PREVALENCE OF ASTHMA/RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE LOW- INCOME IR-BIPOC (IMMIGRANT, REFUGEE, BLACK, INDIGENOUS AND PEOPLE OF COLOR) OF THE TALENT/PHOENIX, OREGON AREAS. CONTRACTUAL COMPONENTS MAY INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS AND PEOPLE SCIENCE TRAINING. THIS RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB AWARD FUNDS. CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. SDWA 1442: HANDWASHING IS A WELL-ACCEPTED APPROACH TO COMBATING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. CLEAN WATER IS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER WASHING OF HANDS. SDWA 1442 GRANT PROJECTS CONTRIBUTE TO PROVIDING CLEAN WATER FOR HANDWASHING IN COMBATTING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19.
ACTIVITIES:

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENTAL RISK ASSESSMENT OF CURRENT HAZARDS BOTH THROUGH QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE ASSESSMENTS AND CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE TRAINING, EDUCATION, AND 'PEOPLE SCIENCE' SKILLS FOR IMMIGRANTS, REFUGEES, AND BIPOC RESIDENTS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE; SURVEYS REGARDING ASTHMA AND RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS, TEMPERATURE/WIND DIRECTION, MONITORING LEVELS OF PM 2.5/PM10 FOR INDOOR/OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY, COMMUNITY MEETINGS/TRAININGS, AND CREATING A SURVEY OF FIRE-DESTROYED PROPERTIES THAT MAY HAVE TOXIC RESIDUES THAT COULD BECOME AIRBORNE (ASH, ASBESTOS, ETC.).
OUTCOMES:

OUTPUTS INCLUDE TWO SURVEY REPORTS, MAPS OF PROPERTIES WITH CHARACTERISTICS OF FIRE RESIDUES, AIR QUALITY DATA AND A COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS OF MONITORING RESULTS, TRAINED COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND MULTILINGUAL PUBLIC HEALTH OUTREACH/EDUCATION, WITH THE GOAL OF PRODUCING INFORMED CITIZENS, REDUCED EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION AND LOWER PREVALENCE OF ASTHMA/RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE LOW-INCOME LATINX AND BIPOC COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE TALENT AND PHOENIX REGION OF SOUTHERN OREGON. THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND PREPAREDNESS FOR FUTURE WILDFIRE SEASONS, AS WELL AS INCREASE RESPIRATORY HEALTH AND GREATER RESILIENCE THROUGH THE PANDEMIC, MOVING TOWARDS A SAFER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT FOR OUR COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN THE PHOENIX AND TALENT AREA.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO WORK ALONGSIDE NICKELSVILLE (SELF-MANAGED HOMELESS COMMUNITY) TO CO-ENVISION AN INNOVATIVE TINY HOUSE ECOVILLAGE THAT COMBATS HOMELESSNESS IN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY AND SOCIALLY JUST WAY. THE ANTICIPATED LOCATION OF THE ECOVILLAGE IS THE OTHELLO NEIGHBORHOOD IN SEATTLE, ONE OF THE MOST DIVERSE ZIP CODES IN THE U.S., AN IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE DESTINATION, AND WHICH HOSTS A LARGE HOMELESS POPULATION. THE GRANTEE WILL WORK WITH THE ECOVILLAGE RESIDENTS TO DETERMINE WHAT THEIR NEEDS ARE AND THEN HELP PLAN, DESIGN, AND BUILD DEMONSTRATION CONCEPTS TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS AND REDUCE THE ECOLOGICAL FOOTPRINT OF THE COMMUNITY.
ACTIVITIES:

PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR OVER THREE PHASES: 1) INFORMATION GATHERING OF EXISTING CONDITIONS, NEEDS AND PRIORITIES, 2) MASTER PLANNING FOR A NEW NICKELSVILLE TINY HOUSE ECOVILLAGE, AND 3) PROTOTYPING AND DEMONSTRATION OF SELECT ECO-DESIGN COMPONENTS. ADDITIONALLY, THE ECOVILLAGE WILL ALSO BE SUBMITTED FOR CERTIFICATION WITH THE INTERNATIONAL LIVING FUTURE INSTITUTE'S LIVING COMMUNITY CHALLENGE CERTIFICATION.
OUTCOMES:

PROJECT OUTPUTS INCLUDE A MASTERPLAN BOOK AND BUILT PROTOTYPES. ADDITIONALLY, AN OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL BE TO CERTIFY THE VILLAGE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL LIVING FUTURE INSTITUTE'S LIVING COMMUNITY CHALLENGE CERTIFICATION PROCESS. THE COLLABORATIVE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS WILL FACILITATE TRUST-BUILDING, COMMUNICATION AND CO-TRAINING BETWEEN THE PROFESSIONAL TEAM, NICKELSVILLE RESIDENTS, NEIGHBORS, STAKEHOLDERS AND THE PUBLIC TO SUPPORT OUTCOMES THAT A) EXPLORE A UNIQUE SUSTAINABLE SOLUTION TO HOMELESSNESS; B) AMPLIFY THE HOMELESS VOICES AND VISION TO LIVE SUSTAINABLY AND HEALTHILY WITHIN A SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY SETTING UNIQUE TO PEOPLE FACING HOMELESSNESS; AND C) CHALLENGE HARMFUL HOMELESS STEREOTYPES. TO ACHIEVE THIS, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL FACILITATE PARTICIPATORY WORKSHOPS OVER THREE PHASES AND WORK WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL LIVING FUTURE INSTITUTE (ILFI)'S LIVING COMMUNITY CHALLENGE CERTIFICATION PROCESS AS AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE METRICS GUIDE.

SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FUND BERNALILLO COUNTY COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL'S ACTIVITIES TO INCREASE FREE LOCALLY GROWN PRODUCE WHILE REDUCING CARBON EMISSIONS AND PESTICIDE USE IN THE INTERNATIONAL DISTRICT OF ALBUQUERQUE, NM. SPECIFICALLY, EPA FUNDING WILL BE USED IN INTERNATIONAL DISTRICT ZIP CODE 87108 FOR PROJECT ACTIVITIES ADDRESSING CLIMATE CHANGE AND THE IMPACTS OF COVID-19 ON THE TARGET COMMUNITY THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF A NEIGHBORHOOD FOOD HUB PLAN INCLUDING, 11 COMMITTEE-LED MEETINGS TO SUPPORT LOCAL GARDENERS' CONTRIBUTIONS TO MONTHLY FOOD DISTRIBUTIONS AND FOOD-SHARING NETWORKS; ADDITIONALLY, THE URBAN AG COMMITTEE WILL SUPPORT 2 GARDEN DEMONSTRATION BUILD-OUTS, AND 1 URBAN AG SITE REVITALIZATION PROJECT. PARTNERING WITH TREE NM TO COLLECT AIR QUALITY DATA ON CARBON EMISSIONS, VOC'S, AND TEMPERATURE (HEAT ISLAND INDEX). RESEARCH ON AIR QUALITY, AND IMPACT OF GREEN SPACES ON CITIES. TO SUPPORT THIS EFFORT, 6 PUBLIC WORKSHOPS ON ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES WILL BE HELD AT URBAN AG SITES ON: AIR POLLUTION AND ASTHMA, POLLINATORS NOT PESTICIDES, AND SOIL BUILDING WITH COVER-CROP/MUSHROOMS. EIGHT I.D. GREEN YOUTH CORPS COHORT MEMBERS WILL ATTEND THESE WORKSHOPS AND ENGAGE IN A YOUTH WORKING GROUP. IN SPRING OF 2022 THEY WILL INSTALL 6 AIR QUALITY MONITORS AT 3 BCCUAP SITES AND 3 CONGESTED INTERSECTIONS. THIS PROPOSAL CULMINATES IN AN AIR POLLUTION PROJECT AND NEIGHBORHOOD FOOD HUB PLAN PRESENTATION EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE OF LOCALLY GROWN PRODUCE AT FOOD DISTRIBUTIONS; DEVELOPMENT OF A SUSTAINABILITY PLAN, INCLUDING LONG TERM ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PLAN TO SUSTAIN GARDENS AND NEIGHBORHOOD FOOD HUB PLAN; AND AN IMPROVEMENT OF AIR QUALITY, AND WATER RETENTION BY GARDENING WITH WATER-WISE METHODS.   
DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF ALBUQUERQUE, NEW MEXICO, INTERNATIONAL DISTRICT, 87108. 
THE PROJECT MEETS THE FOLLOWING STATUTORY AUTHORITY:
CLEAN AIR ACT 103:
(B)AUTHORIZED ACTIVITIES OF ADMINISTRATOR IN ESTABLISHING RESEARCH AND
DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM
IN CARRYING OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THE PRECEDING SUBSECTION THE ADMINISTRATOR IS AUTHORIZED TO&MDASH;
(3) MAKE GRANTS TO AIR POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCIES, TO OTHER PUBLIC OR NONPROFIT PRIVATE AGENCIES,
INSTITUTIONS, AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND TO INDIVIDUALS, FOR PURPOSES STATED IN SUBSECTION (A)(1) OF THIS
SECTION;
(A)(1): CONDUCT, AND PROMOTE THE COORDINATION AND ACCELERATION OF, RESEARCH, INVESTIGATIONS,
EXPERIMENTS, DEMONSTRATIONS, SURVEYS, AND STUDIES RELATING TO THE CAUSES, EFFECTS (INCLUDING
HEALTH AND WELFARE EFFECTS), EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION;
NOTE: TRAINING IS ALSO AUTHORIZED IN 103(B)(5)
(5)CONDUCT AND PROMOTE COORDINATION AND ACCELERATION OF TRAINING FOR INDIVIDUALS RELATING TO THE
CAUSES, EFFECTS, EXTENT, PREVENTION, AND CONTROL OF AIR POLLUTION.

ACTIVITIES:
1. BERNALILLO COUNTY URBAN AG COMMITTEE MEETINGS - CONVENE 11 MONTHLY MEETINGS FOR ALL INTERNATIONAL DISTRICT RESIDENTS AND SUPPORTERS WITH THE FOCUS ON CREATING A SUSTAINABILITY PLAN, EPA WORKING GROUP, FOOD DISTRIBUTION, AND DEVELOPING YOUTH COMPONENT OF GRANT
2. NEIGHBORHOOD FOOD HUB PLANNING COMMITTEE - CONVENE 10 MEETINGS TO CONNECT LOCAL FARMERS AND I.D. GARDENERS WITH RESOURCES TO SUPPORT MONTHLY FOOD DISTRIBUTIONS AND A FARMER'S MARKET, WHICH PROVIDE ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS FOR GROWER'S TO DONATE EXCESS PRODUCE AND HERBS.
3.  ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE WORKSHOP SERIES - FACILITATE 6 WORKSHOPS ON ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND ECOLOGICAL HEALTH FROM SPRING TO SUMMER 2022. WORKSHOPS WILL BE LED BY ID COMMUNITY LEADERS INCLUDING 2 YOUTH LEADERS FROM TREE NEW MEXICO.
4. SOIL TESTING AND GARDEN BUILD OUTS - BEFORE AND AFTER SOIL TESTING AT 6 URBAN AG SITES AND 1 DEMONSTRATION SITE RECEIVES BEFORE AND AFTER SOIL TESTING (POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS, RCRA METALS) .
5.  PARTNER WITH TREE NM TO OFFER A PROJECT BASED LEARNING OPPORTUNITY (PBLO) ON AIR QUALITY TO 8 YOUTH AGES 14-21. PARTICIPANTS WILL ATTE

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE SMALL GRANT IS TO ESTABLISH AN EMPOWERING, SCHOOL CURRICULUM-INTEGRATED ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR YOUNGER STUDENTS PROPELLING THEIR AWARENESS OF PROBLEMS LIKE CLIMATE CHANGE AND THE INJUSTICES THEY CREATE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE LEARNING ABOUT THE ANIMAL, MINERAL, AND PLANT KINGDOMS AND HOW THEY INTERACT AND DEPEND ON ECOSYSTEMS; AND DELVING INTO THE LAWS OF NATURE REGARDING THE MOVEMENT OF LIGHT, WATER, WIND, AND SOIL. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASED SENSE OF RESPONSIBILITY TO TAKE CARE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; INCREASED CONSERVATION OF RESOURCES AT HOME AND SCHOOL; AND A FRAMEWORK FOR THE INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL OF LOUISIANA'S (ISL'S) CURRICULUM ADVISOR AND TEACHERS FOR THEIR THIRD-GRADE SCIENCE PROGRAM, WHICH CAN BE REPLICATED FOR OTHERS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE STUDENTS LIVING IN NEW ORLEANS, LOUISIANA, ZIP-CODES 70130 AND 70114. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PREPPING MATERIALS AND TRAINING STAFF ON TEACHING RESPONSIBLE EARTH EDUCATION'S LOST TREASURE CURRICULUM, PILOTING THE CURRICULUM WITH THIRD GRADE STUDENTS, AND EVALUATING THE SUCCESS OF THE PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE CURRICULUM INCLUDE 50 VISITS OVER 16 WEEKS TO TEACH STUDENTS ABOUT THE ANIMAL KINGDOM AND ANIMAL CHARACTERISTICS, FACILITATING INTERACTIVE CHALLENGES WITH STUDENTS ABOUT ANIMAL SIMILARITIES, AND TAKING STUDENTS ON FIELD TRIPS TO REINFORCE LEARNING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASED SENSE OF RESPONSIBILITY TO TAKE CARE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; INCREASED CONSERVATION OF RESOURCES AT HOME AND SCHOOL; AND A FRAMEWORK FOR THE INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL OF LOUISIANA'S (ISL'S) CURRICULUM ADVISOR AND TEACHERS FOR THEIR THIRD-GRADE SCIENCE PROGRAM, WHICH CAN BE REPLICATED FOR OTHERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER SECTION 104(B)(3) OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT AND SECTION 1442(C)(3) OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) TO COTTONWOOD GULCH EXPEDITIONS TO EDUCATE LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES OF COLOR LIVING IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES IN ALBUQUERQUE AND GALLUP, NEW MEXICO, ON THE CONNECTION BETWEEN WATER QUALITY AND IMPACTS TO ECOLOGICAL AND HUMAN HEALTH. THE PRIMARY PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A DRINKING-WATER QUALITY, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND WATERSHED AWARENESS CURRICULUM FOR 400 EIGHTH-GRADE STUDENTS. CLEAN WATER IS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER WASHING OF HANDS. HANDWASHING IS A WELL-ACCEPTED APPROACH TO COMBATING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. SDWA 1442 GRANT PROJECTS CONTRIBUTE TO PROVIDING CLEAN WATER FOR HANDWASHING IN COMBATTING THE SPREAD OF COVID-19.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) DEVELOPING A NEW CLASSROOM CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON WATERSHEDS, WATER QUALITY, AND DRINKING WATER; 2) CONDUCTING CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION ON WATERSHED MODELING, IDENTIFYING LOCAL SUPERFUND SITES, AND LEARNING ABOUT WATER CONTAMINATION; 3) DEVELOPING A FIELD CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON SURFACE WATER AND DRINKING WATER QUALITY TESTING; 4) FACILITATING SURFACE WATER TESTING IN THE FIELD DURING FIELD-BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS IN THE WILDERNESS AREA OF NEW MEXICO PUBLIC LANDS; 5) CONDUCTING APPLIED, PRACTICAL TRAINING WITH STUDENTS SO THEY ARE ABLE TO TEST WATER QUALITY BOTH IN THEIR HOMES, IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, AND IN THE ENVIRONMENT; 6) GENERATING A DATASET TO EDUCATE STUDENTS ON TRENDS AND PATTERNS IN DRINKING AND SURFACE WATER QUALITY; AND 7) CONDUCTING PRE- AND POST-PROGRAM SURVEYS TO ASSESS STUDENTS' UNDERSTANDING OF THESE TOPICS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:PROJECT DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CLASSROOM CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON WATERSHEDS, WATER QUALITY, AND DRINKING WATER AND FIELD CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON SURFACE WATER AND DRINKING WATER QUALITY TESTING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) AS CAREERS THAT ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) ISSUES, COMMUNITIES THAT RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF WATER QUALITY, AND STUDENT BODIES THAT RECOGNIZE THE LINK BETWEEN WATER QUALITY AND EJ. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE EIGHTH-GRADE STUDENTS IN ALBUQUERQUE AND GALLUP, NEW MEXICO.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED SMALL GRANT IS TO EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS NEAR REFINERIES AND PETROCHEMICAL FACILITIES, PARTICULARLY THOSE COMMUNITIES WHERE COVID-19 FATALITIES HAVE BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH, ABOUT AVAILABLE AIR QUALITY INFORMATION, INCLUDING ITS CONNECTION TO COVID-19 MORBIDITY AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ENGAGING AND TRAINING 20-30 RESIDENTS PER PARISH OVER THREE PARISHES TO BECOME AWARE OF AIR QUALITY VIA AIR SAMPLING AND REPORTS TO THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) HOTLINE; SYNTHESIZING DATA, INCLUDING DEMOGRAPHICS, COVID-19 RATES, AND EMISSIONS INFORMATION; AND COMPILING INCIDENT DATA INTO A REPORT TO UNDERSTAND THE FREQUENCY OF INCIDENTS AND THEIR CONNECTION WITH BAD WEATHER EVENTS.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ENGAGING AND TRAINING 20-30 RESIDENTS PER PARISH OVER THREE PARISHES TO BECOME AWARE OF AIR QUALITY VIA AIR SAMPLING AND REPORTS TO THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) HOTLINE; SYNTHESIZING DATA, INCLUDING DEMOGRAPHICS, COVID-19 RATES, AND EMISSIONS INFORMATION; AND COMPILING INCIDENT DATA INTO A REPORT TO UNDERSTAND THE FREQUENCY OF INCIDENTS AND THEIR CONNECTION WITH BAD WEATHER EVENTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 20-30 RESIDENTS PER PARISH OVER THREE PARISHES TRAINED ON AIR QUALITY SAMPLING AND A COMPLETED REPORT ON AIR INCIDENT DATA . EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS ABOUT GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, AIR QUALITY, AND RESPIRATORY ILLNESSES, SUCH AS COVID-19, AND COMMUNITY-GENERATED DOCUMENTATION OF AIR QUALITY AND INDUSTRY INCIDENTS THAT IS SHARED WITH GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE ST. JOHN, ST. JAMES, AND CADDO PARISHES IN LOUISIANA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD TO GIRLS FIRST INC. IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN(ARP) FUNDED GRANT IS TO ALLOW MIRACLE GARDEN COMMUNITY TO PARTNER WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN THE CITY OF MCDONOUGH, GA TO DEVELOP A COMMUNITY GARDEN.  AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, THE MIRACLE GARDEN COMMUNITY COLLABORATIVE THEY WILL PARTNER WITH THE MCDONOUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL STARTING THIS JUNE 2022 FOR FIVE WEEKS TO ASSIST THE MIDDLE SCHOOL WITH A LEARNING ENVIRONMENT IN AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE. THIS ACTIVITY WILL SERVE AS A PRECURSOR TO A LARGER ALLIANCE BETWEEN THE COLLABORATIVE AND THE SCHOOL. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) COLLABORATIVE PROPOSAL DEVELOPMENT PHASE; (2) DETERMINE POTENTIAL EXTERNAL PARTNERS: (3) DRAFTING THE SMALL GRANT PROPOSAL: (4) HOST INTERNAL /EXTERNAL PARTNER COLLABORATION AND PLANNING MEETINGS; (5) VOLUNTEER WITH MCDONOUGH, MIDDLE SCHOOL ON SCHOOL GARDEN PILOT PROJECT; (6)  ACQUIRE THE LAND, TEST THE SOIL, PREP THE
SOIL, PURCHASE EQUIPMENT, INSTALL IRRIGATION SYSTEM, PURCHASE THE PLANTS AND VEGETABLES, FERTILIZE, PLANT AND THE GARDEN; (7)  HOST COMMUNITY MEETINGS TO EDUCATE AND
MENTOR STUDENTS AND RESIDENCE IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES, NUTRITION AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, HORTICULTURE AND BEAUTIFICATION; (8)  HARVEST GARDEN, HOST A COOKING DEMONSTRATION CLASS AND DISTRIBUTE THE VEGETABLES IN A COMMUNITY GIVE AWAY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO ENGAGE AND EMPOWER HISTORICALLY UNDER-RESOURCED AND HEAT-VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF JACKSON, MS IN THE CO-CREATION OF LOCAL PLANS AND PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THE INTERSECTION OF HEALTH, COMMUNITY RESILIENCE, AND HEAT MITIGATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE WORKING ALONGSIDE RESIDENTS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ORGANIZERS DURING MONTHLY WORKSHOPS AND MEETINGS. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO SUPPORT THE 2C MISSISSIPPI: TOWARDS SUSTAINABLE, EDUCATED, AND EMPOWERED MISSISSIPPI (2CMISSTSEEM). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE HEAT SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED, PARTICIPANTS WILL EXPLORE CONCEPTS OF COMMUNITY AND SOCIAL COHESION, INCLUDING WAYS IN WHICH NEIGHBORHOODS CAN PREPARE FOR HEAT EMERGENCIES, ACCOUNT FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE NEIGHBORS, PROVIDE EACH OTHER WITH THE MOST EFFECTIVE SUPPORT AND PROVIDE TRAINING TO THE COMMUNITY.  THEY WILL ALSO PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND LIVE DEMONSTRATIONS. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A PRESENTATION OF COOLING INTERVENTIONS (E.G., VERTICAL GARDENS, GREEN ROOFS, PARKS ETC.), AN ANALYSIS OF URBAN HEAT ISLAND EFFECTS, AND CREATING SYSTEMATIC DATASETS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY STUDENTS AT JACKSON STATE UNIVERSITY AND MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY, AND COMMUNITIES OR ORGANIZATIONS WHO MAY BE INTERESTED IN LEADING SIMILAR INITIATIVESACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO CLEAN AIR CAROLINA (CAC), NORTH CAROLINA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION, IMPROVE HEALTH, AND BUILD A CLIMATE-RESILIENT COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE COLLABORATING WITH CITY OFFICIALS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, THE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND RESIDENTS TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT AIR QUALITY IMPACT ON SPECIFIC HEALTH ISSUES.  INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF AIR POLLUTION, DESIGNING AND IMPLEMENTING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AND MAINTAINING THEM INTO THE FUTURE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES IS A HISTORIC WEST END ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE EDUCATIONAL VIDEO. EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO INCREASE RESIDENT UNDERSTANDING OF HEALTH RISKS FROM AIR POLLUTION AND MEASURES TO REDUCE RISKS, EXPAND LOCAL AIR MONITORING TO PROTECT HEALTH, AND PROVIDE EQUITABLE ACCESS TO THE BENEFITS OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE. THE ENVIRONMENTAL/PUBLIC HEALTH RESULTS CLEAN AIR CAROLINA EXPECT TO ACHIEVE ARE IMPROVED AIR QUALITY AND REDUCTION IN RESIDENT EXPOSURE TO AIR POLLUTION AND EXTREME HEAT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES IS THE HISTORIC WEST END GREEN DISTRICT THAT WILL BECOME A HARBINGER OF A HEALTHY, EMPOWERED, AND CLIMATE-RESILIENT COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT, PARTIALLY FUNDED BY THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN, IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO SUSTAINING WAY TO INCREASE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH THREATS, AND DRIVE COMMUNITY PROGRESS BY COLLABORATING WITH RESIDENTS OF THE LOW-INCOME, MINORITY NEW WASHINGTON HEIGHTS (NWH) COMMUNITY IN GREENVILLE COUNTY, SC TO COMPLETE AN INTENSIVE, MONTHS- LONG COMMUNITY BUILDING AND PARTICIPATORY LEADERSHIP TRAINING SERIES; DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COMMUNITY TRAINING AND PUBLIC EDUCATION PLAN ANCHORED BY THE LOWCOUNTRY ALLIANCE FOR MODEL COMMUNITIES' ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ACADEMY; AND UPDATE THE COMMUNITY MASTER PLAN TO INCORPORATE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH GOALS FOR THE COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY BUILDING AND PARTICIPATORY LEADERSHIP IN NWH THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF COHORTS CONSISTING OF NWH RESIDENTS AND SUSTAINING WAY STAFF THAT WILL UNDERGO A LEADERSHIP TRAINING; DEVELOPMENT AND CONDUCTING OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ACADEMY; UPDATING NWH COMMUNITY MASTER PLAN; CONDUCTING A MAINTENANCE FACILITY ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT REVIEW: AND DISSEMINATING KNOWLEDGE THROUGHOUT THE TARGET COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE AN INCREASED NUMBER OF NWH RESIDENTS ENGAGED IN COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP AS MEASURED BY ATTENDANCE AT COMMUNITY MEETINGS; IMPROVED AND INCREASED COMMUNICATION BETWEEN LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND NWH RESIDENTS; AND AN EXPANSION OF COMMUNITY BUILDING THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, TRAIN-THE-TRAINER EVENTS, OR OTHER METHODS AS DEFINED BY SUSTAINING WAY LEADERSHIP. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO THE YOUNG TEEN ASTHMA AND WELLNESS CAMP, INC. IN BIRMINGHAM, AL.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICA RESCUE PLAN GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE RECIPIENT TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO RAISE YOUNG TEENS AWARENESS ABOUT ASTHMA TRIGGERS AND APPROPRIATE ACTION STEPS TO AVOID ENVIRONMENTAL EXPOSURES. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO PERFORM INCLUDE ASTHMA SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION AND WELLNESS ACTIVITIES TO YOUTH IN THREE RURAL ALABAMA COUNTIES AND STATEWIDE UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS OF MEDICAID RECIPIENTS. THE CAMP IS PROVIDED BY AN INTER-PROFESSIONAL TEAM FROM NURSING, RESPIRATORY THERAPY, PHARMACY, SOCIAL WORK, PHYSICAL THERAPY, NUTRITION, AND MEDICINESUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE (1) FOCUS GROUP MEETING WITH COMMUNITY PARTICIPANTS LOCATED IN TARGETED COUNTIES; (2) ESTABLISH A COMMUNITY ADVISORY COMMITTEE (CAC) AND ARRANGE SUBSEQUENT MEETINGS AND GATHER INPUT; (3) CAC PLAN ASTHMA CAMP ACTIVITIES INCLUDING TEAM RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING; (4) ASTHMA CAMP IMPLEMENTATION WITH ASTHMA EDUCATOR FOLLOW-UP COACHING PROGRAM; AND (5) EVALUATE CAMP ACTIVITIES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT INCLUDING CONDUCTING A POST CAMP SURVEY.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ASTHMA TRIGGERS, ENVIRONMENTAL EXPOSURES, AND BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF INTERVENTIONS TO REDUCE ASTHMA EPISODES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE 100 CAMPERS FROM THE ALABAMA COORDINATED HEALTH NETWORKS (ALABAMA MEDICAID) AND 50 CAMPERS FOR THE EXPANSION RURAL COUNTIES OF DALLAS, GREENE, AND PERRY COUNTIES, ALABAMA (TOTAL 150 CAMPERS, 12 LEADERSHIP STUDENTS, 10 OR MORE CAC MEMBERS, AND 18 SCHOOL-BASED TEAM MEMBERS).

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO SUNDARI FOUNDATION, INC., DBA LOTUS HOUSE WOMEN'S SHELTER. A PORTION OF THE AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $32,159 IS FUNDED THROUGH THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT. THE PURPOSE OF THE ARP FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $32,159 IS TO INCREASE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE FOR THOSE WHO ARE AMONGST THE MOST VULNERABLE IN MIAMI-DADE COUNTY, FLORIDA WITH A JOB TRAINING AND PUBLIC EDUCATION PROJECT RELATED TO THE AIR TRANSMISSION OF COVID-19 AND IMPORTANCE OF INDOOR AIR QUALITY. THE LOTUS HOUSE OPERATIONS INTERNSHIP PROGRAM PROVIDES CURRENTLY SHELTERED GUESTS WITH PAID INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES AND WORK EXPERIENCE, AND THROUGH THIS GRANT, WILL INCLUDE EDUCATION ON INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND HANDS-ON TRAINING TO IMPLEMENT ENVIRONMENTAL SAFETY MEASURES. OVER 1300 HIGH SPECIAL NEEDS WOMEN, YOUTH AND CHILDREN EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN MIAMI-DADE COUNTY WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED AIR QUALITY WITHIN THE SHELTER RESULTING FROM AIR FILTER UPGRADES TO HVAC EQUIPMENT. ACTIVITIES:LOTUS HOUSE WILL INTEGRATE COVID-19 SAFETY AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY MEASURES INTO THE LOTUS HOUSE OPERATIONS INTERNSHIP PROGRAM TO INCLUDE INSTRUCTIONS ON THE PROPER INSTALLATION OF MERV-13 AIR FILTERS AND THEIR IMPORTANCE. OPERATIONS INTERNS WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE OPERATIONS DIRECTOR AND ENGINEERING AND MAINTENANCE TEAM DURING MONTHLY REMOVALS AND INSTALLATIONS OF THE MERV-13 FILTERS, EXPOSING CURRENT GUESTS TO A HIGHER LEVEL OF TRAINING AND EDUCATION DURING THEIR TIME AS INTERNS. ADDITIONALLY, INFORMATION AND EDUCATION FROM PARTNERS WILL BE PROVIDED BI-MONTHLY TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF COVID-19 PREVENTION AND TREATMENT, INCLUDING ACCESS TO TESTING, VACCINES AND RESPIRATORY HEALTH CARE. INFORMATION ON SMOKING, ASTHMA, AND OTHER INFECTIOUS VECTORS WILL BE PROVIDED, AS WELL AS CHILDREN'S AIR-RELATED EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: 1) INSTALLATION OF 3-MONTH SUPPLY OF HIGH-GRADE MERV-13 AIR FILTERS. 2) OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING AIR SANITATION SYSTEMS WITHIN THE SHELTER, INCLUDING ULTRAVIOLET AIR-DUCT CLEANING SYSTEM. 3) INACTIVATION OF 99.97% OF VIRUSES AND BACTERIA IN THE AIR WITHIN THE LOTUS HOUSE SHELTER.  4) DISTRIBUTION OF AIR QUALITY AND RESPIRATORY HEALTH INFORMATION TO SHELTER GUESTS AND INTERNSHIP TEAM. 5) PROJECT RESULTS WILL BE SUMMARIZED IN A 'HOW TO' PAPER WHICH WILL BE SHARED VIA WEBSITES AND SOCIAL MEDIA.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE 1300 SPECIAL NEEDS WOMEN AND CHILDREN IN THE MIAMI-DADE COUNTY, FL AREA STAYING AT THE SHELTER.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO SUPPORT BONIFAY MAIN STREET ASSOCIATION, INC (BMSAI) IN THEIR GOALS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ADDRESS LACK OF ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOODS AS A PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUE, WHILE LOWERING EMISSIONS BY ELIMINATING THE NEED TO TRAVEL LONG DISTANCES FOR FOOD, AND ADDRESSING ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CHALLENGES FOR THIS VULNERABLE COMMUNITY BASED IN AN OPPORTUNITY ZONE. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT AIMS TO INCREASE THE COMMUNITY'S KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY TO INFLUENCE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES THAT DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACT THEM THROUGH TRAINING AND EDUCATION SERIES. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE VENUE REVITALIZATION, TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL SEMINARS, DEVELP SOCIAL MEDIA AND MAIL CAMPAIGN, IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL SUPPORTERS, AND DEVELOP LOCAL FOOD DISTRIBUTION CENTERS. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES APPROXIMATELY 2000 BONIFAY RESIDENTS WILL BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE URBAN AGRICULTURAL TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM, A SURVEY TOOL WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO COLLECTING DATA FROM STAKEHOLDERS/RESIDENTS FOR A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT OF THE PROGRAM INITIATIVES AND FOR DEVELOPMENT OF FURTHER EXPANSION OF RESIDENT GREEN NEEDS, LOCAL FARMERS WILL BE ORGANIZED TO PROVIDE EDUCATION LEADERSHIP GREEN CLASSES AT THE SITE FOR YOUTH AND RESIDENT STAKEHOLDERS, AND COMMUNITY WIDE GREEN INITIATIVE PROGRAM WILL DE-EMPHASIZE THE USE OF AUTOMOBILE TRAVEL BY INTEGRATING OVER 50 LOCAL FARMERS TO PROVIDE HEALTH ALTERNATIVES AT THE GREEN SPARK CENTER. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF BONIFAY, FLORIDA.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO INDOOR AIR HEALTH CONCERNS DUE TO COVID-19 STAY-AT-HOME ORDERS IN THE COTTAGE GROVE AND ADJACENT NEIGHBORHOODS IN GREENSBORO, NORTH CAROLINA. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO THE NEW HOPE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT GROUP, INC.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CONDUCTING INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY TRAINING SESSIONS, DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATION AND RESOURCES FOR INFORMED CHOICES TO IMPROVE HOME AIR QUALITY. THROUGH TELEPHONE AND FACE-TO-FACE ASSESSMENTS, RESIDENTS WILL BE EVALUATED TO DETERMINE IF THEY HAVE INDOOR AIR ISSUES THAT HAVE INCREASED DUE TO COVID-19.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE ARTICLES FOR COMMUNITY AND PARTNER NEWSLETTERS, MEETINGS, VIDEO, FLYERS, AND PRESENTATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE, IMPROVED HOME ENVIRONMENTS AND REDUCED SOCIAL ISOLATION FOR SENIOR RESIDENTS IN THE COTTAGE GROVE NEIGHBORHOOD IN GREENSBORO, NC.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO TOXIC FREE NORTH CAROLINA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH EDUCATION FOR THE LATINX IMMIGRANT MEMBERS OF RURAL EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE HOSTING FOCUS GROUP SESSIONS, IDENTIFYING PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, AND CONDUCTING AND EVALUATING WORKSHOPS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ( EJ) ACADEMY SPANISH LANGUAGE WORKSHOP CURRICULUM ARE TO HAVE A FOCUS GROUP SESSION AND FIVE LANGUAGE ACCESSIBLE WORKSHOPS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY, CHANGES IN BEHAVIOR TO PREVENT AND REDUCE EXPOSURES, AND INCREASED ENGAGEMENT OF RURAL IMMIGRANT COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ADVOCACY EFFORTS TO ENSURE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES HAVE OPPORTUNITY TO HEAR FROM THOSE MOST IMPACTED. THESE RESULTS WILL ULTIMATELY LEAD TO REDUCTIONS IN POLLUTION EXPOSURE FOR RURAL COMMUNITIES DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND INCREASED ENGAGEMENT OF RURAL IMMIGRANT FARMWORKERS AND MIGRANT WORKERS IN RURAL EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO SUPPORT GASP TO LAUNCH A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT SURVEY TO GAUGE RESIDENTS HEALTH CONCERNS AND DEPLOY AT LEAST 20 DIGITAL AIR SENSORS (PURPLEAIR) IN THE COMMUNITY AND TRAIN RESIDENTS TO REPORT AIR QUALITY INCIDENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TO STUDY AIR POLLUTION AND COLLECT PARTICLE POLLUTION DATA USING PURPLE AIR (OR COMPARABLE) LOW-COST DIGITAL AIR SENSORS. WE WILL ALSO SAMPLE FOR TOXIC AIR POLLUTION USING SORBENT TUBES AND/OR SUMMA CANNISTERS. THIS INFORMATION WILL HELP RESIDENTS UNDERSTAND WHAT'S IN THE AIR THEIR BREATHING AND WHAT IMPACT THAT MAY HAVE ON THEIR HEALTH. PLAN TO DO THE FOLLOWING: (1) CONDUCT 2-WEEK PASSIVE SORBENT TUBE SAMPLING; (2) COLLECT A SMALLER NUMBER OF SUMMA CANISTER SAMPLES COLLOCATED WITH SORBENT TUBES TO ASSESS MEASUREMENT PRECISION; AND (3) CONDUCT TWO 3-MONTH SAMPLING CAMPAIGNS DURING SUMMER AND WINTER. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE UNDER THE CATEGORIES OF STUDYING OF AIR POLLUTION, WHICH WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. THE MAIN PROJECTED OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE SHORT-TERM (INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE OF RESIDENTS ON OUTDOOR AIR POLLUTION AND RISKS TO PUBLIC HEALTH); INTERMEDIATE (EDUCATION OF RESIDENTS THAT CAN BETTER REPORT INCREASED AIR POLLUTION EVENTS TO NON-PROFITS AND REGULATORY AGENCIES); LONG-TERM (BETTER CONTROLS/REDUCTION IN AIR POLLUTION, 2 YEARS AFTER THE PROJECT). THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF BIRMINGHAM, ESPECIALLY THOSE LIVING NEAR THE FENCE-LINE OF AN ASSORTMENT OF MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY, WHICH EMITS AIR POLLUTION.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $75,000 TO ENVIRONMENTAL COMMUNITY ACTION (ECO-ACTION).  A PORTION OF THE AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $37,500 IN FUNDED THROUGH THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT. THE PURPOSE OF THE ARP FUNDED GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $37,500 IS TO ASSIST WITH BUILDING BOTH COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND ENHANCE THE ABILITY OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO IDENTIFY EQUITABLE STRATEGIES TO RESPOND TO THE CLIMATE RELATED THREATS THEY ARE ALREADY FACING. THE PROJECT ENTITLED BUILDING THE CAPACITY AND RESILIENCE OF LOW-INCOME ATLANTA NEIGHBORHOODS TO EQUITABLY MITIGATE THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND INVESTIGATION ELEMENTS. PROGRAM ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) RECRUITING 60 PARTICIPANTS AND FINALIZING SESSION TOPICS WITH COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES, 2) PROVIDING TRAINING TO ENABLE PARTICIPANTS TO DEVELOP PERSONAL RESILIENCY PLANS, AND 3) CONDUCT GROUP RESILIENCY ACTIVITIES INCLUDING IDENTIFYING COLLECTIVE STRATEGIES FOR CLIMATE ADAPTION AND/OR ENHANCED CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND HOSTING A 100-PERSON COMMUNITY FORUM TO GAIN CONSENSUS FOR THE DEVELOPED COMMUNITY-BASED CLIMATE STRATEGIES.

COMMUNITY BENEFICIARIES:  ECO-ACTION WILL ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITHIN THE TWO IDENTIFIED WATERSHEDS, INTRENCHMENT CREEK AND PROCTOR CREEK ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF UNDERSERVED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES IN ATLANTA, GA WHO RESIDE WITHIN THE ZIP CODES OF 30310, 30312, 30314, 30315, 30316, AND 30318.   


ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES:  
THE PROGRAM ALSO SEEKS TO INCREASE SUPPORT FOR COMMUNITY-DRIVEN STRATEGIES FOR CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCE AND ADAPTION. SPECIFIC ANTICIPATED RESULTS (OUTPUT ACTIVITIES) INCLUDE: 
- TWO COMMUNITY GROUPS WILL BE TRAINED. THIRTY COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM EACH GROUP WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE TRAINING ACTIVITIES.
- EACH COMMUNITY WILL HOST 9 COMMUNITY WORKSHOP SESSION (6 TRAINING SESSIONS, 2 WORKSHOP SESSIONS, 1 CLOSING CELEBRATION).
- EACH PARTICIPANT WILL COMPLETE AN INDIVIDUAL RESILIENCY PLAN (60 PLANS).
- EACH GROUP WILL DEVELOP A COLLECTIVE STRATEGY TO INCREASE NEIGHBORHOOD LEVEL RESILIENCE.
- EACH GROUP WILL CREATE A CLIMATE RESILIENCE/ADAPTATION POLICY STATEMENT.
- EACH GROUP WILL HOST A CLIMATE MITIGATION ACTIVITY AND 30 PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE MITIGATION RESOURCES AT EACH FINAL PROGRAM CELEBRATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE OVERALL PROJECT GOAL IS TO INCREASE THE ABILITY OF LOW-INCOME, ATLANTA COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO REMAIN RESILIENT IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE. FURTHER, INCREASE PARTICIPANTS' UNDERSTANDING OF THE CAUSES OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND ITS INEQUITABLE IMPACTS; INCREASE PARTICIPANTS' ABILITIES TO IDENTIFY THEIR CLIMATE VULNERABILITIES; INCREASE PARTICIPANTS' ABILITIES TO MITIGATE IDENTIFIED CLIMATE VULNERABILITIES EQUITABLY THROUGH INDIVIDUAL AND COLLECTIVE ACTION; AND INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF AND COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY-BASED RESILIENCE AND STRATEGIES.

THIS PROJECT WILL FIND OUT HOW A COMMUNITY-BASED AIR MONITORING NETWORK OF PURPLE AIR MONITORS CAN BE USED BY THE COMMUNITY TO PROMOTE AIR QUALITY AWARENESS AND DRIVE BEHAVIORAL CHANGE TO PROTECT HEALTH DURING PROLONGED WILDFIRE SMOKE EPISODES. THE RESULTS WOULD LEAD TO THE CREATION OF A 'CLEAN AIR AMBASSADOR' PROGRAM TO MORE DIRECTLY SERVE THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS AND INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF WILDFIRE SMOKE RESILIENT COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE RURAL WEST.

THE PROJECT WILL INFORM THE RESIDENTS OF SELDOVIA VILLAGE AND THE CITY OF SELDOVIA OF, AND HELP THEM PREPARE FOR, POTENTIAL NATURAL DISASTERS BY OFFERING THREE PUBLIC LEARNING SESSIONS FROM DIFFERENT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS ON NATURAL DISASTER PREPAREDNESS. THE FOCUS WILL BE ON THE EFFECTS NATURAL DISASTERS CAN HAVE ON DRINKING WATER, WASTE MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, AND HOW TO PREPARE FOR THESE SITUATIONS.  PLEASE NOTE THAT FUNDS MAY NOT BE DRAWN DOWN FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHOUT A CURRENT, APPROVED RATE IN PLACE.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS IN SPRINGBROOK CREEK BEFORE IT ENTERS THE DUWAMISH RIVER. FORTERRA, UNLEASH THE BRILLIANCE AND PUGET SOUNDKEEPER ALLIANCE WILL PARTNER WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO MEET THESE OBJECTIVES: 1) REFORESTATION, VEGETATION BUFFERS ALONG SPRINGBROOK CREEK; 2) GREEN JOB SKILLS TRAINING FOR YOUTH TO PERFORM OUTREACH AND COLLECT DATA TO MONITOR FOREST HEALTH; AND 3) SPRINGBROOK CREEK WATERSHED VISIONING DOCUMENT.

THE PROJECT WILL EDUCATE AND EMPOWER FARMWORKERS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN BENTON AND LANE COUNTIES, OREGON TO BETTER PROTECT THEMSELVES FROM THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF PESTICIDES. INCREASED AWARENESS WOULD RESULT IN REDUCED EXPOSURE, HEALTH RISKS, AND PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

THE PROJECT WOULD RAISE KNOWLEDGE OF LEAD CONTAMINATED SOIL FOR VEGETABLE PRODUCTION TO INCREASE FOOD SECURITY WITHIN LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS IN THE PORTLAND METRO AREA. A COHORT OF 25 LOW-INCOME AND COMMUNITIES OF COLOR WILL PARTICIPATE IN WORKSHOPS ON HEALTH ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH LEAD CONTAMINATED SOIL, HOW TO TEST SOIL, AND HOW TO PREPARE FOR EMERGENCIES. UP TO FIVE AFFORDABLE HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS WILL PARTNER WITH THE PROJECT TO GROW, PLANT AND HARVEST VEGETABLES USING ORGANIC GROWING AND INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.

SITKA TRIBE OF ALASKA WILL COLLECT WATER AND SUBSISTENCE FOOD SAMPLES FROM FOUR LOCATIONS WITHIN STA'S TRADITIONAL TERRITORY TO TEST FOR THE PRESENCE OF MICROPLASTICS AND ASSOCIATED TOXINS. THESE RESULTS WILL BE COMPARED TO COMMERCIALLY PURCHASED FOODS AND THE SAFETY STANDARDS. THESE RESULTS WILL BE SHARED WITH THE PUBLIC SO THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT HARVESTING TRADITIONAL FOODS. LOCAL STUDENTS WILL ASSIST IN SAMPLING OF LOCAL FOOD AND WATER. PROJECT OUTPUTS INCLUDE COLLECTING AND TESTING 72 SUBSISTENCE FOOD SAMPLES, 18 COMMERCIAL FOOD SAMPLES, AND 12 WATER SAMPLES.

THE PROJECT PROPOSES TO INITIATE OPERATION OF A BIOCHAR REACTOR (A RELOCATABLE DEVICE THAT CONVERTS HUMAN WASTE INTO PATHOGEN-FREE BIOCHAR) BY HIRING LOCAL WORKERS FROM THE COMMUNITY THAT WILL OPERATE AND MANAGE THE REACTOR, TRACK SYSTEM PERFORMANCE, AND LEAD COMMUNITY EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING ABOUT THE REACTOR AND ITS BENEFITS. OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS, HOUSEHOLD SURVEYS, RADIO ANNOUNCEMENTS, AND LONG-TERM PLANNING TOWN HALLS.  BIOCHAR HAS PROVEN TO BE USEFUL AS A SOIL AMENDMENT, FOR ODOR ELIMINATION, AND TO MITIGATE POLLUTION AT TOXIC WASTE SITES.

THE 'GROWING A GRASSROOTS EJ PROGRAM AT VALLE DE ORO NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE (NWR)' PROJECT WILL REACH UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE MOUNTAIN VIEW NEIGHBORHOOD (MVN) AND BROADER SOUTH VALLEY AREA, THROUGH AN ON-GOING INCLUSIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE-FOCUSED APPROACH THAT WILL DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN AN EDUCATIONAL AND ADVOCACY PROGRAM TO IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH OF THE MVN AND SOUTH VALLEY AREA RESIDENTS.

THE ACEQUIA EDUCATION INITIATIVE WILL WORK TOWARDS THE PREVENTION, REDUCTION AND ELIMINATION OF ACEQUIA POLLUTION, THEREBY ENHANCING WATER QUALITY FOR ACEQUIA COMMUNITIES AND FOR THE RIO FERNANDO WATERSHED AS A WHOLE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SERVE TO ENGAGE AND EMPOWER YOUTH IN ACEQUIA CULTURE. THROUGH THIS EDUCATIONAL CAMPAIGN, THE COLLABORATIVE AIMS TO STEM THE TIDE OF ACEQUIA DEGRADATION AND INCREASE WATER QUALITY FOR ACEQUIA USERS. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ORGANIZE AND IMPLEMENT UNIQUE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR REALTORS/TITLE COMPANIES, AND FOR TAOS YOUTH. TWO DIFFERENT EDUCATIONAL PACKETS WILL BE CREATED, WITH INFORMATION ON ACEQUIA POLLUTION, BEST PRACTICES, CULTURE, AND THE ROLE EACH ENTITY PLAYS IN MAINTAINING (AND RESTORING) ACEQUIA WATER QUALITY WITHIN THE RIO FERNANDO DE TAOS WATERSHED.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THAT THE ZIA YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL COLLABORATION PROJECT SEEKS TO ADDRESS ARE THE OVERABUNDANCE OF LITTER, ILLEGAL DUMP SITES AND SCRAP TIRES THAT ARE LEFT WITHIN THE PUEBLO BOUNDARIES. IN ORDER TO MEET THE OBJECTIVE OF GARNERING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES, THE PUEBLO OF ZIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES (DER) WILL TAKE THE FOLLOWING STEPS: 1) EDUCATE YOUTH ON THE SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL ACT; 2) COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS ABOUT THE EFFECTIVENESS AND IMPORTANCE OF RECYCLING; 3) COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS ABOUT THE ISSUES WITH ILLEGAL DUMPING AND LITTERING; 4) GAINING PARTICIPATION THROUGH PHOTOGRAPHY TO DOCUMENT ILLEGAL DUMPSITES, TIRE PILES AND LITTERING; AND 5) TEACHING THE COMMUNITY HOW TO REPORT THESE TO DER AND WHAT THE DEPARTMENT WILL DO WITH THE DATA  IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THESE STEPS, DER WILL LOAN OUT 20 CAMERAS WITH (GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEMS) GPS IMBEDDED IN THE CAMERA TO YOUTH AGED 15-25. AFTER AN INTRO

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE YOUTH LEADERSHIP AND COMMUNITY ACTION FOR HEALTHIER HOMES PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY HOMES THROUGH YOUTH DEVELOPMENT IN NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA CITY, ZIP CODE 73117. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ADDRESS ASTHMA TRIGGERS IN THE COMMUNITY AND HOW HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTES (HHW) CAN CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTH ISSUES, LIKE ASTHMA. PROJECT PARTNERS WILL ADMINISTER A SURVEY THAT WILL INCLUDE AN IN-HOME ASSESSMENT THAT WILL HELP TO MAKE RESIDENTS MORE AWARE OF THE TYPES OF PRODUCTS THAT GENERATE HHW AND HOW MUCH IS IN THEIR COMMUNITY. COMMUNITY YOUTH LEADERS WILL BE TRAINED TO ADVOCATE FOR HEALTHIER HOMES BY HELPING TO EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF THE POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO THEIR LOCAL ENVIRONMENT AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH RISKS (INCLUDING ASTHMA ATTACKS) ASSOCIATED WITH IMPROPER USE, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HHW. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO ENCOURAGE RESIDENTS TO TRY MORE ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY ALTERNATIVES TO SUBSTANCES THAT GENERATE HHW.

SANKOFA WILL ENGAGE WITH 20 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN THE LOWER NINTH WARD NEIGHBORHOOD OF THE CITY OF NEW ORLEANS AS A PART OF THE SANKOFA ENVIRONMENTAL EMPOWERMENT TEAM (SWEET) PROJECT TO CONDUCT HANDS-ON EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITHIN A DESIGN/BUILD LEARNING PROGRAM  PROJECT PARTICIPANTS WILL SHARE THEIR LEARNED KNOWLEDGE OF WETLAND HABITATS AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE BY CREATING THEIR OWN ENGAGING ACTIVITIES TO SHARE WITH OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

THE BLIGHT TO BIOSWALES (B2B) WATER QUALITY PROJECT SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSES ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH THREATS RELATED TO STORM WATER RUNOFF, DISASTER RESILIENCY AND WATER QUALITY THROUGH PUBLIC EDUCATION, COMMUNITY TRAININGS, AND A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT. THROUGH A PARTICIPATORY PROGRAM THAT USES EXPERTS AS RESOURCE PEOPLE AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH WORKERS AS FACILITATORS, RESIDENTS IN THE TARGETED COMMUNITIES WILL BE TRAINED TO INVESTIGATE THE MAJOR POLLUTION SOURCES IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS THAT ARE IMPACTING WATER QUALITY. RESIDENTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING ON COLLECTING SOIL SAMPLES ON BLIGHTED LOTS AND RECEIVE EDUCATION ABOUT THE TESTING PROCESS AND HOW BEST TO UTILIZE RESULTS. RESIDENTS WILL ALSO BE EDUCATED ON THE NATURAL MATERIALS AVAILABLE TO REDUCE POLLUTION FROM STORMWATER RUNOFF AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY. RESIDENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE CREATION OF A BIOSWALE ON A BLIGHTED LOT AS A DEMONSTRATION OF HOW BIOSWALES COULD POSSIBLY BE UTILIZED IN A NEW WAY--TO ADDRESS LINGERING POS

THE SUSTAINABLE SELF-SUFFICIENCY DEVELOPMENT FOR VETERANS & COMMUNITY PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN COMMUNITY DRIVEN PROJECTS THAT BUILD CONSENSUS THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. AN ESTIMATED 120 VETERANS PLUS 200 OTHER RESIDENTS FROM A VULNERABLE POPULATION WILL BE PROVIDED WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO ATTEND MONTHLY GARDEN DAYS TO DEVELOP NEW SKILLS TO START/MAINTAIN BACKYARD GARDENS, INCLUDING CHICKEN COOPS, RAIN BARRELS, COMPOST BINS; COMPOSTING IS RELATED TO REDUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GASES (METHANE) IN LANDFILLS. COMMUNITY GARDENS WITH RAISED WICKING BEDS WILL 1) ACCOMMODATE DISABILITIES (SOME WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE GARDEN BEDS), 2) ALLOW THE IMPACTED POPULATION TO RAISE SOME OF THEIR OWN FOOD USING NEW SUSTAINABLE ORGANIC GROWING METHODS, AND 3) DEMONSTRATE HOW LOCAL FRESH FOOD REDUCES IMPACT ON THE PLANET THROUGH A REDUCED CARBON FOOTPRINT RELATED TO THE TRANSPORTATION OF PRE-PACKAGED FOODS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO SUSTAIN CHARLOTTE, INC. WHICH WILL ENABLE THEM TO ENGAGE RESIDENTS OF CHARLOTTE'S NORTH END NEIGHBORHOODS TO LEARN ABOUT THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTION AND THE IMPACT OF TRANSPORTATION CHOICES ON BOTH ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO METRO COMMUNITY MINISTRY TO  PROVIDE TRAINING AND PUBLIC EDUCATION ADDRESSING CLEAN AND SAFE WATER TO SCHOOLS, YOUTH GROUPS, CHURCHES AND YOUTH SERVING ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS THE ATLANTA METRO REGION.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO THE SUSTAINABLE WORKPLACE ALLIANCE TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH PROVIDING COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND TRAINING TO LOW INCOME AND NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING RESIDENTS SURROUNDING LAKE OKEECHOBEE WHO ARE ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY HARMFUL ALGAE BLOOM.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO OCEAN RESEARCH & CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH ASSESSING THE RISK OF TOXIN TRANSFER FROM ALGAE BLOOMS TO SUBSISTENCE FISHING COMMUNITIES AND MINIMIZING THE RISK OF EXPOSURE OF VULNERABLE GROUPS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO LEAD COALITION OF BAY COUNTY TO SUPPORT THEIR WORK ON AN EXISTING MODEL OF COMMUNITY-BASED PUBLIC HEALTH DECISION-MAKING. LEAD COALITION OF BAY COUNTY WILL ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY TO HELP IMPROVE INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND ESTABLISH A COLLABORATIVE WORK GROUP TO CONTINUE ADDRESSING HEALTH ISSUES RELATED TO HURRICANE MICHAEL.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO LIVELIHOODS KNOWLEDGE EXCHANGE NETWORK INCORPORATION TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS EDUCATING, EMPOWERING, AND ENGAGING RESIDENTS IN COLLECTING QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DATA ABOUT WATER VULNERABILITY IN EASTERN KENTUCKY.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO SOCIALLY EQUAL ENERGY EFFICIENT DEVELOPMENT INCORPORATION TO SUPPORT ADDRESSING COMMUNITY CONCERNS BY CONDUCTING GREEN HOUSE CALLS, AND CONDUCTING WORKSHOPS ON ENERGY/WATER EFFICIENCY, HEALTHY HOMES, AND EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS.

DESCRIPTION:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD HUB'S COMMUNITY SOLAR GARDEN MODEL PROJECT WILL ULTIMATELY REDUCE ENERGY BILL BURDENS ON RESIDENTS, REDUCE GHG EMISSIONS, CREATE PATHWAYS TO GREEN LOCAL JOBS, INCREASE CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND PROVIDE A STABLE, MULTI-DECADE FUNDING SOURCE TO PARTICIPATING MINNEAPOLIS NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS.
ACTIVITIES:
PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF AN OUTREACH STRATEGY TO SURVEY AND RECRUIT NORTHSIDE GREEN ZONE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS, YOUTH AND NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS; 2) WORKSHOPS ON CURRENT ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE, ENVIRONMENTAL RACISM AND HEALTH DISPARITIES IN THE NORTHSIDE GREEN ZONE, RENEWABLE ENERGY SOLUTIONS' POSITIVE HEALTH AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS AND GREEN JOB TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES; 3) FOUR DEMONSTRATION FIELD TRIPS TOURS OF NEARBY GREEN JOB TRAINING CENTER AND COMMUNITY SOLAR GARDENS.
OUTCOMES:
OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF RESIDENTS AND YOUTH WHO ARE AWARE OF CLIMATE HEALTH IMPACTS, RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES, AND RELATED JOB OPPORTUNITIES. OTHER OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMMUNITY WORKGROUP TO BEGIN PLANNING THE COMMUNITY SOLAR GARDEN MODEL AND AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF RESIDENTS THAT CHALLENGE CURRENT ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE TO RECLAIM COMMUNITY AGENCY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE NORTHSIDE GREEN ZONE NEIGHBORHOODS IN NORTH MINNEAPOLIS, MN.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE CLASSES DETAILING INFORMATION ON THE BIKESHARE SYSTEM, SAFE URBAN CYCLING PRACTICES, CURRENT BEST PRACTICES RELATED TO COVID-19, AND THE ROLE OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY IN REDUCING THE NEGATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTION. CAA 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. 
ACTIVITIES:
AFTER THE VIRTUAL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE GRANTEE WORKSHOPS BUBLR, THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN, AND THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE MEET TO DEVELOP DRAFT CURRICULUM FOR THE CLASSES, AS WELL AS ENTRANCE AND EXIT SURVEYS TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE CLASSES AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK FOR IMPROVING THE CLASSES IN FUTURE YEARS. THE CLASSES WILL BE 60-90 MINUTES IN LENGTH AND INCLUDE INFORMATION ON HOW TO USE THE BUBLR BIKESHARE SYSTEM, AN OVERVIEW OF THE BEST PRACTICES GOVERNING URBAN CYCLING, AND CURRENT BEST PRACTICES ON COVID-19.

OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTPUTS ARE THAT CLASS PARTICIPANTS UNDERSTAND HOW TO USE THE BUBLR BIKESHARE SYSTEM, FEEL MORE CONFIDENT CYCLING IN THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT, HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE CURRENT BEST COVID-19 PRACTICES, ARE AWARE OF THE ACCESS PASS PROGRAM, UNDERSTAND THE ROLE OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY IN REDUCING THE NEGATIVE HEALTH AND WELFARE IMPACTS OF AIR POLLUTION.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS IS AN AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT. UNION HOSPITAL FOUNDATION WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO EXPAND THE ALL BABIES HEALTHY HOMES INITIATIVE'S CLINICALLY INTEGRATED PERINATAL NAVIGATION PROGRAM TO INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ASSESSMENTS, EDUCATION, AND RESOURCES TO 150 UNDER-RESOURCED FAMILIES IN THE WABASH VALLEY COMMUNITY. THE PROGRAM WILL LEVERAGE THE EXISTING HOME-VISITING PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS TO PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ASSESSMENTS AND INTERVENTIONS TO REDUCE NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RISK FACTORS.
ACTIVITIES:
THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE HOME HEALTH HAZARD ASSESSMENTS FOR 150 UNDERSERVED FAMILIES THAT ARE PREGNANT AND/OR HAVE A CHILD LESS THAN 18 MONTHS OF AGE. THESE IN-HOME ASSESSMENTS AND INTERVENTIONS WILL FOCUS ON TRIGGERS OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESS AND CARBON MONOXIDE RISK. MORE SPECIFICALLY THE ELEMENTS OF THE ASSESSMENT WILL INCLUDE AN OCCUPANT INTERVIEW; VISUAL PAINT CONDITION ASSESSMENT; AND VISUAL EVIDENCE OF RISKS.
OUTCOMES:
THE UNION HOSPITAL FOUNDATION WILL PARTNER WITH THE LUGAR CENTER AND THEIR ALL BABIES HOME-VISITING PROGRAM TO TARGET 150 UNDER-SERVED FAMILIES IN THE WABASH VALLEY THAT ARE PREGNANT OR HAVE A CHILD LESS THAN 18 MONTHS OF AGE THAT ARE CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN THE ALL BABIES HOME VISITING PROGRAM AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TOOLS THROUGH HOME HEALTH HAZARD ASSESSMENTS/INTERVENTIONS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO DECREASE AIR POLLUTION, ENERGY BURDEN, AND UNEMPLOYMENT IN DETROIT'S EAST SIDE. THE GRANTEE WILL ADMINISTER THEIR COMMUNITY-DRIVEN ICAN PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. DESCRIPTION:
THIS PROJECT HAS THREE INTER-RELATED OBJECTIVES TO AID IN CAPACITY-BUILDING: DEVELOP A TECHNICAL REPORT SUMMARIZING EXISTING KNOWLEDGE FROM VARIOUS SOURCES ON ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION AFFECTING KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY; USE THE TECHNICAL REPORT TO INFORM AND CONDUCT AN ENVIRONMENTAL RISK ASSESSMENT; AND DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO DISTRIBUTE THE PROJECT FINDINGS. THE RESULTS FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON WHAT THEIR EXPOSURES AND RISKS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION MAY BE AND DEVELOP FUTURE COMMUNITY PLANNING. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE PROJECT HAS THREE MAIN ACTIVITIES. LITERATURE REVIEW AND DATABASE DEVELOPMENT - USING SYSTEMATIC REVIEW METHODOLOGIES, PEER-REVIEWED, GOVERNMENTAL, AND OTHER LITERATURE WILL BE SEARCHED FOR PUBLICATIONS INVOLVING POLLUTION IN ENVIRONMENTAL MEDIA RELEVANT TO KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY. RISK ASSESSMENT - FOLLOWING THE LITERATURE REVIEW AND DATA COMPILATION, A TIERED RISK ASSESSMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED FOLLOWING US EPA METHODS. COMMUNITY EDUCATION - KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY MEMBERS MAY NOT HAVE ACCESS TO SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE WHICH DOCUMENTS THE VARIOUS TYPES OF POLLUTION PRESENT IN KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY AND SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENTS.
OUTCOMES:
OUTPUTS INCLUDE 1 PUBLIC OUTREACH FORUM AND PRESENTATION OF FINAL REPORTS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUB-AWARD TO OAKLAND UNIVERSITY (AUBREY ARAIN) FOR LITERATURE REVIEW, DATABASE COMPILATION, ASSISTANCE IN RISK ASSESSMENT, AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION.

THE SYLVESTER BROOME EMPOWERMENT VILLAGE NUTRITION PROGRAM AIMS TO IDENTIFY AND UNDERSTAND HOW SOCIOECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND CULTURAL BARRIERS INTERPLAY WITH FOOD SELECTION AMONG FLINT, MICHIGAN RESIDENTS. THE HOURCAR, WILL GATHER INFORMATION FROM RESIDENTS IMPACTED NEIGHBORHOODS TO ENSURE OPTIMAL PLACEMENT OF CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND MITIGATE NEGATIVE EXTERNALITIES AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC AS TO THE BENEFITS OF THE NEW SERVICE TO ENSURE ROBUST UTILIZATION OF THE NEW SERVICE.

IN ADDITION, OVER 48% OF THE RESIDENTS IN NNN LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LINE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO CREATE THE VERMONT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (VT-EJ) NETWORK THAT WILL ACT AS AN EFFECTIVE PLATFORM TO INCREASE TRANSPARENCY FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT ON ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (EJ) ISSUES. THE PROPOSED NETWORK WILL HELP BUILD RESILIENCY IN EJ COMMUNITIES BY FORGING CONNECTIONS AMONG COMMUNITIES FACING A DISPROPORTIONATE SHARE OF ENVIRONMENTAL BURDENS, AND CREATE A COMMUNICATION PATHWAY AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS, COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND KEY DECISION MAKERS AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL. AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDING WILL BE USED TO FACILITATE ASSESSMENTS, SUPPORT RELATIONSHIP BUILDING, ENABLE STRUCTURAL DEVELOPMENT, AND COMPENSATE FRONTLINE PARTNERS FOR THEIR LEADERSHIP. THE VT-EJ NETWORK WILL BRIDGE OVERBURDENED COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH DECISION-MAKERS AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL, FOSTERING RELATIONSHIPS AND CREATING CONTINUITY BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND GOVERNMENT, INCREASING ACCESSIBILITY OF INFORMATION AND RESOURCES, AND SUPPORTING CONTEXT-SENSITIVE COMMUNICATION. LONG TERM, THE VT-EJ NETWORK WILL STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES' ABILITY TO EQUITABLY DISTRIBUTE ENVIRONMENTAL BURDENS AND BENEFITS. THE SUBRECIPIENT RIGHTS AND DEMOCRACY INSTITUTE WILL ENGAGE THEIR CHAPTERS ACROSS THE STATE TO INTRODUCE LOCAL LEADERS TO THE VT-EJ NETWORK AND DRIVE FORWARD POLICY WORK THROUGH THE VERMONT RENEWS COALITION. THE SUBRECIPIENT VERMONT LAW SCHOOL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CLINIC WILL WORK WITH VT-EJ NETWORK MEMBERS TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY LEGAL EDUCATION ON RELEVANT LEGAL AND REGULATORY PROCESSES, ANALYZE POLICY, AND OFFER COMMUNITY-DRIVEN RECOMMENDATIONS TO STATE AGENCIES.ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT REPRESENTS THE EARLY STAGES OF COLLABORATION TO BUILD THE VERMONT ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE (VT-EJ) NETWORK. AT THE START OF THIS PROJECT, PROJECT COLLABORATORS WILL CONDUCT AN INITIAL ASSESSMENT OF EXTERNAL PARTNERS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, AND PARTNERING STATE OFFICIALS' EXISTING NETWORKS. PROJECT PARTNERS WILL HOLD INITIAL COMMUNITY LIAISON RELATIONSHIP-BUILDING MEETINGS WITH EXTERNAL PARTNERS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, AND STATE OFFICIALS, TO FORMALIZE RELATIONSHIPS. THE CENTER FOR WHOLE COMMUNITIES WILL HOLD PROJECT PARTNER MEETINGS AT LEAST MONTHLY TO SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF THE NETWORK, BUILD RELATIONSHIPS, AND ADVANCE PROJECT GOALS. PROJECT PARTNERS, ALONG WITH NETWORK LIAISONS AND STEERING COMMITTEE MEMBERS WILL COLLABORATIVELY DESIGN AND CONVENE THE VT-EJ NETWORK. THE INITIAL PROPOSAL FOR NETWORK STRUCTURE WILL BE SHARED WITH EXTERNAL PARTNERS AND LIAISONS FOR REVIEW. THIS WORKING AGREEMENT ABOUT NETWORK STRUCTURE AND NORMS WILL BE REVIEWED AND REFINED IN AN ITERATIVE PROCESS. PROJECT COLLABORATORS WILL HOLD 3 COMMUNITY MEETINGS ON COMMUNITY ISSUES OF CONCERN. THREE OR MORE COMMUNITIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THESE NETWORK-CONVENED COMMUNITY SESSIONS, ENGAGING UPWARDS OF 150 INDIVIDUAL PARTICIPANTS. MEETING SUMMARIES WILL BE DEVELOPED AND SHARED FOLLOWING EACH MEETING. AT THE END OF THE PROJECT, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL CONDUCT A FOLLOW-UP NETWORK ASSESSMENT AND SHARE THESE FINDINGS WITH NETWORK LIAISONS, NETWORK MEMBERS, AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS.SUBRECIPIENT:RIGHTS AND DEMOCRACY INSTITUTE (RDI) WILL TAP INTO THEIR CHAPTERS ACROSS THE STATE TO INTRODUCE LOCAL LEADERS TO THE VT-EJ NETWORK AND DRIVE FORWARD POLICY WORK THROUGH THE VERMONT RENEWS COALITION. RDI'S PARTICIPATION IN THIS PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN THEIR ESTABLISHED RELATIONSHIPS, DIRECT THE ENERGY OF THEIR BASE, AND PROVIDE A PUBLIC PARTICIPATION FRAMEWORK FOR THEIR POLICY INITIATIVES. 

VERMONT LAW SCHOOL'S ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CLINIC (VLS-EJC) WILL WORK WITH VT-EJ NETWORK MEMBERS TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY LEGAL EDUCATION ON RELEVANT LEGAL AND REGULATORY PROCESSES, ANALYZE POLICY, AND OFFER COMMUNITY-DRIVEN RECOMMENDATIONS TO STATE AGENCIES. DEPENDING ON THE CAPACITY OF THEIR STUDENT CLINICIANS, THE CLINIC WILL TAKE ON CASES AND ISSUES ARISING OUT OF CONNECTIONS IN THE NETWORK.

DESCRIPTION:
IN ACCORDANCE WITH TSCA, SECTION 10, THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE REFUGEE LEAD SAFETY PROGRAM IS TO ADDRESS HOUSING SAFETY AND PREVENT LEAD POISONING AMONG REFUGEES IN RHODE ISLAND. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON INCREASING AWARENESS ABOUT LEAD SAFETY AND DECREASE THE INCIDENCE OF LEAD POISONING AMONG REFUGEES. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING PREVENTATIVE HOME VISITS AND PHONE CHECK- INS ON LEAD SAFETY WITH REFUGEE FAMILIES IN COLLABORATION WITH RELEVANT PARTNERS TO PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS AND THEIR FAMILIES WITH KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND RESOURCES ON HOUSING SAFETY AND LEAD POISONING, CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES AND HOSTING AND FACILITATING RI HOUSING SAFETY MEETINGS AND REFUGEE HOUSING ADVISORY NETWORK.
ACTIVITIES:
REFUGEE DEVELOPMENT CENTER PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE LEAD SAFETY-FOCUSED HOME VISITS ; CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES; HOSTING AND FACILITATING REFUGEE HOUSING ADVISORY NETWORK AND RI HOUSING SAFETY MEETINGS. 
OUTCOMES:
THE PROJECT SEEKS TO ACHIEVE INCREASED AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF HOUSING SAFETY AND LEAD POISONING, AN INCREASE IN LEAD-SAFE HOMES, AND REDUCTION IN INSTANCES OF LEAD POISONING AMONG REFUGEES IN RHODE ISLAND.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED GRANT IS TO INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF RESIDENTS' CURRENT EXPERIENCE OF EXTREME HEAT, HOUSING, AND FOOD INSECURITY IN EVERETT, MASSACHUSETTS, IN ORDER TO IMPLEMENT CLIMATE RESILIENCE EFFORTS AND ENSURE THAT POTENTIAL STRATEGIES TO COMBAT THESE ISSUES DO NOT INCREASE SOCIAL INEQUITIES, SUCH AS GENTRIFICATION AND DISPLACEMENT OF LOWER-INCOME AND WORKING-CLASS RESIDENTS. EVERETT HAD ONE OF THE HIGHEST RATES OF COVID INFECTION IN THE STATE, WITH ANALYSIS SHOWING THAT COMMUNITIES OF COLOR WERE PARTICULARLY HARD HIT, AND EVERETT RESIDENTS ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY POOR AIR QUALITY. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN THIS PROJECT AS AUTHORIZED UNDER CAA 103(B)(3), THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO: EXAMINE POLICIES, PLANS AND PROGRAMS THAT WERE ACTIVATED DURING THE PANDEMIC VIA MUNICIPAL AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS IN EVERETT THROUGH PARTICIPATORY RESEARCH; IDENTIFY IF STRATEGIES ARE ADAPTABLE OR CAN BE IMPROVED UPON FOR LONG-TERM CLIMATE RESILIENCE, WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON EXTREME HEAT AND HOUSING AND FOOD INSECURITY; AND DETERMINE RESIDENT-LED POLICY, SYSTEMS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE STRATEGIES TO COMBAT EXTREME HEAT AND HOUSING AND FOOD INSECURITY.ACTIVITIES:IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLEAN AIR ACT, SECTION 103(B)(3), THIS PROJECT WILL COLLECT DATA AND INFORMATION, CONDUCT A PUBLIC HEALTH ASSESSMENT, AND PROVIDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION TO EXPLORE CAUSES OF EXTREME HEAT AND AIR POLLUTION, HOUSING, AND FOOD INSECURITY, AND EXPLORE STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT LONG-TERM CLIMATE RESILIENCE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) LEADING A COMMUNITY PUBLIC HEALTH ASSESSMENT USING A PARTICIPATORY ACTION RESEARCH (PAR) MODEL FROM THE HEALTHY NEIGHBORHOODS STUDY (HNS) MENTORSHIP PROGRAM, INCLUDING RESEARCH AND TRAINING FOR RESIDENTS AND THE REVIEW OF EXISTING CLIMATE POLICIES; 2) FACILITATING 6 WORKSHOPS WITH THE GREATER BOSTON ANTI-DISPLACEMENT TOOLKIT TO ENGAGE OVER 30 COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN IDENTIFYING STRATEGIES TO COMBAT CLIMATE INTENSIFIED HEALTH RISKS RELATED TO EXTREME HEAT, HOUSING INSTABILITY AND FOOD INSECURITY; AND 3) IDENTIFYING AND PRESENTING 1-2 CLIMATE RESILIENCE STRATEGIES AND PUBLIC HEALTH ASSESSMENT FINDINGS TO A COHORT OF THREE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND AT LEAST 30 RESIDENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:TWO EVERETT-BASED ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE SUBAWARDS TO COMPLETE ELEMENTS OF THIS PROJECT. EVERETT COMMUNITY GROWERS (ECG), A COMMUNITY-BASED FOOD JUSTICE ORGANIZATION, WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND WILL HIRE A COMMUNITY ORGANIZER TO COORDINATE PROJECT ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. OTHER ECG STAFF, SUCH AS THE YOUTH CREW, WILL PARTICIPATE IN  TRAINING, ASSESSMENT, AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. ECG WILL ALSO PROVIDE IN-KIND PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT THROUGH THEIR PLANNING AND POLICY COORDINATOR AND DEVELOPMENT COORDINATOR. ECG WILL UTILIZE THEIR FARM AND COMMUNITY GARDENS AS COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT SPACE, TO EXEMPLIFY HOW GROWING SPACES COMBAT THE HEAT ISLAND EFFECT WHILE ALSO PROVIDING A SPACE TO GATHER, GROW, AND EXPERIENCE FOOD. ONE EVERETT (OE) IS A COALITION OF COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS (CBOS) AND RESIDENTS ORGANIZING FOR A COMMUNITY THAT VALUES, ACTS AND ADVOCATES FOR JUSTICE, TRANSPARENCY AND ACCOUNTABILITY, FIGHTING AGAINST SYSTEMIC RACISM AND XENOPHOBIA. MEMBERS OF OE WILL BE TRAINED TO LEAD THE ACTIVITIES OF THE ASSESSMENT AND ORGANIZE THE COMMUNITY AROUND THE PLANNED ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. MEMBERS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PARTICIPATING IN TRAINING, COMPLETING THE MODULES ADAPTED FROM THE GREATER BOSTON ANTI-DISPLACEMENT TOOLKIT AND SELECTING A PILOT STRATEGY AS AN OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CITY OF EVERETT, MASSACHUSETTS. EVERETT RESIDENTS ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY CORONAVIRUS (COVID) INFECTIONS AND POOR

DESCRIPTION:
THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE FACILITATION OF A RESIDENT-LED, MULTI-STAKEHOLDER TASK FORCE TO UNDERSTAND AND ANALYZE AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTED; TRANSLATE AND SHARE DATA OUT EASILY, ACCESSIBLY AND MULTILINGUALLY; COLLABORATE WITH AIR QUALITY EXPERTS, HEALTH INSTITUTIONS AND CITY PARTNERS TO BEST DETERMINE AIR FILTER DISTRIBUTION; DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ENSURE REGULAR AIR FILTER USE; AND LASTLY, IT WILL SUPPORT INFORMATION GATHERING TO DETERMINE IF THE FILTERS ARE IMPROVING HEALTH AND QUALITY OF LIFE AND IF THERE ARE POTENTIAL POLICY CHANGES THAT COULD LEAD TO LASTING AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS.  
ACTIVITIES:
GREENROOTS WILL IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE, INCLUSIVE AND REPLICABLE COMMUNITY-CENTERED AND DATA-DRIVEN AIR QUALITY CAMPAIGN. THE CAMPAIGN WILL FOCUS ON THREE MAJOR OBJECTIVES: 1) ANALYZING AIR QUALITY INFORMATION THROUGHOUT THE HIGHLY INDUSTRIAL, URBAN COMMUNITY; 2) SHARING OUT DATA IN A WAY THAT IS ACCESSIBLE TO ALL INCLUDING LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT INDIVIDUALS; AND 3) IMPLEMENTING INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES TO REDUCE THE IMPACT OF AIR POLLUTION ON ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE POPULATIONS, PARTICULARLY THOSE WITH RESPIRATORY AND CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE.
GREENROOTS WILL ENGAGE LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT RESIDENTS, ALLIES AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS
OUTCOMES:
GREENROOTS ANTICIPATES THE FOLLOWING LONG-TERM OUTCOMES FROM THE PROJECT WORK: COMMUNITY MEMBERS ARE INFORMED ABOUT DIRECT IMPACTS OF AIR QUALITY ON HEALTH AND HEALTH OUTCOMES (WITH LANGUAGE JUSTICE), AND EMPOWERED TO TAKE ACTION; PUBLIC ACCESS TO UNDERSTANDABLE AND ACCESSIBLE AIR QUALITY DATA IS STRENGTHENED (APP CREATION FOR REAL-TIME DATA ACCESS, RESEARCH COALESCED, FURTHER RESEARCH NEEDS IDENTIFIED); LASTING, WORKING, CROSS-SECTOR PARTNERSHIPS ARE DEVELOPED TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY NEEDS, INCLUDING RESIDENTS, ACADEMIC RESEARCHERS, DECISION-MAKERS: INDOOR AIR QUALITY WILL IMPROVE THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF GREENROOTS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WHICH
WILL RESULT IN THE INSTALLATION OF AIR PURIFIERS IN AT LEAST 200 HOMES IN CHELSEA AND MUNICIPAL AND /OR SCHOOL BUILDINGS.

THE PROJECT IS INTENDED TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE AIR QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH FOR THE RESIDENTS OF CHELSEA AND EAST BOSTON.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
REGIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL COUNCIL BASED IN WORCESTER, MA, IS A SMALL NON-PROFIT THAT AIMS TO INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY AND AFFORDABILITY OF HEALTHY FOOD FOR RESIDENTS OF WORCESTER'S LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS BY CREATING A MORE EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE REGIONAL FOOD SYSTEM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDED GRANT IS TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELFARE BY INCREASING PUBLIC EDUCATION AND BUILDING LOCAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE BY TRAINING URBAN GARDENERS IN BEST PRACTICES FOR URBAN FOOD GARDENING TECHNIQUES THAT PROMOTE CLIMATE RESILIENCE. THE PROJECT WILL EDUCATE AND TRAIN GROWERS AT APPROXIMATELY 60 COMMUNITY AND SCHOOL GARDEN SITES IN LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITIES OF COLOR TO ENGAGE IN HEALTHY SOIL AND BIO GROWTH PRACTICES THAT SEQUESTER CARBON AND WILL CREATE A NETWORK OF SKILLED COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT THIS PROJECT. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 MAY BE REDUCED.
ACTIVITIES:
THROUGH THIS PROJECT, THE REGIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL COUNCIL WILL PROMOTE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELFARE, RAISE AWARENESS, AND BUILD LOCAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE BY TRAINING LOCAL WORCESTER URBAN FOOD GARDENERS IN CLIMATE RESILIENT GROWING TECHNIQUES, INCLUDING CARBON SEQUESTRATION. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY THE CLEAN AIR ACT, SECTION 103(B)(3) BY CONDUCTING PUBLIC EDUCATION AND TRAINING ON AIR POLLUTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL THROUGH URBAN GARDENS. THE PROJECT WILL TRAIN LOCAL GROWERS TO ENGAGE IN HEALTHY SOIL AND BIO-GROWTH PRACTICES THAT SEQUESTER CARBON AND PROMOTE CLIMATE RESILIENCE. THE PROJECT INCLUDES ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY THE CLEAN WATER ACT, SECTION 104(A)(1) BY CONDUCTING AND PROMOTING PUBLIC EDUCATION AND TRAININGS THAT REDUCE WATER POLLUTION THROUGH PLANT AND SOIL FILTRATION IN GREEN SPACES.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MULTIPLE BENEFITS TO THE COMMUNITY. COMMUNITY GARDENERS WILL LEARN EFFICIENT WATER USE, PESTICIDE ALTERNATIVES, AND SOIL HEALTH/CARBON SEQUESTRATION THAT ARE CRITICAL FOR CLIMATE RESISTANT URBAN GARDENING. PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE EDUCATION AND TRAINING VIA WORKSHOPS AND WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PUT NEW CLIMATE RESILIENT GROWING TECHNIQUES INTO PRACTICE. GRASSROOTS COMMUNITY GARDEN VOLUNTEERS AND PROJECT STAFF WILL DEVELOP AND STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS WITH KEY PARTNERS WORKING TOWARDS SIMILAR CLIMATE GOALS AND BUILD NETWORK CAPACITY AND IMPACT BY INTRODUCING A NEW GARDEN VOLUNTEER CORPS PROGRAM. FIVE DEMONSTRATION SITE GARDENS WILL RECEIVE INTENSIVE TECHNICAL SUPPORT AND RESOURCES TO MAKE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE GARDEN VOLUNTEER CORPS TO INCREASE WATER CONSERVATION AND REDUCE STORMWATER RUNOFF, AND TO IMPLEMENT ORGANIC GROWING AND CARBON SEQUESTRATION TECHNIQUES INCLUDING LOW OR NO-TILL GROWING AND USE OF COVER CROPS. THESE INNOVATIONS WILL INCREASE CLIMATE RESILIENCY OF THE GARDENS AND HELP THEM SERVE AS EDUCATIONAL SITES FOR OTHER GROWERS IN THE NETWORK. IN SUMMARY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE RESIDENTS OF WORCESTER'S LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES WITH VITAL EDUCATION, SKILL-BUILDING, RESOURCES, AND INCLUSION IN LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE PROCESSES, HELPING RESIDENTS OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE NEIGHBORHOODS BECOME CHANGE AGENTS ON THEIR OWN BEHALF AND TAKE IMPORTANT STEPS TOWARD IMPROVING THE CLIMATE RESILIENCE OF THEIR COMMUNITIES WHILE BEGINNING TO ADDRESS SOME OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL INEQUITIES THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS HAVE ENDURED.
OUTCOMES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT 10 EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS ON TOPICS IDENTIFIED BY GRASSROOTS COMMUNITY GARDENERS AS PRIORITY SKILL-BUILDING AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. THESE WORKSHOPS WILL FOCUS ON STRATEGIES THAT URBAN GROWERS CAN USE TO INCREASE CLIMATE RESILIENCE, WITH A TARGET OF A MINIMUM 100 ATTENDEES FOR THE SERIES. WORKSHOPS WILL BE PRESENTED IN AN ACC

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) FUNDED GRANT IS TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND DIALOGUE SURROUNDING INEQUITABLE TREE CANOPY COVER AND ITS IMPLICATIONS ON THE HEALTH OF RESIDENTS LIVING IN BOSTON, MASSACHUSETTS, AS AUTHORIZED UNDER CLEAN AIR ACT 103(B)(3). TREES PROVIDE NUMEROUS ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS AND CAN MITIGATE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH BURDENS FACED BY COMMUNITIES WITH LOW TREE CANOPY COVERAGE. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE BOSTON'S URBAN TREE CANOPY IN LOW-CANOPY  NEIGHBORHOODS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS BY RAISING COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND ENGAGEMENT, LEADING TO IMPROVED AIR QUALITY AND IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH THROUGH REDUCTION IN ASTHMA RATES AND/OR HEART DISEASE. THE PROJECT WILL BE CONDUCTED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND NONPROFITS WHO WILL CO-DEVELOP A SERIES OF COMMUNITY TREE WALKS IN THREE NEIGHBORHOODS FOR RESIDENTS, MUNICIPAL OFFICIALS, AND RESEARCHERS TO EXPLORE AND DEEPEN THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE INTERSECTIONS OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, CLEAN AIR, AND TREE CANOPY COVER. THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND COLLECTION OF FEEDBACK, STORIES, AND EXPERIENCES, THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP SHARED VISIONS FOR AN URBAN FOREST THAT PROVIDES PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS.ACTIVITIES:IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLEAN AIR ACT, SECTION 103(B)(3), THIS PROJECT WILL USE SURVEYS, RESEARCH AND EDUCATION TO EXPLORE THE CAUSES AND FUTURE PREVENTION OF AIR POLLUTION THROUGH THE EXPANSION OF URBAN TREE CANOPY. PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) COLLECTING SURVEYS ABOUT RESIDENTS' EXPERIENCES WITH ISSUES INCLUDING TREE INEQUITY, ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH; 2) HOLDING ONE-ON-ONE INTERVIEWS WITH RESIDENTS AND GATHERING THEIR PERSONAL STORIES ABOUT LIVED EXPERIENCES REGARDING TREE INEQUITY AND AIR QUALITY; AND 3) CREATING COMMUNITY WALKS TO EDUCATE ADDITIONAL RESIDENTS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF URBAN TREES. 

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND TREE WALKS IN THREE BOSTON NEIGHBORHOODS THAT FACE INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH BURDENS FROM POLLUTED AIR, LESS GREENSPACE, AND LOW TREE CANOPY COVERAGE. SPEAK FOR THE TREES WILL COLLABORATE WITH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS TO 1) PREPARE COMMUNITY SURVEYS AND OUTREACH MATERIALS; 2) ENGAGE WITH RESIDENTS THROUGH SURVEYS, INTERVIEWS, AND PRESENTATIONS ABOUT TREE EQUITY AT THREE OR MORE COMMUNITY MEETINGS IN TARGET NEIGHBORHOODS; 3) CREATE MAPS AND EDUCATIONAL CONTENT FOR COMMUNITY TREE WALKS BASED ON SURVEY RESPONSES AND AMERICAN FORESTS' TREE EQUITY SCORE ANALYZER; 4) CONDUCT SIX COMMUNITY TREE WALKS FOR PUBLIC AWARENESS AND INCREASING KNOWLEDGE ABOUT AIR POLLUTION AND THE ROLE OF TREE CANOPY; AND 5) SHARING OF 'ARTIFACTS,' EITHER DIGITAL OR PRINT, CREATED BY EACH NEIGHBORHOOD TO SHARE RESULTS.SUBRECIPIENT:THREE NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WILL RECEIVE SUBAWARDS TO PROVIDE CONSULTATION AND PARTNERSHIP ON COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND OUTREACH. EACH NEIGHBORHOOD GROUP WILL CO-DEVELOP THE COMMUNITY TREE WALKS, HOST NEIGHBORHOOD MEETINGS, ADVERTISE THE PROJECT TO RESIDENTS, AND ASSIST WITH EVENT PLANNING. EACH GROUP WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING A MINIMUM OF 20 RESIDENTS ATTEND MEETINGS, THAT ATTENDEES FILL OUT IN-MEETING EVALUATION AND FEEDBACK FORMS, AND THAT 60 RESIDENTS IN TOTAL ATTEND EACH COMMUNITY'S WALKS.

EMVISION AND EVERYDAY BOSTON WILL ASSIST WITH IN-MEETING EVALUATION DESIGN, DEVELOP AND CARRY OUT INTERVIEWS, AND CAPTURE AND CURATE VIDEOS OF RESIDENTS' STORIES AND THE COMMUNITY TREE WALKS. EVERYDAY BOSTON, A LOCAL GRASSROOTS NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT CONNECTS NEIGHBORHOODS THROUGH THE SHARING OF STORIES WILL PROVIDE AND CAPTURE RESIDENT INTERVIEWS. PER YOUR APPLICATION REQUEST DATED MARCH 7, 2020, THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO SUPPORT GROUNDWORK LAWRENCE WITH THEIR GROUNDWORK SOUTH COAST'S TEAM TO BUILD COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE RESILIENCY BY FOCUSING ON: (1) DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS THAT RESULTS IN RESTORING HABITAT AREAS AND FOOD ACCESS WITHIN DEGRADED RIVERFRONT SITES; (2) PARTICIPATION IN THE EMERGENCY RESILIENCY AND PREPAREDNESS PLANNING OF NEW BEDFORD THROUGH BUILDING COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP IN THE ACUSHNET AVENUE NEIGHBORHOOD; (3) ENGAGE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE RESIDENTS IN DECISION-MAKING THROUGH ENGAGEMENT IN ACTIVITIES AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES CONNECTED TO BOTH DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS AND RESILIENCY PLANNING.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT TESTING OF DRINKING WATER QUALITY ON THE PASSAMAQUODDY TRIBE OF PLEASANT POINT RESERVATION, AND TO INCREASE COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND INVOLVEMENT RELATING TO DRINKING WATER EDUCATION. OUTPUTS INCLUDE A COMMUNITY DRINKING WATER REPORT, AS WELL AS INSTALLING AN EASILY ACCESSIBLE WATER PURIFICATION STATION FOR THE COMMUNITY TO USE. OVERALL, THE PROJECT WILL EMPOWER PLEASANT POINT RESERVATION COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN UNDERSTANDING THEIR DRINKING WATER ISSUES. WITH THE DATA COLLECTED FROM DRINKING WATER QUALITY TESTING, THE COMMUNITY CAN COLLECTIVELY DISCUSS AND DETERMINE AN ACTION PLAN AS IT PERTAINS TO THEIR DRINKING WATER.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT DATA ON MERCURY CONCENTRATIONS IN FISH AND CRAYFISH FROM LAKES SUBJECT TO PENOBSCOT INDIAN NATION SUSTENANCE FISHING RIGHTS.  OUTPUTS INCLUDE THE CREATION OF A TRIBAL MERCURY ADVISORY COUNCIL, THE COLLECTION AND MERCURY ANALYSIS OF FISH SPECIES, AND PROVIDING TRIBAL COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON THE FINDINGS OF MERCURY CONCENTRATIONS IN FISH AND CRAYFISH.  OVERALL, THE PROJECT WILL DOCUMENT THE VARIABILITY OF MERCURY CONCENTRATIONS IN FISH AND CRAYFISH IN TRIBAL PONDS AND LAKES AND INFORM THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY AND INFLUENCE BEHAVIOR TO MINIMIZE MERCURY EXPOSURE DURING SUSTENANCE FISHING.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT AGREEMENT IS TO USE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) APPROPRIATIONS TO PARTNER WITH THE YALE UNIVERSITY URBAN DESIGN WORKGROUP TO CONDUCT A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND PLANNING PROCESS TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY AND URBAN HEAT ISLAND ISSUES IMPACTING LOCAL RESIDENTS. THE PROJECT, CONDUCTED BY THE GREATER DWIGHT DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, BASED IN NEW HAVEN, CT, WILL DEVELOP RESEARCH ON LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, INCLUDING AIR QUALITY MONITORING; AND DEVELOP A WEB-BASED NEIGHBORHOOD PLANNING DOCUMENT, INCLUDING A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS), REAL-TIME DASHBOARD OF AIR QUALITY IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD FOR USE BY LOCAL RESIDENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE RESIDENT UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES, IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND GREEN SPACE FROM ADDED TREES, PLANTS, AND SHADE; AND EXPAND SOCIALIZATION OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH ACTIVITIES WITH OTHER RESIDENTS, FAMILIES, AND NEIGHBORS. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) 103(B)(3): PEOPLE WITH MODERATE-TO-SEVERE OR UNCONTROLLED ASTHMA ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE HOSPITALIZED FROM COVID-19. AIR POLLUTION MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ASTHMA. BY ADDRESSING AIR POLLUTION IN CAA 103(B)(3) PROJECTS, THE CHANCES OF SEVERE ILLNESS FROM COVID-19 ARE REDUCED.
ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT HAS THREE COMPONENTS: TO RESEARCH AND DOCUMENT URBAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD WHICH IMPACT RESIDENT HEALTH, CONTRIBUTING TO A COMPREHENSIVE UNDERSTANDING OF UNDERLYING ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, INCLUDING EXPANDING A NEIGHBORHOOD SCALE AIR QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK TO PROVIDE A NEW, COMMUNITY-OWNED DATASET THAT WILL BE USED FOR ONGOING AND FUTURE PLANNING EFFORTS; TO ENGAGE AND INFORM NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS IN A PLANNING PROCESS THAT CREATES LEARNING FOR PLANNERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH A SERIES OF OPEN CHARRETTE-STYLE ACTIVITIES, OPEN HOUSES, WALKING TOURS, A SCAVENGER HUNT, AND MEETINGS FOCUSED ON HEALTH AND THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT, INCLUDING A YOUTH EDUCATION COMPONENT TO DEVELOP AN ACTIONABLE NEIGHBORHOOD PLAN WITH PRIORITIES THAT GUIDES FUTURE ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: CONDUCTING SIX PLANNING SESSIONS, PURCHASING AND INSTALLING SEVEN AIR MONITORS, COLLECTING AIR QUALITY DATA, CONDUCTING RESEARCH TO DEVELOP AN ENVIRONMENTAL HISTORY OF THE GREATER DWIGHT NEIGHBORHOOD, CREATE A NEW WEBSITE, AND POST AIR QUALITY DATA AND ANALYSIS OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD STUDY TO THE NEW WEBSITE TO EDUCATE LOCAL RESIDENTS. SUBRECIPIENT:A SUB AWARD TO YALE UNIVERSITY URBAN DESIGN WORKSHOP TO COLLECT AIR MONITORING DATA, ANALYZE TRENDS, AND PUBLISH THEIR STUDY ON A NEW WEBSITE.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE (1) INCREASED UNDERSTANDING AND KNOWLEDGE ON AMBIENT AIR QUALITY ISSUES TO 20 COMMUNITY LEADERS AND 250 COMMUNITY MEMBERS; (2) IDENTIFYING DETERMINANTS OF A HEALTHY NEIGHBORHOOD; (3) PROVIDING A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AS THEY RELATE TO IMPROVING PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT; (4) RAISING AWARENESS WITHIN NEIGHBORHOOD, MUNICIPAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS ABOUT OPPORTUNITIES IN GREATER DWIGHT TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY; (5) IDENTIFY HOW URBAN FORM AND USE IMPACTS HEALTH, EMPOWERING NEIGHBORHOOD ADVOCACY; AND (6) IDENTIFY FUTURE PROJECTS INCLUDING TREE CANOPY AND IMPROVING BOTH OPEN SPACE AND PEDESTRIAN INFRASTRUCTURE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE FAMILIES AND LOCAL RESIDENTS LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY NEIGHBORHOOD OF GREATER DWIGHT, WITHIN NEW HAVEN, CONNECTICUT. AN INVOLVED AND EDUCATED COMMUNITY IS BETTER EQUIPPED TO PARTICIPATE IN EFFORTS TO PROTECT THEMSELVES AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP FUNDED GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE NEW HAVEN ECOLOGY PROJECT'S EATING AND GROWING EQUITABLY PROJECT. THROUGH THIS EFFORT NEW HAVEN RESIDENTS WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND BE INSPIRED TO GROW FOOD LOCALLY AND BUILD THE CITY'S CAPACITY TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH. NHEP'S PROJECT AIMS TO CREATE SPACES FOR COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE SHARING THAT AMPLIFY LOCAL EXPERTS AND YOUTH VOICES REGARDING CLIMATE FRIENDLY FOOD BY UTILIZING ITS FARM TO CREATE AN INTENSIVE LEARNING EXPERIENCE FOR SUMMER FARM INTERNS AND A GREEN JOBS CORPS CREW. THE ORGANIZATION FOCUSES ON LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP, INVITING PEOPLE ACROSS AGES AND IDENTITIES TO CONNECT TO THEIR URBAN ENVIRONMENT, BUILD COMMUNITY, GROW INTO THEIR FULL POTENTIAL, AND CONTRIBUTE TO A JUST AND SUSTAINABLE ROLE. THROUGH AN ESTABLISHED NETWORK OF CONNECTIONS IN NEW HAVEN, THE NEW HAVEN ECOLOGY PROJECT WILL ENGAGE APPROXIMATELY 175 PEOPLE FOR AN ANNUAL CONFERENCE AND FIVE SMALLER WORKSHOPS, INCLUDING YOUTH WORKSHOPS. EATING  AND  GROWING EQUITABLY WILL BUILD AWARENESS  AND  SKILL AROUND SEED SAVING, COMPOSTING, AND BLACK AND BROWN FARMING TECHNOLOGIES AND RESULT IN MORE FOOD BEING PRODUCED IN EJ NEIGHBORHOODS BY THE NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS, REDUCED FOOD TRANSPORTATION MILES AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY. THIS PROJECT CAN BE FUNDED UNDER SECTION 103(B) OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE AN INTENSIVE FARM-BASED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM . THE FARM AND GARDEN SERIES CONSISTS OF ONE MAIN WINTER CONFERENCE, AND FIVE INDIVIDUAL WORKSHOPS FOR TARGETED AUDIENCES; FARM INTERNSHIPS FOR YOUNG ADULTS AND JOBS CORPS FARM CREW PLACEMENTS FOR COMMON GROUND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS.
OUTCOMES:THE EATING AND GROWING EQUITABLY: GROWING FOOD, IMPROVING HEALTH, CLEANING URBAN AIR PROJECT WILL HELP INCREASE LOCAL FOOD PRODUCTION AND CONSUMPTION IN LOW INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS THAT ARE FOOD DESERTS, REDUCING FOOD TRANSPORTATION MILES AND THUS EMISSIONS.
